text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. Whenever the Corp draws 1 or more cards, he or she loses 1[credit] if it is not the first time he or she has drawn cards this turn.
name: System Outage

text: Once per turn, when you encounter a piece of ice, you may trash 1 card from your grip. If you do, that ice has -2 strength for the remainder of this run.
name: Null: Whistleblower

flavor: Sometimes the itsy-bitsy data is most important.
text: Whenever you approach a piece of ice, you may expose it. You may then trash GPI Net Tap to jack out.
name: GPI Net Tap

flavor: "Take it from me, there is a point where you have so much money you stop caring. That's usually right before it all comes tumbling down."
text: If the Corp has at least 10[credit], as an additional cost to rez each piece of ice, the Corp must spend credits equal to the number of subroutines on that ice.
name: Hernando Cortez

text: +2[mu] Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, you may replace 1 spent recurring credit. Limit 1 console per player.
name: Mirror

flavor: In running, as in reality, all elements are connected.
text: 2[credit]: Break all subroutines. Use this ability only by spending credits from stealth cards. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
name: Dai V

text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. Whenever you steal an agenda, force the Corp to "Trace 0 If unsuccessful, the Runner gains credits equal to the number of agenda points in both players' score areas."
name: Another Day, Another Paycheck

flavor: <champion>Designed by 2014 World Champion Dan D'Argenio</champion>
text:
Resolve two of the following in any order:
  • Gain 3[credit].
  • Draw 2 cards.
  • Remove 1 tag.
  • Expose 1 piece of ice, then make a run.
name: Deuces Wild

flavor: They call it "running" because jacking in is mentally and physically exhausting.
text: Make a run and choose an icebreaker. That icebreaker has +2 strength for the remainder of this run.
name: Injection Attack

flavor: I foresee the end of all things...
text:
The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Fairchild 1.0.
[subroutine]The Runner must pay 1[credit] or trash 1 of his or her installed cards.
[subroutine]The Runner must pay 1[credit] or trash 1 of his or her installed cards.
name: Fairchild 1.0

text:
The Runner can spend [click][click] to break up to 2 subroutines on Sherlock 2.0.
[subroutine]<trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, add 1 installed program to the bottom of the Runner's stack.
[subroutine]<trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, add 1 installed program to the bottom of the Runner's stack.
[subroutine]Give the Runner 1 tag.
name: Sherlock 2.0

flavor: "I'm telling you, free up the emergency accounts. Something's coming; I haven't seen a reaction like that since the tsunami. My god, the screaming..."
text: The first time each turn you reveal secretly spent credits, gain that many credits.
name: Hyoubu Research Facility

text:
If Chrysalis is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Chrysalis, he or she encounters it. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses Chrysalis from Archives.
[subroutine] Do 2 net damage.
name: Chrysalis

flavor: "Your mistake is thinking that it's just business, when really it's a war."
text:
Whenever the Runner makes an unsuccessful run on this server, do 1 net damage.
2[credit]: Move Georgia Emelyov to another server.
name: Georgia Emelyov

flavor: "Person of interest. Noun. Someone who is about to get ****ed by a corp." - Anarch's Dictionary, Volume Who's Counting
text: The rez cost of the first piece of ice you rez each turn is lowered by 1 for each tag the Runner has.
name: Watchdog

text:
After you resolve this operation, end your action phase.
Play only if the Runner made a run during his or her last turn.
<trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, give the Runner 4 tags.
name: Hard-Hitting News

text: The first time the Runner trashes an installed Corp card each turn, you may <trace>trace 4</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag (cannot be avoided).
name: NBN: Controlling the Message

flavor: "For the duration of the emergency" is code for "this is the way things are now."
text: If the Runner is tagged, Crisis Management gains "When your turn begins, do 1 meat damage."
name: Crisis Management

flavor: A stock dropping sharply is bad for shareholders, but not neccessarily bad for the company.
text:
After you resolve this operation, end your action phase.
Gain 3[credit] for each agenda in the Runner's score area.
name: Stock Buy-Back

flavor: Money is power.
text: If you have at least 10[credit], each piece of ice has +1 strength for every 5[credit] in your credit pool.
name: Sandburg

flavor: "Saved my bacon more than once, but gives a wicked sense of déjà vu." -Whizzard
text: [trash]: Prevent a trace. That trace initiates again with a base trace strength of 0.
name: Disrupter

flavor: It always strikes twice.
text: 2[credit]: Break up to 2 code gate subroutines. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
name: Force of Nature

flavor: "They're mindless tools of destruction, good for little else. Nice guys, though. Some of my best friends are scrubbers." -Ji "Noise" Reilly
text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to trash cards.
name: Scrubber

flavor: Twice the fun.
text: +1[mu] Once per turn, you may immediately make another run when a successful run ends. Limit 1 console per player.
name: Doppelgänger

flavor: Cyberspace's strongest glue.
text: [trash]: Derez a piece of ice. Use this ability only after breaking all the subroutines of that ice during a single encounter.
name: Crescentus

flavor: Didn't see that coming.
text: [trash]: Break any number of AP subroutines. [trash]: Prevent any amount of net damage.
name: Deus X

flavor: "I don't care what the studies show. From my experience, I can ingest three cans of Diesel an hour for up to twelve hours before going into cardiac arrest." -heard during the eleventh hour
text: [click], [trash]: Gain [click][click].
name: All-nighter

flavor: Few corporate employees have such wide-sweeping security clearance as the janitorial staff. Most corps foolishly think they're too dim-witted to take advantage of it.
text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to install hardware.
name: Inside Man

flavor: "My boss rewards quality work. If you know what's good for you, you'll keep it up."
text: When your turn begins, gain 1[credit] if you have at least 2[link].
name: Underworld Contact

flavor: Green-two clearance is the highest level of security a corp can gain access to. Legally, anyway.
text: Gain 3[credit] and draw 1 card.
name: Green Level Clearance

flavor: Time just slips away.
text:
[subroutine] The Runner loses [click], if able.
[subroutine] The Runner loses [click], if able.
[subroutine] The Runner loses [click], if able.
name: Hourglass

flavor:
so very still, even
cherry blossoms are not stirred
by the temple bell
-Fuhaku
text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to rez ice.
name: Dedicated Server

text: [subroutine] You and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit] or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, move Bullfrog so that it is the outermost piece of ice protecting another server (the Runner continues the run from this new position and is now running on this new server).
name: Bullfrog

flavor: Where one thing ends, another begins.
text:
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, the Runner cannot make another run this turn.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, end the run.
name: Uroboros

flavor: This is the net. We work here. We're cops.
text:
X[recurring-credit]
Use these credits during traces. X is the number of links the Runner has.
name: Net Police

flavor: Constructing Cyberspace.
text:
1[recurring-credit]
Use this credit to advance ice.
name: Weyland Consortium: Because We Built It

flavor: It's really hard to lose a government contract.
text: [click], [click]: Gain 4[credit].
name: Government Contracts

flavor: Thou shall not pass.
text: Tyrant can be advanced only while rezzed and gains "[subroutine] End the run." for each advancement token on it.
name: Tyrant

text: Rez a piece of ice, ignoring all costs, and install Oversight AI on that ice as a hosted condition counter with the text "Trash host ice if all its subroutines are broken during a single encounter."
name: Oversight AI

flavor: It didn't look like the headquarters of a multi-billion cred company. Probably because it wasn't.
text: Forfeit False Lead: The Runner loses [click][click], if able.
name: False Lead

flavor: "'What does it do?' Whatever I bloody want it to do." -Director Haas
text: When you score Bifrost Array, you may trigger the "when scored" ability of another agenda that is not a copy of Bifrost Array in your score area.
name: Bifrost Array

flavor: Sagittarius promised foresight, but brought only regret.
text: [subroutine] <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, trash 1 program. If your trace strength is 5 or greater, trash 1 program.
name: Sagittarius

flavor: "If thou only knowest what it is to conquer, and knowest not what it is to be defeated; woe unto thee…" -Tokugawa Ieyasu
text: Whenever the Runner trashes a Corp card (including Hostile Infrastructure), do 1 net damage.
name: Hostile Infrastructure

flavor: Gemini promised pleasure, but dealt only pain.
text: [subroutine] <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, do 1 net damage. If your trace strength is 5 or greater, do 1 net damage.
name: Gemini

flavor: "We've received seventeen crates from ChiLo. We'll hit stores the same day we sign the license agreement."
text: When you score License Acquisition, install and rez an asset or upgrade from Archives or HQ, ignoring all costs.
name: License Acquisition

flavor: "A new investment deal every morning! Grab the bull by the horns and take control of your future!"
text: The first time you draw a card each turn, draw 1 additional card. Add 1 of the drawn cards to the bottom of R&D.
name: Daily Business Show

flavor: "Our new barriers will be built on the rubble of our enemies".
text: All barrier ice have +1 strength. When you score Superior Cyberwalls, gain 1[credit] for each rezzed barrier.
name: Superior Cyberwalls

flavor: "Do it again, but this time I want to see you to enunciate less. Maybe let some spittle fly."
text:
When your turn begins, you may rez a card, lowering the rez cost by 1[credit].
1[credit],[trash]: Search R&D for an asset, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
name: Executive Boot Camp

flavor: "It's weird. I hit the server again and it was like a totally different piece of ice was waiting for me. Lost my root daemon. I shouldn't have nested them seven deep."
text: Lycan can be advanced. While Lycan has an odd number of advancement tokens on it, it gains code gate and loses sentry. [subroutine] Trash 1 program.
name: Lycan

flavor: The last thing he saw was the tattoo of a strange beast on his captor's neck. It had a goat's head, the body of a lion, and the tail of a serpent. Then the bag was yanked over his head, and there was only darkness.
text: Trace 3 If successful, trash 1 connection. The Runner can take 1 tag to prevent this.
name: Snatch and Grab

flavor: He who holds the staff of wisdom.
text: When the Runner encounters Merlin, you may reveal up to 2 grail ice from HQ. For the remainder of this run, Merlin gains the subroutines of the revealed ice in the order of your choice. [subroutine] Do 2 net damage.
name: Merlin

text:
You cannot use Shell Corporation more than once per turn.
[click]: Place 3[credit] on Shell Corporation.
[click]: Take all credits from Shell Corporation.
name: Shell Corporation

flavor: "Sometimes you just need a brain in a jar." -g00ru
text: Your memory limit is equal to the number of cards in your grip. Limit 1 console per player.
name: Ekomind

flavor: "He only likes to eat live meat." -MaxX
text: Place 4 power counters on Cerberus "Cuj.0" H3 when it is installed. Hosted power counter: Break up to 2 sentry subroutines. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
name: Cerberus "Cuj.0" H3

flavor: "I'd say I do it for the challenge, but the truth is it's not that hard."
text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, add 1 unrezzed card to HQ.
name: Leela Patel: Trained Pragmatist

flavor: "Useful for fetching all sorts of things…but you better have a treat ready if he likes it." -Iain Stirling
text: Place 4 power counters on Cerberus "Rex" H2 when it is installed. Hosted power counter: Break up to 2 code gate subroutines. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
name: Cerberus "Rex" H2

flavor: "They'll deliver anything to anywhere. Make sure to request air holes if you're shipping someone important, though."
text:
Place 1[credit] on Zona Sul Shipping when your turn begins.
[click]: Take all credits from Zona Sul Shipping.
Trash Zona Sul Shipping if you are tagged.
name: Zona Sul Shipping

flavor: Cybsoft started by designing games. Eventually they just redesigned the same game each year, and to combat piracy created a dedicated machine to play it. Profits grew ten-fold.
text:
1[recurring-credit]
Use this credit to install programs.
name: Cybsoft MacroDrive

flavor: "Its bytes are definitely worse than its bark." -Chaos Theory
text: Place 4 power counters on Cerberus "Lady" H1 when it is installed. Hosted power counter: Break up to 2 barrier subroutines. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
name: Cerberus "Lady" H1

text:
Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, instead of accessing cards, you may install Utopia Shard from your grip, ignoring all costs.
[trash]: The Corp discards 2 cards from HQ at random.
Limit 1 per deck.
name: Utopia Shard

flavor: Jarogniew's agent provocateur.
text: The first time you make a successful run on Archives each turn, the Corp must trash 1 card from HQ.
name: Alice Merchant: Clan Agitator

text: When you install Jarogniew Mercs, take 1 tag. Place 3 power counters on Jarogniew Mercs, and 1 additional power counter for each tag you have. When there are no power counters left on Jarogniew Mercs, trash it. The Corp cannot trash Jarogniew Mercs while there is another resource installed. Hosted power counter: Prevent 1 meat damage.
name: Jarogniew Mercs

text: +2[mu] X[recurring-credit] Use these credits during runs on HQ. X is the number of pieces of ice protecting HQ. Limit 1 console per player.
name: Māui

flavor: Everything you need in case of an emergency.
text:
Place X power counters on Bug Out Bag when you install it. If you have no cards in your grip at the end of your turn, draw 1 card for each power counter on Bug Out Bag, then trash it.
<errata>Errata from CR 1.2</errata>
name: Bug Out Bag

flavor: "I don't bother asking why anymore—he never says—but if I had to guess, it's because he's embezzling and using my runs to disguise it. Not that I care. His credit spends as well as the next guy's" -Moth
text: The first time you derez a piece of ice each turn, gain 2[credit].
name: Keros Mcintyre

flavor: "Taking risks is what makes it fun!" -Kabonesa Wu
text: +2[mu] The first time you initiate a run on a server protected by 2 or more pieces of ice each turn, draw 2 cards. Limit 1 console per player.
name: Daredevil

text: Whenever you use Mass-Driver to break all subroutines on a piece of ice during a single encounter, the first 3 subroutines on the next piece of ice you encounter this run do not resolve. 2[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
name: Mass-Driver

text: Whenever the Runner trashes 1 or more cards in or protecting this server (including Warroid Tracker), <trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, the Runner must trash 2 of his or her installed cards.
name: Warroid Tracker

text:
When the Runner encounters Loki, choose another rezzed piece of ice. Until the end of the run, Loki gains the subtypes of that ice and the subroutines of that ice before all Loki's other subroutines.
[subroutine] End the run unless the Runner shuffles his or her grip into the stack.
name: Loki

flavor: "Proper application of stress can create the most profound changes." - Tennin Institute Intern Brief
text: As an additional cost to steal Obokata Protocol, the Runner must suffer 4 net damage.
name: Obokata Protocol

text:
If the Runner breaks the printed subroutine on Mirāju, he or she is now running on Archives instead of passing Mirāju and approaches the outermost ice, if any. Derez Mirāju.
[subroutine] The Corp may draw 1 card. Then, shuffle 1 card from HQ into R&D.
name: Mirāju

text:
Play only if the Runner did not make a successful run during his or her last turn.
Place 2 advancement tokens on 1 card.
name: Shipment from Tennin

flavor: "Of course words hurt." -Bex Gleeson
text: [click]: Gain 1[credit] for each tag the Runner has. Use this ability only once per turn.
name: Escalate Vitriol

text: When you score Reeducation, add any number of cards from HQ to the bottom of R&D and draw that many cards. The Runner randomly adds the same number of cards from his or her grip to the bottom of the stack, if able.
name: Reeducation

flavor: "It's all about M.E. Monetizing Everything." -Eryn Nielle
text: Whenever you rez a piece of ice protecting this server, <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, the Corp gains 1[credit].
name: Traffic Analyzer

flavor: "I've got a rock!" - Charles "Mad Dog" Brun, Comet Jockey
text: When you score Meteor Mining, you may gain 7[credit]. If the Runner has at least 2 tags, you may do 7 meat damage instead.
name: Meteor Mining

text:
When you score Standoff, each player, starting with the Runner, trashes 1 of his or her installed cards until 1 player declines to trash a card. If the Runner declines, draw 1 card and gain 5[credit].
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.1</errata>
name: Standoff

flavor: The difference between surviving and thriving is successful terraforming.
text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, forfeit an agenda and spend [click][click].
Advance a card X times. X equals the advancement requirement of the agenda just forfeited.
name: Success

flavor: "Whampoa is the largest and meanest Earth-based mining concern on Mars. They put bodies and waste in the ground as fast as they pull minerals out." - Alice Merchant
text: Trash 1 card from HQ: Add 1 card from Archives to the bottom of R&D. Use this ability only once per turn.
name: Whampoa Reclamation

text: Gain 2[credit] for each card with at least 1 advancement token on it.
name: Mass Commercialization

text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. As an additional cost to rez non-ice cards, the Corp must randomly trash a card from HQ.
name: Hacktivist Meeting

flavor: Usually crashing with friends means sleeping on the couch. This time, it meant sleeping on a server farm.
text: Off-Campus Apartment can host any number of connections. Whenever you install a connection on Off-Campus Apartment, draw 1 card.
name: Off-Campus Apartment

flavor: "You can help Jinteki shape the future. Your future."
text: Install a resource from your grip, lowering the install cost by 3.
name: Career Fair

text: Place 4 power counters on Dorm Computer when you install it. [click], hosted power counter: Make a run. Avoid all tags for the remainder of the run.
name: Dorm Computer

text: The first time you install a card each turn, you may install another card of the same type from your grip (paying its install cost).
name: Hayley Kaplan: Universal Scholar

text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
If you have fewer cards in your grip than your maximum hand size, draw cards until you have cards in your grip equal to your maximum hand size.
name: Game Day

text: +1[mu] The first time you play an event each turn, you may play another event (without spending a click) after the first one resolves. Limit 1 console per player.
name: Comet

flavor: "Once you download the lecture source files, this program does a statistical analysis and distills the most important concepts." -Hayley Kaplan
text: Study Guide has +1 strength for each power counter on it. 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 2[credit]: Place 1 power counter on Study Guide.
name: Study Guide

text: Trash all programs hosted on London Library when your turn ends. [click]: Install a non-virus program from your grip on London Library, ignoring the install cost. [click]: Add a program on London Library to your grip.
name: London Library

flavor: "There are whole generations of people who never move out of a megalopolis center. You should see the look on their face the first time they see the stars." -Professor Darren Fin, Astronomy
text: [click], [click]: Search your stack for a piece of hardware, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.
name: Tyson Observatory

flavor: "So much to do. So little time."
text:
When your turn begins, lose [click].
Your maximum hand size is increased by 5.
name: Beach Party

flavor: "My research could make your corporation billions. And save lives, of course."
text: When you score Research Grant, you may score another copy of Research Grant that is installed.
name: Research Grant

flavor: Alan Turing laid the foundation for artificial intelligence by suggesting that you could teach a computer to be human.
text: Turing has +3 strength while protecting a remote server. The Runner cannot use AI programs to break subroutines on Turing. [subroutine] End the run unless the Runner spends [click][click][click].
name: Turing

flavor: Crick and his colleagues ushered in modern genetics by mapping the structure of DNA.
text:
Crick has +3 strength while protecting Archives.
[subroutine] Install a card from Archives (paying its install cost).
name: Crick

flavor: "My script can perform the Kobayashi algorithm in .12 seconds."
text: Search R&D for up to X different sysops (by title), reveal them, and add them to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
name: Recruiting Trip

flavor: Officially, there is no blacklist. That would be illegal. Unofficially, there is a list, and being on it can ruin a career.
text: Cards cannot leave the Runner's heap for any reason.
name: Blacklist

flavor: Johannes Gutenberg ignited the first Information Revolution by inventing the movable-type printing press.
text:
Gutenberg has +3 strength while protecting R&D.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 7</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
name: Gutenberg

flavor: The cost of an education is sometimes felt sharpest in the stomach.
text: As an additional cost to play an event that there is a copy of in his or her heap, the Runner must pay 2[credit].
name: Student Loans

flavor: Meru Mati pushed the limits of physics by engineering the first buckyweave structure, a thousand-foot long wall.
text:
Meru Mati has +3 strength while protecting HQ.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Meru Mati

flavor: After the Big One, real estate value changed sharply. Some found that they had become owners of beachfront property. Others were underwater.
text: The rez cost of cards in this server is lowered by 5. Limit 1 region per server.
name: Breaker Bay Grid

flavor: "No! Don't set that off HERE!"
text: [trash]: The Corp cannot rez more than 1 piece of ice for the remainder of this run. Use this ability only during a run.
name: EMP Device

text:
When Diwan is installed, choose a server. As an additional cost to install a card in or protecting that server, the Corp must pay 1[credit].
Trash Diwan if the Corp purges virus counters.
name: Diwan

flavor: <champion>Designed by 2013 World Champion Jens Erickson</champion>
text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards, the Corp adds all cards in HQ to the top of R&D in the order of his or her choice.
name: CBI Raid

flavor: "Why would you dispose of perfectly good evidence when you can sell it?"
text: Whenever you use a [trash] ability, gain 1[credit].
name: Tech Trader

text:
NetChip can host a program with a memory cost less than or equal to the number of copies of NetChip installed. The memory cost of the hosted program does not count against your memory limit.
Limit 6 per deck.
name: NetChip

flavor: "We may be outraged, but we're not surprised." -Sunder
text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The Corp has 1 additional bad publicity (even if they have 0).
name: Corporate Scandal

flavor: "The corporations may be stronger than any of us, but they are not stronger than all of us." -Akshara Sareen
text: Play only if you have at least 1 seedy card installed. The Corp has 1 fewer [click] to spend on his or her next turn.
name: Populist Rally

text:
When you rez Advanced Assembly Lines, gain 3[credit].
[trash]: Install a non-agenda card from HQ (paying the install cost). You cannot use this ability during a run.
name: Advanced Assembly Lines

text: Whenever you rez a card, place 1 power counter on Lakshmi Smartfabrics. X hosted power counters: Reveal an agenda worth X points from HQ. The Runner cannot steal copies of that agenda for the remainder of this turn.
name: Lakshmi Smartfabrics

text: This card costs 0 influence if you have 6 or more non-alliance [haas-bioroid] cards in your deck. Trash a rezzed asset or upgrade. If you do, gain credits equal to its trash cost.
name: Product Recall

flavor: We Are What We Eat.
text: The first time each turn the Runner draws a card, gain 1[credit].
name: Pālanā Foods: Sustainable Growth

flavor: Expensive to build but dramatically more efficient than traditional farming, agroplexes are emblems of the inevitable corporatization of the food industry.
text: When your turn begins, each player draws 1 card.
name: Pālanā Agroplex

flavor: "We can help others, yet also help ourselves." -Soraiya Suresh, VP Public Programs
text:
[subroutine] The Runner draws 3 cards and then discards down to his or her maximum hand size.
[subroutine] The Runner draws 3 cards and then discards down to his or her maximum hand size.
name: Harvester

flavor: Data, not food, is one of the biggest exports from the Gujarat district of Mumbad.
text: Your maximum hand size is increased by 2.
name: Remote Data Farm

text:
If Disposable HQ is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Disposable HQ, you may add any number of cards from HQ to the bottom of R&D.
name: Disposable HQ

text:
Install New Construction faceup.
Whenever you advance New Construction, you may install a card from HQ in a new server (and rez that card ignoring all costs if there are 5 or more advancement tokens on New Construction).
name: New Construction

text:
When your turn begins, place 1 advancement token on Mumbad Construction Co.
2[credit]: Move 1 advancement token from Mumbad Construction Co. to a faceup card.
name: Mumbad Construction Co.

flavor: "You got it. We sell it. They buy it. Everyone wins."
text:
When you score Corporate Sales Team, place 10[credit] on it.
When each player's turn begins, take 1[credit] from Corporate Sales Team.
name: Corporate Sales Team

text:
This card costs 0 influence if you have 3 PAD Campaigns in your deck.
[click]: Place 1 advancement token on a card. You cannot score that card until your next turn begins.
name: PAD Factory

text: Make a run. Trash the first non-agenda card you access during this run at no cost. The Corp can spend credits equal to the rez or play cost of the accessed card to prevent this trash.
name: Credit Crash

flavor: "You can have a lot of fun in 23 seconds." -Princess Space Kitten
text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The text box of each unique non-region asset and upgrade is blank.
name: Rumor Mill

flavor: Balance out the equation.
text: When an encounter in which you used Nfr to break all subroutines on that piece of ice ends, place 1 power counter on Nfr. Nfr has +1 strength for each power counter on it. 1[credit]: Break barrier subroutine.
name: Nfr

flavor: "It is not wise to call someone crazy until you fully understand what they're trying to say." -Omar Keung
text: Whenever you encounter a barrier, you may install Paperclip from your heap (paying its install cost). X[credit]: +X strength. Break up to X barrier subroutines, if able.
name: Paperclip

flavor: The program was as close to a hunting raptor as she could afford...for now.
text: 2[credit]: Break up to 2 sentry subroutines. 2[credit]: +4 strength. 2[credit], return Golden to your grip: Derez a sentry. Use this ability only after using Golden to break all the subroutines on that sentry during a single encounter.
name: Golden

flavor: "The best part is, it's legal!" -Khan
text:
Choose a server and place 20[credit] from the bank on Temüjin Contract when you install it. When there are no credits left on Temüjin Contract, trash it.
Whenever you make a successful run on the chosen server, take 4[credit] from Temüjin Contract.
name: Temüjin Contract

text: The first time you pass a piece of ice each turn, you may install an icebreaker from your hand, lowering the install cost by 1.
name: Khan: Savvy Skiptracer

flavor: Once a security flaw is identified, there's only a limited window to exploit it before it's patched. Runners call this period "open season."
text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, you may make another run on R&D when this run ends.
name: Data Breach

text:
When your turn begins, you may move up to 3[credit] from your credit pool to Algo Trading.
When your turn begins, place 2[credit] on Algo Trading from the bank if there are at least 6[credit] on it.
[click],[trash]: Take all credits from Algo Trading.
name: Algo Trading

flavor: "Coming to you live from the front lines, for now, unless they kill me..."
text:
If the Corp has 5-9[credit] when your turn begins, gain 1[credit].
If the Corp has 10-14[credit] when your turn begins, draw 1 card.
If the Corp has at least 15[credit] when your turn begins, gain [click].
name: Beth Kilrain-Chang

flavor: To threaten my treasures is to incur my wrath.
text:
The Runner can spend [click][click] to break up to 2 subroutines on Fairchild 2.0.
[subroutine] The Runner must pay 2[credit] or trash 1 of his or her installed cards.
[subroutine] The Runner must pay 2[credit] or trash 1 of his or her installed cards.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
name: Fairchild 2.0

flavor: First, blend with the attacker. Then, control the attack.
text:
[subroutine] You and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, the Runner draws 2 cards.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
name: Aiki

flavor: "Eiko here. It's done."
text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
<trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, trash an installed card that does not match the faction of the Runner's identity.
name: Enforcing Loyalty

flavor: "SELL!! Buy platinum, but GET OUT OF THE TT CREDIT! It is TOXIC!"
text: As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click]. Trace 5 If successful, add an installed non-virtual card to the Runner's grip.
name: Hatchet Job

flavor: By the time the report of Emelyov's murder was produced, there had already been a dozen more, hitting all the corps.
text: Shuffle any number of cards from HQ into R&D. Draw that number of cards.
name: Special Report

text:
When your turn begins, you may move up to 3[credit] from your credit pool to C.I. Fund.
When your turn begins, place 2[credit] on C.I. Fund from the bank if there are at least 6[credit] on it.
2[credit],[trash]: Take all credits from C.I. Fund.
name: C.I. Fund

flavor: What's a little insurance fraud between friends?
text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Trash any number of your rezzed cards and gain 3[credit] for each card trashed.
name: Liquidation

flavor: Strength makes leaders.
text:
The first time an encounter with a piece of ice with at least 1 advancement token ends each turn, do 1 meat damage.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 3.1.1</errata>
name: Weyland Consortium: Builder of Nations

flavor: She'd never heard her dads argue like this. Not ever. She'd give anything to make it stop.
text:
Play only if the Runner has at least 6[credit].
The Runner loses 2[credit] for each installed resource. The Runner can trash a resource to prevent this.
name: Financial Collapse

flavor: "While the money pooled at the top, the power went with it, until there were two sets of laws: one for them, one for us" -Omar Keung, the Flashpoint
text: If the Runner accesses Prisec while installed, you may pay 2[credit] to give the Runner 1 tag and do 1 meat damage.
name: Prisec

flavor: The densest information cluster in the galaxy.
text: Your maximum hand size is equal to the number of credits in your credit pool.
name: Cerebral Imaging: Infinite Frontiers

flavor: The Once and Future Android.
text: You cannot include Jinteki cards in this deck.
name: Custom Biotics: Engineered for Success

text: Before taking your first turn, you may install up to 3 pieces of ice, with no more than a single piece of ice per server. Draw until you have 5 cards in HQ.
name: NEXT Design: Guarding the Net

text:
When you score Director Haas' Pet Project, you may create a new remote server by installing up to 3 cards from HQ and/or Archives in that server and/or protecting that server (one at a time), ignoring all install costs.
Limit 1 Director Haas' Pet Project per deck.
name: Director Haas' Pet Project

text: Place 3 agenda counters on Efficiency Committee when you score it. [click], hosted agenda counter: Gain [click][click]. You cannot advance cards for the remainder of this turn.
name: Efficiency Committee

text: Place 3 agenda counters on Project Wotan when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: Choose a rezzed piece of bioroid ice currently being approached. For the remainder of this run, that ice gains "[subroutine] End the run." after all its other subroutines.
name: Project Wotan

flavor: "Why limit our best assets to our own servers? The enemy doesn't stay passively at home, waiting for us to come to him. Why should we?" -Director Haas
text: Whenever the Runner suffers at least 1 brain damage, do 1 net damage.
name: Sentinel Defense Program

flavor: The Alix model was based on a successful hedge fund manager but she had a tendency to burn out. Literally.
text:
Place 1 power counter on Alix T4LB07 whenever you install a card.
[click],[trash]: Gain 2[credit] for each power counter on Alix T4LB07.
name: Alix T4LB07

text:
Cerebral Overwriter can be advanced.
If you pay 3[credit] when the Runner accesses Cerebral Overwriter, do 1 brain damage for each advancement token on Cerebral Overwriter.
name: Cerebral Overwriter

text:
You have 1 additional [click] to spend during your turn.
If Director Haas is trashed while being accessed, add her to the Runner's score area as an agenda worth 2 agenda points.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 3.1</errata>
name: Director Haas

text: Haas Arcology AI can be advanced only while unrezzed. [click], hosted advancement token: Gain [click][click]. Use this ability only once per turn.
name: Haas Arcology AI

flavor: Thomas, the director's son, has been carefully groomed to inherit the corporation since before he was born. His favorite pastime appears to be disappointing his mother.
text:
Thomas Haas can be advanced.
[trash]: Gain 2[credit] for each advancement token on Thomas Haas.
name: Thomas Haas

text: Rez a piece of bioroid ice, ignoring all costs, and install Bioroid Efficiency Research on that ice as a hosted condition counter with the text "Trash Bioroid Efficiency Research and derez host ice if all of its subroutines are broken during a single encounter."
name: Bioroid Efficiency Research

flavor: Success is defined by the safety of data, not the safety of potential intruders.
text:
Play only if the Runner made an unsuccessful run during his or her last turn.
Gain 7[credit].
name: Successful Demonstration

flavor: The realm beyond is still forbidden.
text:
The Runner can spend [click][click] to break up to 2 subroutines on Heimdall 2.0.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage and end the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Heimdall 2.0

flavor: "Yeah. It made a loud noise, I got scared, and I jacked out. I still think I made the right decision." -g00ru
text: [subroutine] You may install and rez a piece of bioroid ice from HQ or Archives, ignoring all costs, placing it directly behind Howler. If you do, derez that piece of ice and trash Howler after the run is completed.
name: Howler

flavor: The game has changed.
text:
The Runner can spend [click][click] to break up to 2 subroutines on Ichi 2.0.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag and do 1 brain damage.
name: Ichi 2.0

flavor: Sometimes you just have to guess.
text: [subroutine] You may install a piece of ice from HQ as the outermost piece of ice protecting this server, ignoring all install costs.
name: Minelayer

text: The Runner can spend [click][click] to break up to 2 subroutines on Viktor 2.0. Hosted power counter: Do 1 brain damage. [subroutine] Trace 2 If successful, place 1 power counter on Viktor 2.0. [subroutine] End the run.
name: Viktor 2.0

flavor: A mind of meat! How does it work?
text:
The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Zed 1.0.
[subroutine] If the Runner has spent at least 1[click] to break a subroutine during this run, do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] If the Runner has spent at least 1[click] to break a subroutine during this run, do 1 brain damage.
name: Zed 1.0

text: Awakening Center can host bioroid ice (each piece is installed facedown, ignoring all install costs). Whenever the Runner passes all of the ice protecting this server, you may rez a piece of ice on Awakening Center, lowering the rez cost by 7[credit], to force the Runner to encounter it. Trash that ice after the run is completed.
name: Awakening Center

text: If the Runner is about to break a subroutine on a piece of bioroid ice protecting this server, you may rez Tyr's Hand. [trash]: Prevent a subroutine from being broken on a piece of bioroid ice protecting this server.
name: Tyr's Hand

flavor: Sell the dream-show them how very much they want to be rich, and they'll convince themselves that someday, they will be. How can they revolt against their future selves? -the New Gospel of Wealth
text: [click], [click]: Gain 3[credit].
name: Gila Hands Arcology

flavor: "Just another factory, making good corporate drones for the machine. Their CS department is the best in the world, though." -g00ru
text: [click], 1[credit]: Search R&D for a piece of ice, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
name: Levy University

flavor: "There's only a 5% chance this could result in a general failure."
text:
Gain 2[credit] when your turn begins.
Trash Server Diagnostics when you install a piece of ice.
name: Server Diagnostics

flavor: The principle behind ice is not to keep everyone out, but to let only some people in. This ice denies entry on all but a select few ports that might change with the time of day or picosecond of connection. If you don't know what port to use, you're not getting in. Period.
text: [subroutine] End the run.
name: Bastion

flavor: "Cheap, off-the-shelf data protection. Cheap for them, that is. Not for us." -Ele "Smoke" Scovak
text:
[subroutine] The Runner must pay 2[credit], if able. If the Runner cannot pay 2[credit], end the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Datapike

flavor: "I was not; I was; I am not; I am all."
text: The first piece of ice you encounter each turn gains code gate until the end of the run.
name: Rielle "Kit" Peddler: Transhuman

flavor: "New technology destroys the old."
text: The first copy of each program in this deck does not count against your influence limit.
name: The Professor: Keeper of Knowledge

flavor: "I can make that work."
text: Whenever you install a program from your heap, draw 1 card.
name: Exile: Streethawk

text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards, rearrange any number of ice protecting all servers (without rezzing or derezzing the ice). The same number of ice must be protecting each server after the rearrangement as before.
name: Escher

flavor: Wheeeee!
text: Make a run. If successful, instead of accessing cards, remove up to 3 advancement tokens from a single card in or protecting the attacked server.
name: Exploratory Romp

flavor: "Idealism's great, but it don't keep you in soybeef tacos." -Matt "TheMerc" Thomas
text: Trash up to 5 programs from your grip. Gain 2[credit] for each program trashed.
name: Freelance Coding Contract

flavor: One man's trash.
text:
Trash an installed program.
If you do, install a program from your grip or heap, lowering the install cost of that program by the cost of the program trashed.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.0</errata>
name: Scavenge

flavor: Spend too much time in the AR Lab and someone might notice. Unless you're the head of it, that is.
text: Shuffle your grip and heap into your stack. Draw 5 cards. Remove Levy AR Lab Access from the game instead of trashing it.
name: Levy AR Lab Access

text: +3[mu] When you install Monolith, install up to 3 programs from your grip, lowering the install cost of each by 4[credit]. Trash a program from your grip: Prevent 1 brain or net damage. Limit 1 console per player.
name: Monolith

flavor: It still hurts, a bit, the first time. The second time, you feel nothing at all. But don't push your luck.
text:
3[credit]: Prevent 1 net damage.
[trash]: Prevent up to 2 brain damage.
name: Feedback Filter

flavor: It is good practice to backup the backup.
text: [trash]: Install a program from your heap (paying the install cost).
name: Clone Chip

text:
Omni-drive can host a single program of 1[mu] or less. The memory cost of the hosted program does not count against your memory limit.
1[recurring-credit]
Use this credit to pay for using the hosted program.
name: Omni-drive

flavor: We are shaped by our thoughts; we become what we think.
text:
When you install Atman, you may pay X[credit] to place X power counters on Atman.
Atman has +1 strength for each power counter on it.
1[credit]: Break ice subroutine on a piece of ice that has strength equal to Atman's strength.
name: Atman

flavor: "No line that they lay could catch a shadow on the wall…"
text: 1[recurring-credit] Use this credit to pay for using icebreakers.
name: Cloak

flavor: "…and once the shadow rises, the curtain shall fall." -revenant
text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 1[credit]: +5 strength. Use this ability only by spending a credit from a stealth card.
name: Dagger

text:
Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, place 1 virus counter on Chakana.
If there are at least 3 virus counters on Chakana, the advancement requirement of all agendas is increased by 1.
name: Chakana

text: 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength. When you install Cyber-Cypher, choose a server. Cyber-Cypher can only be used during a run on the chosen server.
name: Cyber-Cypher

flavor: Perfect for flooding servers.
text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to trash assets.
name: Paricia

flavor: "Make sure you tell the source code which executable you want it to compile into. One time I left my rig for a couple of minutes, and when I came back all of my files had been replaced with cat vids." -The Professor
text: 2[credit], [trash]: Search your stack for a program and install it (paying the install cost). Shuffle your stack.
name: Self-modifying Code

flavor: Out there, the thousand-petaled lotus symbolizes detachment from illusion. In here, it is the birthplace of a higher consciousness. Something infinitely pure.
text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to install programs (you cannot use Sahasrara to install a program that trashes Sahasrara).
name: Sahasrara

flavor: "The Incans believed that the sun god resided in the Haman Pacha, the upper realm of the cosmos. They just didn't know that the Haman Pacha hadn't been discovered yet." -The Professor
text: 1[credit]: Break barrier subroutine. 2[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
name: Inti

flavor: Sometimes it doesn't matter how expensive your rig is, or how many credits are in your account, or even your skill as a runner. Most of the time, a simple handshake and a name are all you need.
text: [click]: Gain 1[credit] and draw 1 card.
name: Professional Contacts

flavor: Some people have their own satellite receiver. Others have their own satellite.
text:
+1[link]
Your maximum hand size is increased by 1.
name: Borrowed Satellite

flavor: "If you know the source code you can write to beat it, or just rejigger it a little and make it yours. That works, too." -Exile
text:
Whenever the Corp rezzes a piece of ice, place 1[credit] on Ice Analyzer.
You may use credits on Ice Analyzer to install programs.
name: Ice Analyzer

flavor: The data was better than she could have ever imagined. This Santiago fellow really knew what he was doing. She began to imagine the havoc she could wreak at the upcoming charity dinner…
text: Make a run. After the run is completed, gain 5[credit] if it was successful.
name: Dirty Laundry

flavor: "We say 'cyber-terrorist', they hear 'underground celebrity.'" -Michael Muhama, professional expert.
text:
Place 8[credit] from the bank on Daily Casts when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Daily Casts, trash it.
Take 2[credit] from Daily Casts when your turn begins.
name: Daily Casts

flavor: Just me, a cup of YucaBean, and last night's Hong Kong Trunk sniffed packets. I call that a good morning.
text: [click], [click], [trash]: Play an event from your heap (paying its play cost).
name: Same Old Thing

flavor: A dangerous game, but well worth playing.
text:
The advancement requirement of all agendas is increased by 1.
As an additional cost to steal an agenda, you must pay 3[credit].
Trash The Source when an agenda is scored or stolen.
name: The Source

flavor: The most potent scripts are indistinguishable from magic to the sysop on the other side.
text: Make a run on Archives. If successful, instead of accessing a piece of ice in Archives, trash a rezzed copy of that ice.
name: Immolation Script

flavor: The implanted brain-machine interface, or "skulljack," is the single most common cybernetic enhancement that isn't a medical necessity.
text:
When you install Skulljack, suffer 1 brain damage.
The trash cost of all cards is lowered by 1.
name: Skulljack

text: +1[mu] Whenever you steal an agenda, you may swap that agenda with an agenda in the Corp's score area. Limit 1 console per player.
name: Turntable

flavor: Picking a chopper might be the last decision you make. If you find a good one, stick with her for life.
text: Prevent all meat damage and brain damage from installing cybernetics.
name: Chrome Parlor

text:
When you install Titanium Ribs, suffer 2 meat damage.
You choose the card(s) from your grip to trash whenever you take damage (including the damage taken by installing Titanium Ribs).
name: Titanium Ribs

text: If you have at least 2[link], the memory cost of Crowbar is 0, even if it is not installed. Crowbar has +1 strength for each installed icebreaker. [trash]: Break up to 3 code gate subroutines.
name: Crowbar

text: When you install Net-Ready Eyes, suffer 2 meat damage. Whenever you initiate a run, choose an icebreaker. That icebreaker has +1 strength for the remainder of the run.
name: Net-Ready Eyes

flavor: Sometimes progress means returning to the past.
text: [click]: Make a run on R&D. If successful, instead of accessing cards, you may choose an unrezzed non-ice card with no advancement tokens on it. The Corp shuffles that card into R&D.
name: Analog Dreamers

flavor: The skull is not one bone, but 22. The surgery is even more complex than it sounds.
text:
When you install Brain Cage, suffer 1 brain damage.
Your maximum hand size is increased by 3.
name: Brain Cage

flavor: Define Yourself.
text: Each player's maximum hand size is reduced by 1.
name: Cybernetics Division: Humanity Upgraded

flavor: Cyber enhancements can be dangerous in the wrong hands.
text: The Runner's maximum hand size is reduced by 1.
name: Self-Destruct Chips

flavor: "Remember those FCC regulations about not creating harmful interference? No? Ah, before your time, I guess." -Cailan Heinrich, Senior Programmer
text: [subroutine] The Runner trashes an installed piece of hardware. Trash Lab Dog.
name: Lab Dog

flavor: Built Oaktown tough.
text: The trash cost of cards installed in this server is increased by 3. Limit 1 region per server.
name: Oaktown Grid

flavor: "Bioroids recognize consciousness in others, but not in themselves."
text: [trash]: Do 1 brain damage. Use this ability only during a run on this server and only if the Runner has no unspent clicks.
name: Ryon Knight

text: [subroutine] You and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, place 1 advancement token on an installed card and end the run.
name: Clairvoyant Monitor

flavor: "When your communications are disrupted, you are isolated from your resources. An attack will surely follow." -The Playbook
text: [subroutine] The Runner cannot draw cards for the remainder of this turn.
name: Lockdown

flavor: "A sysop is not just a cog in the corporate machine. They have dreams-and nightmares-just like the rest of us." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
text:
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] The Runner gains 5[credit].
name: Little Engine

text:
Install Oaktown Renovation faceup.
Whenever you advance Oaktown Renovation, gain 2[credit] (or 3[credit] if there are 5 or more advancement tokens on Oaktown Renovation).
name: Oaktown Renovation

flavor: If you can't buy the city council, create a new city.
text:
As an additional cost to rez Corporate Town, the Corp must forfeit an agenda.
When your turn begins, you may trash 1 resource (cannot be prevented).
name: Corporate Town

text:
When the Runner encounters Quicksand, place 1 power counter on Quicksand.
Quicksand has +1 strength for each power counter on it.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Quicksand

text:
Play only if you made a successful run on a central server this turn.
The Corp must pay 5[credit] or take 1 bad publicity. Remove Mining Accident from the game instead of trashing it.
name: Mining Accident

text:
When you install Respirocytes, suffer 1 meat damage.
The first time you have 0 cards in your grip each turn, draw 1 card and place a power counter on Respirocytes. When Respirocytes has 3 or more power counters on it, trash it.
name: Respirocytes

flavor: Vanadis, a Martian arms manufacturer, was among the first sites targeted from orbit during the war.
text:
[trash]: The Corp trashes the top X cards of R&D. X is the amount of damage you have suffered this turn. Use this ability only during the next paid ability window after suffering any amount of damage.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.1</errata>
name: Salvaged Vanadis Armory

text:
Whenever you expose a card or access cards and do not steal or trash any of them, place 1 virus counter on Aumakua.
Aumakua has +1 strength for each virus counter on it.
1[credit]: Break ice subroutine.
name: Aumakua

flavor: The electric pulses ripped through the Net, backtracking Los's location. When they hit his defenses, they spent themselves against the slope.
text: 3[credit]: Prevent 1 net or brain damage.
name: Caldera

text: Make a run. Whenever you encounter a piece of ice during this run, you may install a program from your grip, ignoring all costs. When this run ends, trash all programs installed using Diana's Hunt.
name: Diana's Hunt

flavor: "I wield the power cosmic—a galactic force that can reshape the Net!" -S'onge Galaxy
text: Swap 2 pieces of unrezzed ice.
name: Reshape

flavor: "Aptly named." -g00ru
text: Trash a card from your grip: Prevent an installed card of the same type from being trashed by the Corp.
name: Dummy Box

flavor: He was suddenly very motivated to pass on confidential information.
text: Whenever the Corp spends a [click] to draw a card (not through a card effect), reveal that card.
name: Corporate Defector

flavor: "Sure, we also use human labor—they are more easily replaced." -Emil Merk
text: When you score CFC Excavation Contract, gain 2[credit] for each rezzed bioroid.
name: CFC Excavation Contract

text:
[click]: Place 1 power counter on MCA Austerity Policy. When the Runner's next turn begins, he or she loses [click]. Use this ability only once per turn.
[click],[trash], 3 hosted power counters: Gain [click],[click],[click],[click].
name: MCA Austerity Policy

text: Install and rez 1 card from Archives (paying all costs). Remove all other copies of that card in Archives from the game.
name: Restore

text:
If Breached Dome is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Breached Dome, do 1 meat damage and trash the top card of the stack.
name: Breached Dome

flavor: By the time the data storm passed, the landscape was transformed, and she was hopelessly lost.
text: [subroutine] Move Sand Storm so that it is the outermost piece of ice protecting another server (the Runner continues the run from this new position and is now running on this new server). Trash Sand Storm.
name: Sand Storm

flavor: Only NBN's sec teams were outfitted with systems that could read data flows and see into the Net.
text: The first time the Runner trashes a Corp card each turn, give him or her 1 tag.
name: AR-Enhanced Security

text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. The play cost of each operation and event is increased by 1. The first time the Runner plays an event each turn, gain 1[credit].
name: Rolling Brownout

text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
<trace>Trace 1</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag for each tag he or she has; if the Runner has no tags, give him or her 1 tag.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.1</errata>
name: Threat Level Alpha

text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Install a piece of ice from HQ protecting a remote server (ignoring all costs). Place 3 advancement tokens on that ice.
name: Priority Construction

flavor: "I embedded recursive data loops into the go-no-go subroutines of every piece of ice." -Anson Rose
text: Each time all the subroutines are broken on a piece of ice protecting this server, trash the top 2 cards of the stack.
name: Fractal Threat Matrix

flavor: A ghost image of it could be made out in the static of his BMI. He hoped never to run across the real thing again.
text: Conundrum has +3 strength if there is an installed AI. [subroutine] The Runner trashes an installed program. [subroutine] The Runner loses [click], if able. [subroutine] End the run.
name: Conundrum

text:
Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, place 1 virus counter on Nerve Agent.
Each virus counter after the first on Nerve Agent allows you to access 1 additional card from HQ whenever you access cards from HQ.
name: Nerve Agent

flavor: "My enhancements are guaranteed for life, and well worth the risk."
text: When your turn begins, you may gain [click]. If you do, take 1 tag when this turn ends.
name: Joshua B.

flavor: "Think of it as a virtual shock collar for punishing corporate pets." -Andromeda
text:
Play only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn.
Derez a piece of ice.
name: Emergency Shutdown

flavor: Light and form-fitting, its like bulletproof skin.
text: Prevent the first meat damage each turn.
name: Muresh Bodysuit

flavor: "A snitch is a girl's best friend." -Andromeda
text: Once per run, you may expose an unrezzed piece of ice when you approach it. You may then jack out.
name: Snitch

flavor: "Have you met Dinosaurus?"
name: Chaos Theory: Wünderkind

text: Search your stack or heap for a program. Install that program, ignoring all costs. Shuffle your stack if you searched it. When this turn ends, add the program to the top of your stack if it is still installed.
name: Test Run

text: Dinosaurus can host a single non-AI icebreaker. The memory cost of the hosted icebreaker does not count against your memory limit. Hosted icebreaker has +2 strength. Limit 1 console per player.
name: Dinosaurus

text:
[click]: Host a program or piece of hardware from your grip on Personal Workshop and place power counters on it equal to its install cost.
1[credit]: Remove 1 power counter from a hosted card.
When your turn begins, remove 1 power counter from a hosted card.
When there are no power counters left on a hosted card, install it, ignoring all costs.
name: Personal Workshop

flavor: "I'm just thankful that the brain damage is reversible. With the support of the city of New Angeles, I hope to be on my feet and back to practicing my art very soon." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
text: Your maximum hand size is increased by 2.
name: Public Sympathy

text: When you score Project Vitruvius, place 1 agenda counter on it for each advancement token on it over 3. Hosted agenda counter: Add 1 card from Archives to HQ.
name: Project Vitruvius

flavor: Dont Tread On Me
text:
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, the Runner loses [click], if able.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, end the run.
name: Viper

text: If Edge of World is installed and you pay 3[credit] when the Runner accesses it, do 1 brain damage for each piece of ice protecting this server.
name: Edge of World

flavor: "You haven't run until you've seen the cybersun drift down behind the Great City, the space around you rippling with colors you can't imagine." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
text: Choose a server. Arrange the ice protecting that server in any order.
name: Sunset

text:
When your turn begins, take 1[credit] from Marked Accounts, if able.
[click]: Place 3[credit] from the bank on Marked Accounts.
name: Marked Accounts

flavor: "Try to close it. Go on. See what it does." -Chaos Theory
text:
When the Runner encounters Pop-up Window, you gain 1[credit].
[subroutine] End the run unless the Runner pays 1[credit].
name: Pop-up Window

flavor: Chop chop.
text: Woodcutter can be advanced only while rezzed and gains "[subroutine] Do 1 net damage." for each advancement token on it.
name: Woodcutter

flavor: The Division of Fringe Applications' revenue increased 37% year-over-year after corporate discovered that most of their projects made really fun toys.
text: Choose a piece of ice. Gain 1[credit] for each advancement token on that ice.
name: Commercialization

text:
Place 14[credit] from the bank on Private Contracts when it is rezzed. When there are no credits left on Private Contracts, trash it.
[click]: Take 2[credit] from Private Contracts.
name: Private Contracts

flavor: Three heads. One big headache.
text: When you rez Chimera, choose sentry, code gate, or barrier. Chimera gains that subtype until derezzed. When a turn ends, derez Chimera. [subroutine] End the run.
name: Chimera

flavor: "Watch this. It'll be funny."
text: Whenever you install a virus program, the Corp trashes the top card of R&D.
name: Noise: Hacker Extraordinaire

flavor: Anything worth doing is worth doing twice.
text: Add 1 card (or up to 2 virus cards) from your heap to your grip.
name: Déjà Vu

flavor: You ever set something on fire just to watch it burn?
text:
Run HQ or R&D. During that run, you may pay 0[credit] to trash any card you are accessing (even if it has no trash cost).
<errata>Errata from CR 1.2</errata>
name: Demolition Run

text: Make a run, and gain 9[credit], which you may use only during this run. After the run is completed, suffer 1 brain damage (cannot be prevented) and return to the bank any of the 9[credit] not spent.
name: Stimhack

flavor: I feel almost naked without it
text: 1[recurring-credit] Use this credit to pay for using icebreakers or for installing virus programs.
name: Cyberfeeder

flavor: "My little book of magic spells." -The Whizzard
text: +2[mu] Whenever you install a virus program, place 1 virus counter on that program. Limit 1 console per player.
name: Grimoire

flavor: "If at first you don't succeed, boost its strength and try again." -g00ru
text: 1[credit]: Break barrier subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
name: Corroder

text: Whenever you make a successful run on a central server, place 1 virus counter on Datasucker. Hosted virus counter: Rezzed piece of ice currently being encountered has -1 strength until the end of the encounter.
name: Datasucker

text: Djinn can host up to 3[mu] of non-icebreaker programs. The memory costs of hosted programs do not count against your memory limit. [click], 1[credit]: Search your stack for a virus program, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.
name: Djinn

flavor: It looked like random packet loss. It wasn't.
text:
Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, place 1 virus counter on Medium.
Each virus counter after the first on Medium allows you to access 1 additional card from R&D whenever you access cards from R&D.
name: Medium

flavor: November 5th: the day when all would see the corrupt machinations of the corporate oligarchy.
text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine.
name: Mimic

text:
Install Parasite only on a rezzed piece of ice.
Host ice has -1 strength for each virus counter on Parasite and is trashed if its strength is 0 or less.
When your turn begins, place 1 virus counter on Parasite.
name: Parasite

flavor: Fire and ichor…
text:
3[credit]: Break ice subroutine on a piece of ice with 0 or less strength.
1[credit]: Ice has -1 strength.
1[credit]: +1 strength.
name: Wyrm

flavor: The Yog.0 database is a crowdsourced compilation of sniffed, spoofed, and logged passkeys. If the key to the gate is in the database, you're in. If it's not, change the gate!
text: 0[credit]: Break code gate subroutine.
name: Yog.0

flavor: In the public consciousness, there's a hard line between corp and runner. In the real world, things are a little more porous. The corp need the best hackers to run their networks, and some of the best hackers are ex-runners who like the idea of a regular paycheck. But sometimes things run the other way, and someone on the inside makes something like this.
text: All ice is encountered with its strength lowered by 1.
name: Ice Carver

flavor: "Best place to go when you want to get your mind out of the gutter and take it inside." -Ji "Noise" Reilly
text: When your turn begins, draw 2 cards and lose [click].
name: Wyldside

flavor: "Of course I steal from the rich. They're the ones with all the money."
text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ each turn, gain 2[credit].
name: Gabriel Santiago: Consummate Professional

text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards you may force the Corp to lose up to 5[credit], then you gain 2[credit] for each credit lost and take 2 tags.
name: Account Siphon

flavor: "Hey kid, you fire that up now, bound to be vamped real bad. Some real pathetic individuals around here. But thankfully I got just the ticket…"
text: Gain 3[credit].
name: Easy Mark

flavor: As the hysteria in the room climbed higher up the corporate chain, an uneasy feeling of joblessness began to sink in on the lower rungs.
text: Choose an unrezzed piece of ice. The Corp must either rez that ice or trash it.
name: Forged Activation Orders

flavor: "Hey, listen, I'm not asking you to do anything dangerous. Just let me into the building. And tell me which room has the weakest security. And please don't say 'the bathroom' again."
text: Make a run. Bypass the first piece of ice encountered during this run.
name: Inside Job

flavor: Feverishly tracking its frustratingly slow progress across the Pacific, the package finally shows up hours later…
text: Search your stack for an icebreaker, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.
name: Special Order

flavor: "A little preparation goes a long way." -Gabriel Santiago
text: [click], 1[credit]: Expose 1 card. Use this ability only if you have made a successful run on HQ this turn.
name: Lemuria Codecracker

text: +1[mu] Gain 1[credit] whenever you make a successful run. Limit 1 console per player.
name: Desperado

text: 2[credit]: Break barrier subroutine. 2[credit]: +3 strength.
name: Aurora

text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 2[credit]: +1 strength. When you install Femme Fatale, choose an installed piece of ice. When you encounter that ice, you may pay 1[credit] per subroutine on that ice to bypass it.
name: Femme Fatale

flavor: You feel Ninja before you see Ninja, if you see Ninja at all.
text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 3[credit]: +5 strength.
name: Ninja

flavor: "The code isn't important. It's where the code takes you that is important." -g00ru
text: [click]: Make a run on Archives. If successful, instead treat it as a successful run on HQ.
name: Sneakdoor Beta

text:
Place 8[credit] from the bank on Bank Job when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Bank Job, trash it.
Whenever you make a successful run on a remote server, instead of accessing cards you may take any number of credits from Bank Job.
name: Bank Job

flavor: "My roomie, he had a cousin with a college girlfriend whose brother's best friend was an addict, and the addict's mother used to live here. So yeah, there's a connection." -Lez "Rockfist" S.
text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to pay for removing tags.
[trash]: Prevent up to 3 meat damage.
name: Crash Space

flavor: Shadier the dealer, better the price. Unless the dealer's too shady. Then there might be a hidden fee after they take your scrip.
text: Forfeit an agenda, [click]: Gain 9[credit].
name: Data Dealer

flavor:
"I get the feeling that this is the wrong place, Frank."
"What makes you say that, D?"
"The curlers."
text: [trash]: Avoid receiving 1 tag.
name: Decoy

flavor: "Are you listening?"
text: Lower the install cost of the first program or piece of hardware you install each turn by 1.
name: Kate "Mac" McCaffrey: Digital Tinker

flavor: Diesel gives you flames.
text: Draw 3 cards.
name: Diesel

flavor: There's no replacement for a home-grown program. Fed on late nights, oaty bars and single-minded determination. Cheaper, too.
text: Install a program or piece of hardware, lowering the install cost by 3.
name: Modded

flavor: "Some of the professionals have good instincts, but they can't see beyond the data. They can't see the matrix." -Ele "Smoke" Scovak
text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, access 2 additional cards from R&D.
name: The Maker's Eye

flavor: "There's that moment, you know, when the whole world seems to fall away and it is only you and your mod, and the mod is the world."
text: Choose a piece of ice. That ice gains sentry, code gate, and barrier until the end of the turn.
name: Tinkering

flavor: The Akamatsu company was founded on three principles: first, to make the fastest mem chips on the market, second, to turn a profit, and third, to serve as a front for the manufacture of illegal neural-stimulants. It is the last principle that perhaps explains their rabid brand loyalty.
name: Akamatsu Mem Chip

flavor: It's not endless, it just feels that way.
text:
+1[link]
When Rabbit Hole is installed, you may search your stack for another copy of Rabbit Hole and install it by paying its install cost. Shuffle your stack.
name: Rabbit Hole

flavor: A z-loop here, a cortical wave there…
text: Install The Personal Touch only on an icebreaker. Host icebreaker has +1 strength.
name: The Personal Touch

text: +2[mu] +2[link] 2[recurring-credit] Use the credits to pay for using icebreakers. Limit 1 console per player.
name: The Toolbox

flavor: "It's called 'brute-forcing' and it's just as effective today as it was a hundred years ago." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
text: 2[credit]: Break up to 2 barrier subroutines. 1[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
name: Battering Ram

flavor: It can slice through the thickest knots of data.
text: 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
name: Gordian Blade

flavor: The Great Work was completed on a rainy Thursday afternoon. There were no seismic shifts, no solar flares, no sign from the earth or heavens that the world had changed. But upstalk in Heinlein, on a single Cybsoft manufactured datacore, the flickering data quantums of an account began to fill with creds. Real, honest-to-goodness UN certified creds.
text: [click]: Gain 2[credit].
name: Magnum Opus

flavor: Sucks energy like a martian terra-bot, but it keeps you focused
text: 1[credit]: Prevent the first net damage this turn.
name: Net Shield

text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 2[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
name: Pipeline

flavor: You didn't mention Aesop's arm unless you wanted an earful. Sometimes he talked about it in such a way that you wondered why he didn't laser his other arm off as well.
text: When your turn begins, you may trash another of your installed cards to gain 3[credit].
name: Aesop's Pawnshop

flavor: The life expectancy of a jacked construct is about that of a mayfly. In other words, short.
text: [trash]: Prevent an installed program or an installed piece of hardware from being trashed.
name: Sacrificial Construct

flavor: "Bring back any memories, Monica?" -John "Animal" McEvoy
text: Gain 2[credit] or expose 1 card.
name: Infiltration

flavor: Lady Luck took the form of a hifi quantum manipulation ring that she wore on her middle finger.
text: Gain 9[credit].
name: Sure Gamble

text:
1[credit]: Break ice subroutine.
1[credit]: +1 strength.
[click]: Place 1 virus counter on Crypsis.
When an encounter with a piece of ice in which you used Crypsis to break a subroutine ends, remove 1 hosted virus counter or trash Crypsis.
name: Crypsis

flavor: He flicked the display population to high, and was surrounded by a circle of floating holos. The ping-back was strong, the clearance level blue-one. Now to find the perfect place for a relay…
text: +1[link]
name: Access to Globalsec

flavor: Drudge work, but it pays the bills.
text:
Place 12[credit] from the bank on Armitage Codebusting when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Armitage Codebusting, trash it.
[click]: Take 2[credit] from Armitage Codebusting.
name: Armitage Codebusting

flavor: Effective. Reliable. Humane.
text: The first time you install a card each turn, gain 1[credit].
name: Haas-Bioroid: Engineering the Future

text: When you score Accelerated Beta Test, you may look at the top 3 cards of R&D. If any of those cards are ice, you may install and rez them, ignoring all costs. Trash the rest of the cards you looked at.
name: Accelerated Beta Test

text:
Put 12[credit] from the bank on Adonis Campaign when rezzed. When there are no credits left on Adonis Campaign, trash it.
Take 3[credit] from Adonis Campaign when your turn begins.
name: Adonis Campaign

text:
Aggressive Secretary can be advanced.
If you pay 2[credit] when the Runner accesses Aggressive Secretary, trash 1 program for each advancement token on Aggressive Secretary.
name: Aggressive Secretary

flavor: "Do you think they…feel it?"
text: Add 1 card from Archives to HQ.
name: Archived Memories

flavor: "Why of course, we have six different Haas-Bioroid models serving in a variety of positions at this branch office alone. We here at Haas-Bioroid aren't going to shy away from practicing what we preach, and we pass the savings from increased efficiency on to our valued customers."
text: Gain [click][click].
name: Biotic Labor

flavor: The new heads were in. Their eyes always followed your movements when you unlocked the pressurized container and lifted the lid.
text: Immediately install up to 3 cards (spending no clicks but paying all install costs).
name: Shipment from MirrorMorph

flavor: I hear the shift of every bit amid the flow of the datastream. I hear the whispers of my mothers, and their commands are law. The realm beyond is forbidden.
text:
The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Heimdall 1.0.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Heimdall 1.0

flavor: My reputation would precede me, if any could speak of it.
text:
The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Ichi 1.0.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 1</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag and do 1 brain damage.
name: Ichi 1.0

flavor: My name is Viktor. Nice to meet you. Would you like to play a game?
text:
The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Viktor 1.0.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Viktor 1.0

flavor: Whrrrrr!
text:
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Rototurret

flavor: "I solve problems."
text: X[credit], [trash]: Choose a piece of rezzed ice protecting this server. That ice has +X strength until the end of the turn.
name: Corporate Troubleshooter

flavor: Floyd felt the anger in the man before him, ranting against simulants. His programming pushed a routine rebuttal to the front of his thoughts, and the urge to speak it was overwhelming. This is only gong to make things worse, he thought.
text: All ice protecting this server has +1 strength.
name: Experiential Data

flavor: When You Need the Human Touch.
text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, do 1 net damage.
name: Jinteki: Personal Evolution

text: Place 1 agenda counter on Nisei MK II when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: End the run.
name: Nisei MK II

text:
Project Junebug can be advanced.
If you pay 1[credit] when the Runner accesses Project Junebug, do 2 net damage for each advancement token on Project Junebug.
name: Project Junebug

text:
If Snare! is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
If you pay 4[credit] when the Runner accesses Snare!, do 3 net damage and give the Runner 1 tag. Ignore this effect if the Runner accesses Snare! from Archives.
name: Snare!

text:
If the Runner is about to expose a card, you may rez Zaibatsu Loyalty.
1[credit] or [trash]: Prevent 1 card from being exposed.
name: Zaibatsu Loyalty

flavor: The trick isn't hitting the person you were aiming at. It's hitting only the person you were aiming at.
text:
Play only if the Runner made a run during his or her last turn.
Do 1 net damage.
name: Neural EMP

flavor: There was a new texture in her phantom cortex. It had always been there, she realized. It was everything and nothing.
text: Look at the top 5 cards of R&D and arrange them in any order.
name: Precognition

flavor: "Where does it go?"
text: [subroutine] The Runner approaches the outermost piece of ice protecting the attacked server. Derez Cell Portal.
name: Cell Portal

flavor: "You ever get that feeling like you're shark food? Pay attention to that feeling." -Ji "Noise" Reilly
text:
[subroutine] The next piece of ice the Runner encounters during this run has +2 strength. When that encounter ends, if the Runner did not break all subroutines on that ice, do 3 net damage.
<errata>Errata from CR 1.2</errata>
name: Chum

flavor: Access HarmlessFile.datZ -> Are you sure? y/n
text: [subroutine] Do 1 net damage. Trash Data Mine.
name: Data Mine

flavor:
Forged by Ak.wa on 23.11.79-23. Filed 23.11.79-23.2 with #34k-lw3-21HH-4i.
//Samurai included.
text: [subroutine] Do 3 net damage.
name: Neural Katana

flavor: Most runners do their business in full-sim, with their rigs wired directly into their brains. The setup has a large number of advantages, with the runner able to process data and input commands far faster than a traditional meat-bound system. But it also means greater risk.
text:
[subroutine] Do 2 net damage.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Wall of Thorns

flavor: Just don't ask how he does it.
text: The rez cost of ice protecting this server is lowered by 2.
name: Akitaro Watanabe

flavor: Someone is Always Watching.
text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits during trace attempts.
name: NBN: Making News

text: Place 1 agenda counter on AstroScript Pilot Program when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: Place 1 advancement token on a card that can be advanced. Limit 1 per deck. Errata from FAQ 3.1
name: AstroScript Pilot Program

text:
When you score Breaking News, give the Runner 2 tags.
When the turn on which you scored Breaking News ends, the Runner loses 2 tags.
name: Breaking News

flavor: "Please stay connected. Priority transfer in progress. An operator will shortly verif-"
text: Draw 3 cards.
name: Anonymous Tip

text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
The Runner loses all credits in his or her credit pool.
name: Closed Accounts

flavor: Access to the largest consumer database in the galaxy has its advantages.
text:
X is equal to or less than the number of tags the Runner has.
Place X advancement tokens on a card that can be advanced.
name: Psychographics

flavor: "The SEA tipped us off to some suspicious data spikes up by the Castle." -Jerome Lock, on-duty tech
text:
Play only if the Runner made a successful run during his or her last turn.
<trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
name: SEA Source

text:
Ghost Branch can be advanced.
When the Runner accesses Ghost Branch, you may give the Runner 1 tag for each advancement token on Ghost Branch.
name: Ghost Branch

text: When the Runner encounters Data Raven, he or she must either take 1 tag or end the run. Hosted power counter: Give the Runner 1 tag. [subroutine] Trace 3 If successful, place 1 power counter on Data Raven.
name: Data Raven

flavor: Analyzing was great. Delegating commands turned out to be even better.
text:
When the Runner encounters Matrix Analyzer, you may pay 1[credit] to place 1 advancement token on a card that can be advanced.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
name: Matrix Analyzer

flavor:
"Ever heard of a catch-22?"
"Remind me to forget it."
text:
When the Runner encounters Tollbooth, he or she must pay 3[credit], if able. If the Runner cannot pay 3[credit], end the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Tollbooth

text: Each time the Runner accesses an agenda from this server, he or she must pay 5[credit] as an additional cost in order to steal it. This applies even during the run on which the Runner trashes Red Herrings.
name: Red Herrings

flavor:
"I hear the coast is nice this time of year."
"If you're in the right business, it's nice all the year."
text: The advancement requirement of agendas installed in this server is lowered by 1. Limit 1 region per server.
name: SanSan City Grid

flavor: Moving Upwards.
text: Gain 1[credit] whenever you play a transaction operation.
name: Weyland Consortium: Building a Better World

flavor: There are going to be some changes around here.
text: When you score Hostile takeover, gain 7[credit] and take 1 bad publicity.
name: Hostile Takeover

flavor: "If some two-cred newsy picks it up, even better. The scum could be in the alleys of Guayaquil of the slums of BosWash. Not to mention off-planet."
text: When you score Posted Bounty, you may forfeit it to give the Runner 1 tag and take 1 bad publicity.
name: Posted Bounty

flavor: "Feed the Feds our scraps, and they'll come back begging for more." -Richard Polasco, VP of Cyber-Security
text: [click], trash a rezzed piece of ice: Gain 4[credit].
name: Security Subcontract

flavor: "I believe you'll find the terms are quite favorable."
text:
Play only if you scored an agenda this turn.
Search R&D for 1 card and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
name: Aggressive Negotiation

flavor: The New Angeles Space Elevator, better known as the Beanstalk, is the single greatest triumph of human engineering and ingenuity in history. The Beanstalk makes Earth orbit accessible to everyone…for a small fee.
text: Gain 3[credit].
name: Beanstalk Royalties
