flavor: "I'd like to remind the ladies and gentlemen of the press that several of the buildings damaged in the blast were owned by Weyland Consortium subsidiaries…"
text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
Do 4 meat damage.
name: Scorched Earth

flavor:
"And then there's these two crates. No eID."
"Just leave those with me and forget you ever saw them."
text: Place 1 advancement token on each of up to 2 different installed cards that can be advanced.
name: Shipment from Kaguya

flavor: Next time, read the Terms of Service more carefully. Or you might find yourself in the danger zone.
text:
As an additional cost to rez Archer, the Corp must forfeit an agenda.
[subroutine] The Corp gains 2[credit].
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Archer

flavor: "He had a bit of an ego, ol' Hadrian. His constructs live up to it though." -g00ru
text:
Hadrian's Wall can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement token on it.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Hadrian's Wall

flavor: "I asked for ice as impenetrable as a wall. I can't decide if someone down in R&D has a warped sense of humor or just a very literal mind." -Liz Campbell, VP Project Security
text:
Ice Wall can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement token on it.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Ice Wall

flavor: Who knows what evil lurks in the memory diamonds of men? Weyland knows. -unsigned cyber-graffiti
text:
Shadow can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement token on it.
[subroutine] The Corp gains 2[credit].
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
name: Shadow

flavor: "Jack Weyland built the Beanstalk and transformed the human race forever. I can't wait to see what we're going to do next."
text:
Install only in the root of HQ.
Your maximum hand size is +2.
name: Research Station

flavor: "If it isn't in my terminal by six p.m., heads are going to roll!"
text: When you score Priority Requisition, you may rez a piece of ice ignoring all costs.
name: Priority Requisition

flavor: "Expensive? Not when you're protecting a fortune as large as ours."
text: If the Runner is tagged, Private Security Force gains: "[click]: Do 1 meat damage."
name: Private Security Force

flavor: "The mining bosses are worse than any downstalk crime lords. Tri-Maf, 4K, Yak, I don't care what gangs you got down there. In Heinlein there's just one law: the He3 must flow." -"Old" Rick Henry, escaped clone.
text: [click], [click], [click]: Gain 7[credit].
name: Melange Mining Corp.

flavor: It is like the one you just bought, only better.
text: Gain 1[credit] when your turn begins.
name: PAD Campaign

flavor: Hedge Fund. Noun. An ingenious device by which the rich get richer even while every other poor SOB is losing his shirt. -The Anarch's Dictionary, Volume Who's Counting?
text: Gain 9[credit].
name: Hedge Fund

flavor:
"Hey, hey! Wake up man. You were under a long time. What'd you see?"
"I…don't remember."
text:
[subroutine] The Runner loses [click], if able.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Enigma

flavor:
.//run/hunter-tr/return=true
client/sec256IPv7->confirm? /y
3926:0HB7:1001:2NB1:1601:7784:ERROR
text: [subroutine] <trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
name: Hunter

flavor: "There's nothing worse than seeing that beautiful blue ball of data just out of reach as your connection derezzes. I think they do it just to taunt us." -Ele "Smoke" Scovak
text: [subroutine] End the run.
name: Wall of Static

flavor: "Analyzing the board won't help. Your mistake was thinking we're playing the same game."
text: The rez cost of the first piece of ice rezzed each turn is increased by 1.
name: Reina Roja: Freedom Fighter

flavor: You ever set something on fire just to watch it burn?
text:
Run HQ or R&D. During that run, you may pay 0[credit] to trash any card you are accessing (even if it has no trash cost).
<errata>Errata from CR 1.2</errata>
name: Demolition Run

text: Make a run on Archives. If successful, instead of accessing cards you may install a program from your heap, ignoring all costs.
name: Retrieval Run

text:
Run a remote server. If successful, instead of accessing cards, trash all cards installed in that server.
<errata>Errata from CR 1.2</errata>
name: Singularity

text: Make a run, and gain 9[credit], which you may use only during this run. After the run is completed, suffer 1 brain damage (cannot be prevented) and return to the bank any of the 9[credit] not spent.
name: Stimhack

flavor: I feel almost naked without it
text: 1[recurring-credit] Use this credit to pay for using icebreakers or for installing virus programs.
name: Cyberfeeder

text: +1[mu], 2[recurring-credit] Use these credits to pay for using icebreakers. Whenever there is a successful trace during a run, suffer 1 brain damage. Limit 1 console per player.
name: Spinal Modem

text:
2[credit]: Break ice subroutine.
X is the number of virus counters on Darwin.
When your turn begins, you may pay 1[credit] to place 1 virus counter on Darwin.
name: Darwin

text: Whenever you make a successful run on a central server, place 1 virus counter on Datasucker. Hosted virus counter: Rezzed piece of ice currently being encountered has -1 strength until the end of the encounter.
name: Datasucker

flavor: It always strikes twice.
text: 2[credit]: Break up to 2 code gate subroutines. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
name: Force of Nature

flavor: Something wicked this way comes.
text: Place 2 virus counters on Imp when it is installed. Once per turn, you may remove 1 hosted virus counter to trash a card you are accessing (even if it has no trash cost). Errata from CR 1.2
name: Imp

flavor: Bleeding data is more of a science than an art. Too much and you can end up with a one-way ticket to flatline city. Not enough and you might as well be running an empty server.
text: Whenever you make a successful run, place 1 virus counter on Hemorrhage. [click], 2 hosted virus counters: The Corp trashes 1 card from HQ.
name: Hemorrhage

flavor: November 5th: the day when all would see the corrupt machinations of the corporate oligarchy.
text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine.
name: Mimic

flavor: Weaponizing the heavens, one star at a time.
text: 1[credit]: Break any number of barrier subroutines.
name: Morning Star

flavor: In the public consciousness, there's a hard line between corp and runner. In the real world, things are a little more porous. The corp need the best hackers to run their networks, and some of the best hackers are ex-runners who like the idea of a regular paycheck. But sometimes things run the other way, and someone on the inside makes something like this.
text: All ice is encountered with its strength lowered by 1.
name: Ice Carver

flavor: It's easier to spend when it's not your money.
text:
Place 16[credit] from the bank on Liberated Account when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Liberated Account, trash it.
[click]: Take 4[credit] from Liberated Account.
name: Liberated Account

flavor: "They're mindless tools of destruction, good for little else. Nice guys, though. Some of my best friends are scrubbers." -Ji "Noise" Reilly
text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to trash cards.
name: Scrubber

flavor:
And all should cry, Beware! Beware!
His flashing eyes, his floating hair!
Weave a circle round him thrice,
And close your eyes with holy dread,
For he on honey-dew hath fed,
And drunk the milk of Paradise.
-Samuel Taylor Coleridge
text: The rez cost of all ice is increased by 1.
name: Xanadu

flavor: "Of course I steal from the rich. They're the ones with all the money."
text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ each turn, gain 2[credit].
name: Gabriel Santiago: Consummate Professional

flavor: "Hey kid, you fire that up now, bound to be vamped real bad. Some real pathetic individuals around here. But thankfully I got just the ticket…"
text: Gain 3[credit].
name: Easy Mark

flavor: "Think of it as a virtual shock collar for punishing corporate pets." -Andromeda
text:
Play only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn.
Derez a piece of ice.
name: Emergency Shutdown

flavor: As the hysteria in the room climbed higher up the corporate chain, an uneasy feeling of joblessness began to sink in on the lower rungs.
text: Choose an unrezzed piece of ice. The Corp must either rez that ice or trash it.
name: Forged Activation Orders

flavor: "Hey, listen, I'm not asking you to do anything dangerous. Just let me into the building. And tell me which room has the weakest security. And please don't say 'the bathroom' again."
text: Make a run. Bypass the first piece of ice encountered during this run.
name: Inside Job

flavor: Feverishly tracking its frustratingly slow progress across the Pacific, the package finally shows up hours later…
text: Search your stack for an icebreaker, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.
name: Special Order

flavor: Twice the fun.
text: +1[mu] Once per turn, you may immediately make another run when a successful run ends. Limit 1 console per player.
name: Doppelgänger

flavor: If you don't have someone on the inside, find someone on the inside who's fond of desk ornaments.
text: Whenever you access cards from HQ, access 1 additional card from HQ.
name: HQ Interface

text: 2[credit]: Break barrier subroutine. 2[credit]: +3 strength.
name: Aurora

flavor: Do you believe in faeries?
text: 0[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength. When an encounter with a piece of ice in which you used Faerie to break a subroutine ends, trash Faerie.
name: Faerie

text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 2[credit]: +1 strength. When you install Femme Fatale, choose an installed piece of ice. When you encounter that ice, you may pay 1[credit] per subroutine on that ice to bypass it.
name: Femme Fatale

flavor: Show-off.
text: 2[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 2[credit]: +3 strength.
name: Peacock

text:
X[recurring-credit]
Use these credits during runs on HQ. X is the number of virus counters on Pheromones.
Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, place 1 virus counter on Pheromones.
name: Pheromones

flavor: "The code isn't important. It's where the code takes you that is important." -g00ru
text: [click]: Make a run on Archives. If successful, instead treat it as a successful run on HQ.
name: Sneakdoor Beta

text:
Place 8[credit] from the bank on Bank Job when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Bank Job, trash it.
Whenever you make a successful run on a remote server, instead of accessing cards you may take any number of credits from Bank Job.
name: Bank Job

flavor: "My roomie, he had a cousin with a college girlfriend whose brother's best friend was an addict, and the addict's mother used to live here. So yeah, there's a connection." -Lez "Rockfist" S.
text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to pay for removing tags.
[trash]: Prevent up to 3 meat damage.
name: Crash Space

flavor: There are good, honest, hardworking cops in the NAPD. Officers who do their best to bring justice to the guilty and protect the innocent. Fortunately for the criminals, they're outnumbered by the other kind. The kind who are much easier to work with.
text:
[trash]: Prevent another installed resource from being trashed.
[trash]: Gain 2[credit].
name: Fall Guy

flavor:
"We're always happy to help, Mr. Santiago."
"I appreciate it, Mr. Li."
"We'll be in touch. And, Gabriel…"
"Yes?"
"Don't leave town."
text: [click]: Draw 2 cards. Add 1 of these cards to the bottom of your stack.
name: Mr. Li

flavor: "Have you met Dinosaurus?"
name: Chaos Theory: Wünderkind

flavor: Diesel gives you flames.
text: Draw 3 cards.
name: Diesel

flavor: A little corporate restructuring is necessary once in a while.
text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, instead of accessing cards you may look at the top 5 cards of R&D and arrange them in any order.
name: Indexing

flavor: There's no replacement for a home-grown program. Fed on late nights, oaty bars and single-minded determination. Cheaper, too.
text: Install a program or piece of hardware, lowering the install cost by 3.
name: Modded

flavor: When you're this good, it's hard not to grow a fan base.
text:
Play only if you made a successful run on R&D, HQ, and Archives this turn.
Add Notoriety to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.
name: Notoriety

text: Search your stack or heap for a program. Install that program, ignoring all costs. Shuffle your stack if you searched it. When this turn ends, add the program to the top of your stack if it is still installed.
name: Test Run

flavor: "Some of the professionals have good instincts, but they can't see beyond the data. They can't see the matrix." -Ele "Smoke" Scovak
text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, access 2 additional cards from R&D.
name: The Maker's Eye

flavor: "There's that moment, you know, when the whole world seems to fall away and it is only you and your mod, and the mod is the world."
text: Choose a piece of ice. That ice gains sentry, code gate, and barrier until the end of the turn.
name: Tinkering

text: Dinosaurus can host a single non-AI icebreaker. The memory cost of the hosted icebreaker does not count against your memory limit. Hosted icebreaker has +2 strength. Limit 1 console per player.
name: Dinosaurus

flavor: It's not endless, it just feels that way.
text:
+1[link]
When Rabbit Hole is installed, you may search your stack for another copy of Rabbit Hole and install it by paying its install cost. Shuffle your stack.
name: Rabbit Hole

flavor: A z-loop here, a cortical wave there…
text: Install The Personal Touch only on an icebreaker. Host icebreaker has +1 strength.
name: The Personal Touch

flavor: "It's called 'brute-forcing' and it's just as effective today as it was a hundred years ago." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
text: 2[credit]: Break up to 2 barrier subroutines. 1[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
name: Battering Ram

flavor: It can slice through the thickest knots of data.
text: 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
name: Gordian Blade

flavor: The Great Work was completed on a rainy Thursday afternoon. There were no seismic shifts, no solar flares, no sign from the earth or heavens that the world had changed. But upstalk in Heinlein, on a single Cybsoft manufactured datacore, the flickering data quantums of an account began to fill with creds. Real, honest-to-goodness UN certified creds.
text: [click]: Gain 2[credit].
name: Magnum Opus

text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 2[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
name: Pipeline

flavor: You didn't mention Aesop's arm unless you wanted an earful. Sometimes he talked about it in such a way that you wondered why he didn't laser his other arm off as well.
text: When your turn begins, you may trash another of your installed cards to gain 3[credit].
name: Aesop's Pawnshop

flavor: "I don't care what the studies show. From my experience, I can ingest three cans of Diesel an hour for up to twelve hours before going into cardiac arrest." -heard during the eleventh hour
text: [click], [trash]: Gain [click][click].
name: All-nighter

flavor: The life expectancy of a jacked construct is about that of a mayfly. In other words, short.
text: [trash]: Prevent an installed program or an installed piece of hardware from being trashed.
name: Sacrificial Construct

flavor: "Bring back any memories, Monica?" -John "Animal" McEvoy
text: Gain 2[credit] or expose 1 card.
name: Infiltration

flavor: Lady Luck took the form of a hifi quantum manipulation ring that she wore on her middle finger.
text: Gain 9[credit].
name: Sure Gamble

flavor: Archaic but reliable.
text: +1[mu], +1[link]
name: Dyson Mem Chip

text:
1[credit]: Break ice subroutine.
1[credit]: +1 strength.
[click]: Place 1 virus counter on Crypsis.
When an encounter with a piece of ice in which you used Crypsis to break a subroutine ends, remove 1 hosted virus counter or trash Crypsis.
name: Crypsis

flavor: Drudge work, but it pays the bills.
text:
Place 12[credit] from the bank on Armitage Codebusting when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Armitage Codebusting, trash it.
[click]: Take 2[credit] from Armitage Codebusting.
name: Armitage Codebusting

flavor: "My boss rewards quality work. If you know what's good for you, you'll keep it up."
text: When your turn begins, gain 1[credit] if you have at least 2[link].
name: Underworld Contact

flavor: A Different Breed of Machine.
text: All bioroid ice has +1 strength.
name: Haas-Bioroid: Stronger Together

flavor: Who wants to start a war?
text: When you score Project Ares, the Runner trashes 1 of his or her installed cards for each advancement token on Project Ares over 4. If the Runner trashes at least 1 card, take 1 bad publicity.
name: Project Ares

text: When you score Project Vitruvius, place 1 agenda counter on it for each advancement token on it over 3. Hosted agenda counter: Add 1 card from Archives to HQ.
name: Project Vitruvius

text:
Put 12[credit] from the bank on Adonis Campaign when rezzed. When there are no credits left on Adonis Campaign, trash it.
Take 3[credit] from Adonis Campaign when your turn begins.
name: Adonis Campaign

text:
Aggressive Secretary can be advanced.
If you pay 2[credit] when the Runner accesses Aggressive Secretary, trash 1 program for each advancement token on Aggressive Secretary.
name: Aggressive Secretary

flavor: I hear the shift of every bit amid the flow of the datastream. I hear the whispers of my mothers, and their commands are law. The realm beyond is forbidden.
text:
The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Heimdall 1.0.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Heimdall 1.0

flavor: I'm not here to play games. The game is over.
text:
The Runner may spend [click] to break any subroutine on Hudson 1.0.
[subroutine] The Runner cannot access more than 1 card during this run.
[subroutine] The Runner cannot access more than 1 card during this run.
name: Hudson 1.0

flavor: My reputation would precede me, if any could speak of it.
text:
The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Ichi 1.0.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 1</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag and do 1 brain damage.
name: Ichi 1.0

flavor: Whrrrrr!
text:
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Rototurret

flavor: My name is Viktor. Nice to meet you. Would you like to play a game?
text:
The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Viktor 1.0.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Viktor 1.0

flavor: "Do you think they…feel it?"
text: Add 1 card from Archives to HQ.
name: Archived Memories

flavor: "Why of course, we have six different Haas-Bioroid models serving in a variety of positions at this branch office alone. We here at Haas-Bioroid aren't going to shy away from practicing what we preach, and we pass the savings from increased efficiency on to our valued customers."
text: Gain [click][click].
name: Biotic Labor

flavor: Green-two clearance is the highest level of security a corp can gain access to. Legally, anyway.
text: Gain 3[credit] and draw 1 card.
name: Green Level Clearance

flavor: The new heads were in. Their eyes always followed your movements when you unlocked the pressurized container and lifted the lid.
text: Install up to 3 cards from HQ (one at a time and paying all install costs).
name: Shipment from MirrorMorph

flavor: "Eyes forward please."
text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, <trace>trace 4</trace> if successful, the Runner cannot access any cards other than Ash 2X3ZB9CY for the remainder of this run.
name: Ash 2X3ZB9CY

text: Each time the Runner accesses an agenda from this server, he or she must spend [click] as an additional cost in order to steal it. This applies even during the run on which the Runner trashes Strongbox.
name: Strongbox

flavor: When You Need the Human Touch.
text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, do 1 net damage.
name: Jinteki: Personal Evolution

text:
When you score Braintrust, place 1 agenda counter on it for every 2 advancement tokens on it over 3.
The rez cost of all ice is lowered by 1 for each agenda counter on Braintrust.
name: Braintrust

text: Place 1 agenda counter on Nisei MK II when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: End the run.
name: Nisei MK II

text:
Project Junebug can be advanced.
If you pay 1[credit] when the Runner accesses Project Junebug, do 2 net damage for each advancement token on Project Junebug.
name: Project Junebug

flavor: "I will serve you…for a time."
text:
Ronin can be advanced.
If there are at least 4 advancement tokens on Ronin, it gains "[click], [trash]: Do 3 net damage."
name: Ronin

text:
If Snare! is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
If you pay 4[credit] when the Runner accesses Snare!, do 3 net damage and give the Runner 1 tag. Ignore this effect if the Runner accesses Snare! from Archives.
name: Snare!

flavor: Himitsu-Bako is a simple ice barrier that appears as a digital puzzle box. What makes it special is the ease with which it can be uninstalled and installed in a different server, throwing up barriers in unexpected places and giving any intruder a curious feeling of déjà vu.
text:
1[credit]: Add Himitsu-Bako to HQ.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Himitsu-Bako

flavor:
Forged by Ak.wa on 23.11.79-23. Filed 23.11.79-23.2 with #34k-lw3-21HH-4i.
//Samurai included.
text: [subroutine] Do 3 net damage.
name: Neural Katana

flavor: Writing a program that can pass the Turing test is easy. The Gibson-Akamatsu test is a higher bar, and the only AIs to clear it thus far have been the androids. Even some humans have been known to fail.
text: The Runner cannot use AI programs to break subroutines on Swordsman. [subroutine] Trash 1 AI program. [subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
name: Swordsman

flavor: Most runners do their business in full-sim, with their rigs wired directly into their brains. The setup has a large number of advantages, with the runner able to process data and input commands far faster than a traditional meat-bound system. But it also means greater risk.
text:
[subroutine] Do 2 net damage.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Wall of Thorns

flavor: "This ice sucks." -g00ru
text: [subroutine] The Runner cannot jack out for the remainder of this run. Trash Whirlpool.
name: Whirlpool

flavor: The 'cyber-war' is a war of information, and in a war of information, advance warning can be as good as a killing blow. -Michael Muhama, Musings on Cybercrime
text:
[subroutine] Look at the top card of R&D. You may add that card to the bottom of R&D.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
name: Yagura

flavor: When Miranda Rhapsody showed up with a teacup giraffe, suddenly everybody wanted one.
text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Reveal up to 5 cards in HQ to the Runner. Gain 2[credit] for each card revealed.
name: Celebrity Gift

flavor: The trick isn't hitting the person you were aiming at. It's hitting only the person you were aiming at.
text:
Play only if the Runner made a run during his or her last turn.
Do 1 net damage.
name: Neural EMP

flavor: Smoke and mirrors optional.
text: Move up to 2 advancement tokens from a card to another installed card that can be advanced.
name: Trick of Light

flavor: Despite its appearance, the Hokusai Grid is the most notorious research facility at Jinteki.
text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, do 1 net damage. Limit 1 region per server.
name: Hokusai Grid

flavor: Someone is Always Watching.
text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits during trace attempts.
name: NBN: Making News

text:
When you score Project Beale, place 1 agenda counter on it for every 2 advancement tokens on it over 3.
Project Beale is worth 1 additional agenda point for each agenda counter on it.
name: Project Beale

flavor: "The damn raven just kind of cawed at me as I went past. I should have known it was too good to be true."
text:
If TGTBT is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses TGTBT, give the Runner 1 tag.
name: TGTBT

text:
Ghost Branch can be advanced.
When the Runner accesses Ghost Branch, you may give the Runner 1 tag for each advancement token on Ghost Branch.
name: Ghost Branch

text: When the Runner encounters Data Raven, he or she must either take 1 tag or end the run. Hosted power counter: Give the Runner 1 tag. [subroutine] Trace 3 If successful, place 1 power counter on Data Raven.
name: Data Raven

flavor: A bright light blossomed, and then the console went dark. That's when she smelled smoke.
text: [subroutine]<trace>Trace 6</trace> If successful, trash 1 piece of hardware, do 2 meat damage (cannot be prevented), and end the run.
name: Flare

flavor: "Try to close it. Go on. See what it does." -Chaos Theory
text:
When the Runner encounters Pop-up Window, you gain 1[credit].
[subroutine] End the run unless the Runner pays 1[credit].
name: Pop-up Window

flavor:
"Ever heard of a catch-22?"
"Remind me to forget it."
text:
When the Runner encounters Tollbooth, he or she must pay 3[credit], if able. If the Runner cannot pay 3[credit], end the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Tollbooth

flavor: "It can make a real fine roller coaster, provided you're properly stimmed up." -Noise
text: If there is no installed fracter, Wraparound has +7 strength. [subroutine] End the run.
name: Wraparound

flavor: "Please stay connected. Priority transfer in progress. An operator will shortly verif-"
text: Draw 3 cards.
name: Anonymous Tip

text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
The Runner loses all credits in his or her credit pool.
name: Closed Accounts

flavor: Access to the largest consumer database in the galaxy has its advantages.
text:
X is equal to or less than the number of tags the Runner has.
Place X advancement tokens on a card that can be advanced.
name: Psychographics

flavor: "The SEA tipped us off to some suspicious data spikes up by the Castle." -Jerome Lock, on-duty tech
text:
Play only if the Runner made a successful run during his or her last turn.
<trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
name: SEA Source

text: Each time the Runner accesses an agenda from this server, he or she must pay 5[credit] as an additional cost in order to steal it. This applies even during the run on which the Runner trashes Red Herrings.
name: Red Herrings

flavor: Keeping tabs on the world, one screen at a time.
text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, <trace>trace 5</trace> if successful, give the Runner 1 tag. If unsuccessful, trash Bernice Mai.
name: Bernice Mai

flavor: Moving Upwards.
text: Gain 1[credit] whenever you play a transaction operation.
name: Weyland Consortium: Building a Better World

flavor: There are going to be some changes around here.
text: When you score Hostile Takeover, gain 7[credit] and take 1 bad publicity.
name: Hostile Takeover

text: When you score Project Atlas, place 1 agenda counter on it for each advancement token on it over 3. Hosted agenda counter: Search R&D for 1 card, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
name: Project Atlas

flavor: "I use bioroids because I can wipe their memories or just blow their brains out when the job is done. No witnesses means no witnesses."
text: Whenever you do meat damage, do 1 additional meat damage.
name: The Cleaners

flavor: They don't call them dedicated for nothing
text: If the Runner is tagged, Dedicated Response Team gains "Whenever a successful run ends, do 2 meat damage."
name: Dedicated Response Team

flavor: "It's not personal. Urban renewal is a necessity of the modern world. It's always someone's home, yours is no different."
text: When you rez Elizabeth Mills, remove 1 bad publicity. [click], [trash]: Trash 1 location. Take 1 bad publicity.
name: Elizabeth Mills

flavor: GRNDL refineries process many different rare elements unearthed during the fracking process.
text:
GRNDL Refinery can be advanced.
[click], [trash]: Gain 4[credit] for each advancement token on GRNDL Refinery.
name: GRNDL Refinery

flavor: Next time, read the Terms of Service more carefully. Or you might find yourself in the danger zone.
text:
As an additional cost to rez Archer, the Corp must forfeit an agenda.
[subroutine] The Corp gains 2[credit].
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Archer

flavor: A symbol of commerce, but beware its bite.
text:
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, the Corp gains 3[credit].
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, end the run.
name: Caduceus

flavor: "He had a bit of an ego, ol' Hadrian. His constructs live up to it though." -g00ru
text:
Hadrian's Wall can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement token on it.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Hadrian's Wall

text:
Hive loses an "[subroutine] End the run." subroutine for each agenda point in the Corp's score area.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Hive

flavor: "I asked for ice as impenetrable as a wall. I can't decide if someone down in R&D has a warped sense of humor or just a very literal mind." -Liz Campbell, VP Project Security
text:
Ice Wall can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement token on it.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Ice Wall

flavor: Who knows what evil lurks in the memory diamonds of men? Weyland knows. -unsigned cyber-graffiti
text:
Shadow can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement token on it.
[subroutine] The Corp gains 2[credit].
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
name: Shadow

flavor: The New Angeles Space Elevator, better known as the Beanstalk, is the single greatest triumph of human engineering and ingenuity in history. The Beanstalk makes Earth orbit accessible to everyone…for a small fee.
text: Gain 3[credit].
name: Beanstalk Royalties

flavor: "I'd say it's nothing personal, but corporations are people, too."
text: <trace>Trace 5</trace> If successful, do meat damage to the Runner equal to the number of printed agenda points on agendas he or she stole during his or her last turn.
name: Punitive Counterstrike

flavor:
"And then there's these two crates. No eID."
"Just leave those with me and forget you ever saw them."
text: Place 1 advancement token on each of up to 2 different installed cards that can be advanced.
name: Shipment from Kaguya

flavor: It didn't look like the headquarters of a multi-billion cred company. Probably because it wasn't.
text: Forfeit False Lead: The Runner loses [click][click], if able.
name: False Lead

flavor: "If it isn't in my terminal by six p.m., heads are going to roll!"
text: When you score Priority Requisition, you may rez a piece of ice ignoring all costs.
name: Priority Requisition

flavor: "Expensive? Not when you're protecting a fortune as large as ours."
text: If the Runner is tagged, Private Security Force gains: "[click]: Do 1 meat damage."
name: Private Security Force

flavor: "The mining bosses are worse than any downstalk crime lords. Tri-Maf, 4K, Yak, I don't care what gangs you got down there. In Heinlein there's just one law: the He3 must flow." -"Old" Rick Henry, escaped clone.
text: [click], [click], [click]: Gain 7[credit].
name: Melange Mining Corp.

flavor: It is like the one you just bought, only better.
text: Gain 1[credit] when your turn begins.
name: PAD Campaign

flavor:
"Hey, hey! Wake up man. You were under a long time. What'd you see?"
"I…don't remember."
text:
[subroutine] The Runner loses [click], if able.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Enigma

flavor:
.//run/hunter-tr/return=true
client/sec256IPv7->confirm? /y
3926:0HB7:1001:2NB1:1601:7784:ERROR
text: [subroutine] <trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
name: Hunter

flavor: "There's nothing worse than seeing that beautiful blue ball of data just out of reach as your connection derezzes. I think they do it just to taunt us." -Ele "Smoke" Scovak
text: [subroutine] End the run.
name: Wall of Static

flavor: Hedge Fund. Noun. An ingenious device by which the rich get richer even while every other poor SOB is losing his shirt. -The Anarch's Dictionary, Volume Who's Counting?
text: Gain 9[credit].
name: Hedge Fund

flavor:
"Amateurs feign it as 'random packet loss'. They do this for safety. They do this out of fear. But why should we cower? We will collapse the Corporatocracy, piece by piece! They are not the ones to fear. We are."
- Freedom Khumalo
text:
Whenever you access cards from R&D, access 1 additional card.
Trash eXer if the Corp purges virus counters.
name: eXer

flavor:
"It makes every bad thing that you do so much better."
- g00ru
text: Whenever you trash a Corp card, you may place 1 virus counter on Friday Chip. When your turn begins, you may move 1 hosted virus counter to a virus program.
name: Friday Chip

flavor: The smell of rot strengthens with each step.
text: Whenever you make a successful run on Archives, you may place 1 virus counter on Crypt. [click], [trash], 3 hosted virus counters: Search your stack for a virus program and install it (paying its install cost), then shuffle your stack.
name: Crypt

flavor: You'd think someone would have noticed a program entitled "Career Opportunities in Hacking" earlier.
text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The first time you install a card each turn, the Corp loses 1[credit].
name: Corporate "Grant"

flavor: "Go away! I'm not here!"
text: The first time you would take any number of tags or suffer any amount of net damage each turn, you may trash No One Home to force the Corp to "<trace>trace 0</trace> If unsuccessful, the Runner avoids any number of tags or prevents any amount of net damage."
name: No One Home

text: Make a run on a remote server. When the run ends, gain [click] and add Marathon to your grip instead of trashing it if the run was successful. You may not make another run on that server for the remainder of this turn.
name: Marathon

flavor: Ripples are all the prey sees before Gbahali swallows it whole.
text: [trash]: Break the last subroutine on the encountered piece of ice.
name: Gbahali

text:
Play only if you made a successful run on a central server this turn.
Force the Corp to "<trace>trace 3</trace> If unsuccessful, reveal all cards in HQ. The Runner may choose up to 2 of the revealed cards. Shuffle those cards into R&D."
name: White Hat

text:
When your turn begins, you may <trace>trace X</trace> If successful, do 1 brain damage and trash Kuwinda K4H1U3. If unsuccessful, place 1 power counter on Kuwinda K4H1U3.
X is the number of power counters on Kuwinda K4H1U3.
name: Kuwinda K4H1U3

flavor: Every level of protection for all of your security needs.
text: X is the number of rezzed NEXT ice. [subroutine] Draw up to X cards. [subroutine] Add up to X cards from Archives to HQ. [subroutine] Shuffle up to X cards from HQ into R&D.
name: NEXT Sapphire

text:
Whenever an encounter with Anansi ends, if the Runner did not break all subroutines on it, do 3 net damage.
[subroutine] Look at the top 5 cards of R&D and arrange them in any order.
[subroutine] You may draw 1 card. The Runner may pay 2[credit] to draw 1 card.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
<errata>Errata from CR 1.2</errata>
name: Anansi

flavor: for (;;)
text: When the Runner passes a rezzed piece of ice protecting this server, you may trash Code Replicator to force the Runner to approach that piece of ice again.
name: Code Replicator

text:
Choose one:
  • Purge virus counters. Trash 1 card from the top of the stack for every 3 virus counters removed.
  • Gain 2[credit].
name: Reverse Infection

text: When your turn ends, you may name a card type. Gain 2[credit] the first time each turn the Runner plays or installs a card that has the type you last named this way.
name: Azmari EdTech: Shaping the Future

flavor:
Master any subject in 30 minutes or less!*
*Azmari EdTech is not responsible for altered memories or reduced temporal lobe functionality. Level of mastery may vary.
text: As an additional cost to steal Degree Mill, the Runner must shuffle 2 installed Runner cards into the stack.
name: Degree Mill

flavor: "Welcome to Azmari Mail! You have 4,196 unread messages."
text: When your turn begins, the Runner draws 1 card, then you may gain 1[credit] for every 2 cards in the grip.
name: Personalized Portal

flavor: "The way I see it, you've got two options: die here or die running. I'll enjoy both."
text: When you score Armed Intimidation, the Runner must either suffer 5 meat damage or take 2 tags.
name: Armed Intimidation

flavor: The only certainties.
text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. Whenever the Runner installs a card or trashes an installed card, you may gain 1[credit].
name: Death and Taxes

text:
Play only if the Runner accessed at least 1 card during his or her last turn.
<trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, trash 1 installed program with an install cost equal to or less than the amount by which your trace strength exceeded the Runner's link strength.
name: Trojan Horse

text: The install cost of each program, piece of hardware, and virtual resource is increased by 1. Whenever the Runner installs a program, piece of hardware, or virtual resource, you may gain 1[credit].
name: TechnoCo

text:
[click]: Flip this identity.
The Runner pays 1[credit] more when spending a [click] to remove a tag (not through a card ability).
Flip side:
[click]: Flip this identity.
You may pay 2[credit] fewer when spending a [click] to trash a resource (not through a card ability).
name: SYNC: Everything, Everywhere

flavor: Nothing but the Truth.
text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, you may play 1 current from HQ or Archives (paying its play cost).
name: New Angeles Sol: Your News

flavor: We're ready to start the fire.
text: The first time each turn you rez an advertisement, the Runner loses 1[credit].
name: Spark Agency: Worldswide Reach

flavor: You had your shot, and you blew it.
text:
[click]: Shuffle 15 Minutes into R&D. The Corp can trigger this ability while 15 Minutes is in the Runner's score area.
Limit 1 per deck.
name: 15 Minutes

flavor: "The trick isn't software, it's hardware. Cyberspace is a collection of physical machines. If we control the machines, we control it all." -KR Kane, "Our Future"
text: All tracer ice have +1 strength. The base trace strength of each subroutine is increased by 1.
name: Improved Tracers

flavor: "Nobody ever lost a dollar by underestimating the taste of the public." -Phineas Taylor Barnum
text: All assets gain advertisement.
name: Rebranding Team

flavor: "Yes and No."
text:
If Quantum Predictive Model is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
If the Runner is tagged when Quantum Predictive Model is accessed, add it to your score area.
name: Quantum Predictive Model

flavor: "Live from New Angeles, this is Lily Lockwell."
text: When you rez Lily Lockwell, draw 3 cards. [click], remove 1 tag: Search R&D for an operation, reveal it, and shuffle the rest of R&D. Add the operation to the top of R&D.
name: Lily Lockwell

text:
If News Team is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses News Team, he or she must either take 2 tags or add News Team to his or her score area as an agenda worth -1 agenda point.
name: News Team

flavor: No one can bury a story better.
text:
[click]: Draw 1 card from the bottom of R&D.
[trash]: Search R&D or Archives for an agenda and reveal it. Shuffle the rest of R&D if you searched it. Add the agenda to the bottom of R&D.
name: Shannon Claire

text:
The Runner has 1 fewer [click] to spend during his or her turn.
If Victoria Jenkins is trashed while being accessed, add her to the Runner's score area as an agenda worth 2 agenda points.
name: Victoria Jenkins

flavor: "They're gonna try and make you a star. Whether you want it or not." -MaxX
text:
When you rez Reality Threedee, take 1 bad publicity.
When your turn begins, gain 1[credit] (or 2[credit] if the Runner is tagged).
name: Reality Threedee

text:
If Archangel is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
If you pay 3[credit] when the Runner accesses Archangel, he or she immediately encounters it. Ignore this ability if Archangel is accessed from Archives.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 6</trace> If successful, add 1 installed Runner card to his or her grip.
name: Archangel

flavor: "Most reporting these days can be done by AI. We just need the talent for the name recognition."
text: If a current is active, News Hound gains "[subroutine] End the run." after all its other subroutines. [subroutine] Trace 3 If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
name: News Hound

flavor: "In the Olden Times, a 'resistor" was a vital component of practically all electronic equipment. You know, back when dinosaurs roamed the Earth." -Chaos Theory
text:
Resistor has +1 strength for each tag the Runner has.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, end the run.
name: Resistor

flavor: "If I didn't know better, I'd say they got the better end of that deal." -John Masanori
text: [subroutine] The Corp gains 5[credit]. Trash Special Offer.
name: Special Offer

flavor: //tl;dr duplicate the subs on the next piece of ice
text: [subroutine] When the Runner encounters the next piece of ice during this run, that ice gains a second copy of each subroutine on it (after the original subroutine) for the remainder of the encounter.
name: TL;DR

flavor: "Stay out of the fast lanes! If speed's your only concern, you're already tagged and halfway to fragged." -g00ru
text:
When the Runner encounters Turnpike, he or she loses 1[credit].
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 5</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
name: Turnpike

flavor: The only thing worse than bad news...
text:
As an additional cost to play 24/7 News Cycle, forfeit an agenda.
Resolve the "when scored" ability on an agenda in your score area.
name: 24/7 News Cycle

text: As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click]. Install and rez (paying all costs) X advertisements from Archives and/or HQ, if able.
name: Ad Blitz

text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. Choose an agenda in the Runner's score area. Media Blitz gains the text of that agenda.
name: Media Blitz

flavor: "Only with perfect information can we develop the perfect strategy." -The Playbook
text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
Trash all resources. The Runner can remove 1 bad publicity to prevent this.
name: The All-Seeing I

text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. The Runner must spend credits first for each trace attempt during a run.
name: Surveillance Sweep

flavor: "We use ice on our servers. More runners should ice their own rigs."
text: [trash], remove 1 tag: Trash 1 program. Use this ability only during a run on this server.
name: Keegan Lane

flavor: To the worlds sitting on the couch and watching threedee, Rutherford District might as well be all of New Angeles.
text: The base trace strength of each trace during a run on this server is increased by 2. Limit 1 region per server.
name: Rutherford Grid

flavor: "Corporations are made up of people. It's ridiculous to think they'd be either all good or all bad." -Sunny Lebeau
text: Global Food Initiative is worth 1 fewer agenda point while in the Runner's score area.
name: Global Food Initiative

text:
Place 6[credit] from the bank on Launch Campaign when it is rezzed. When there are no credits left on Launch Campaign, trash it.
When your turn begins, take 2[credit] from Launch Campaign.
name: Launch Campaign

flavor: Bounce rate is a well-understood measure of ice strength. But it is not the only measure.
text:
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 5</trace> If successful, do 3 net damage.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, trash 1 program.
name: Assassin

text: You cannot install non-virtual resources. When your turn begins, you may install 1 card from your grip facedown.
name: Apex: Invasive Predator

text:
Play only if you made a successful run on HQ, R&D and Archives this turn.
Trash all installed Corp cards. Turn all installed Runner cards facedown.
name: Apocalypse

text: Make a run. Once during this run, when you pass a piece of ice, you may trash a number of your installed cards equal to the strength of that ice. If you do, trash that ice.
name: Prey

flavor: "Meantime the hellish tattoo of the heart increased. It grew quicker and quicker, and louder and louder every instant." -Edgar Allan Poe
text: +1[mu] Trash an installed card: Prevent 1 damage. Limit 1 console per player.
name: Heartbeat

flavor: "I've been monitoring the anomaly's activity across the New Angeles Pacifica and Andea trunk lines and associated nodes. I have yet to detect a predictable pattern or even to formulate a theory as to the anomaly's nature." -Joséo Greene, SYNC Analyst
text: Trash an installed card: Break "[subroutine] End the run." subroutine.
name: Endless Hunger

text: When Harbinger is trashed, install it facedown instead of adding it to your heap.
name: Harbinger

flavor: "There's parts of the Network now that are different from how they used to be. I can't put my finger on it; just something twitching at my ganglion through my BMI." -Reeve
text:
Once per turn, prevent a "when encountered" ability on a piece of ice.
[trash]: Install the top 3 cards of your stack facedown.
name: Hunting Grounds

flavor: Data goes in. Nothing comes out.
text: The first time each turn you trash 1 of your installed cards, gain 1[credit].
name: Wasteland

text: You start the game with 3 different directive cards installed (these cards are not considered part of your deck).
name: Adam: Compulsive Hacker

flavor: Adam raised the hammer. He was free.
text: Trash up to 5 of your installed cards. Draw 1 card for each card trashed (or 2 cards for each card trashed if you trashed at least 1 directive).
name: Independent Thinking

text: +X[mu] Your maximum hand size is increased by X. X is equal to the number of agenda points you have. Limit 1 console per player.
name: Brain Chip

flavor: Bioroids have two brains running in parallel, each capable of running sophisticated programming. There are certain advantages to the setup.
text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to pay for using programs.
name: Multithreader

flavor: The Second Directive requires a bioroid to complete its primary function above all other considerations, save the First Directive.
text: Your first [click] each turn must be spent to make a run or a play a run event. Once per turn, you can spend [click][click] to break a subroutine on a piece of ice currently being encountered.
name: Always Be Running

flavor: "You look tore up, kid. Have a seat, I'll fire up the arc welder."
text: When your turn begins, choose one of your installed cards. The text box of that card is blank for the remainder of the turn.
name: Dr. Lovegood

flavor: The Third Directive requires a bioroid to preserve its ability to function and report frequently to Haas-Bioroid for repairs and updates.
text:
The first time each turn you access a card with a trash cost, reveal it. You must trash that card by paying its trash cost, if able.
Whenever you access cards from HQ, access 1 additional card.
<errata>Errata from CR 1.2</errata>
name: Neutralize All Threats

flavor: The First Directive forbids a bioroid from harming, or through inaction allowing harm to befall, a human being.
text:
Your maximum hand size is reduced by 2.
When your turn ends, draw 1 card if you do not have cards in your grip equal to or greater than your maximum hand size.
name: Safety First

flavor: "Mommy will be home soon, sweetie. She has to kick some ass first."
name: Sunny Lebeau: Security Specialist

flavor: Fortunately, Globalsec buys them by the case.
text: [trash]: Choose an icebreaker (or any number of cloud icebreakers). Each chosen icebreaker has +1 strength for each [link] you have for the remainder of this run. Use this ability only during a run.
name: Security Chip

text: +1[mu] +1[link] Once per turn, when you encounter a piece of ice, you may force the Corp to "trace 5 If successful, give the Runner 1 tag and end the run. If unsuccessful, the Runner bypasses the currently encountered ice." Limit 1 console per player.
name: Security Nexus

flavor: Bigger.
text: If you have at least 2[link], the memory cost of GS Striker M1 is 0, even if it is not installed. 2[credit]: Break any number of code gate subroutines. 2[credit]: +3 strength.
name: GS Striker M1

flavor: Badder.
text: If you have at least 2[link], the memory cost of GS Shrike M2 is 0, even if it is not installed. 2[credit]: Break any number of sentry subroutines. 2[credit]: +3 strength.
name: GS Shrike M2

flavor: Boom.
text: If you have at least 2[link], the memory cost of GS Sherman M3 is 0, even if it is not installed. 2[credit]: Break any number of barrier subroutines. 2[credit]: +3 strength.
name: GS Sherman M3

flavor: She approached the server, flashed her credentials, and passed straight through. She wondered what it said about her that doing things the legal way felt like cheating.
text:
Install only if you have at least 2[link].
When your turn begins, you may lose [click]. If you do, look at the top card of R&D.
name: Globalsec Security Clearance

flavor: "I got an early start today...or maybe I forgot to go home last night."
text:
Reduce the cost to install Jak Sinclair by 1 for each [link] you have.
When your turn begins, you may make a run. You cannot use programs during this run.
name: Jak Sinclair

flavor: "Are you crazy? We can't send in prisec until the media gets bored and goes home."
text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The Corp's identity text box is blank.
name: Employee Strike

flavor: She tried to remember who he was. Not that it mattered anymore.
text: Shuffle your stack. Trash the top card of your stack. Gain X[credit] where X is equal to the install cost of that card.
name: Windfall

flavor: Technically correct: the best kind of correct.
text:
Whenever you install a piece of hardware or a program, place 1[credit] from the bank on Technical Writer.
[click],[trash]: Take all credits from Technical Writer.
name: Technical Writer

text: Make a run on Archives. If successful, instead of accessing cards, add Political Graffiti to an agenda in the Corp's score area as a hosted condition counter with the text "This agenda is worth -1 agenda points. Trash Political Graffiti if the Corp purges virus counters."
name: Political Graffiti

flavor: "Credits spend anywhere in the worlds, but there are other forms of currency."
text: Once per turn, you may jack out when you encounter a sentry.
name: Nero Severn: Information Broker

flavor: "I'm on a need-to-know basis. I need to know everything." -Nero Severn
text: +1[mu] +1[link] Whenever you jack out, the Corp reveals 1 card from HQ at random. Limit 1 console per player.
name: Reflection

text:
[click]: Look at the top X cards of your stack and arrange them in any order. X is the number of copies of Spy Camera installed.
[trash]: Look at the top card of R&D.
Limit 6 per deck.
name: Spy Camera

flavor: Leverage, secrets, access, and influence are currency as valuable as credits. But credits work, too.
text: Install only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn. [trash], pay the trash cost of a rezzed card: Trash that card.
name: Political Operative

flavor: The Creator.
text: 1[credit]: Break ice subroutine on a piece of ice with 3 or more subtypes. 1[credit]: +1 strength. 2[credit]: Swap Sadyojata with a deva program from your grip.
name: Sadyojata

text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. When you steal an agenda, add "Freedom Through Equality" to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.
name: "Freedom Through Equality"

flavor: "Our shared humanity is our greatest strength. And as we share more broadly, our strength grows, not dwindles."
text: Each player has 1 additional [click] to spend during his or her turn.
name: Akshara Sareen

flavor: "Bureaucracy and red tape have been weaponized." -Fake-ir
text: Whenever the Corp rezzes an asset or upgrade, you may pay credits equal to its rez cost and trash Councilman. If you do, derez that asset or upgrade. The Corp cannot rez it for the remainder of this turn.
name: Councilman

text:
Place 3 agenda counters on Voting Machine Initiative when you score it.
When the Runner's turn begins, you may spend 1 hosted agenda counter. If you do, the Runner loses [click], if able.
name: Voting Machine Initiative

flavor: "Our research says the public views clones as more human than bioroids. Historically, this has been a liability. Let's make it a strength."
text: When your turn begins, you may add 1 operation from Archives to HQ if there is no ice protecting this server.
name: Clone Suffrage Movement

flavor: "There's no conflict of interest here. These are complex issues with highly technical minutiae. It's only natural that the experts should lay down the guidelines."
text: When your turn begins, do 1 net damage if there is no ice protecting this server.
name: Bio-Ethics Association

flavor: "Politics is a dirty business. But so is business." -Krishnan Sareen
text: Whenever you draw an agenda, you may reveal and install it.
name: Political Dealings

text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. When you score an agenda, add "Clones are not People" to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.
name: "Clones are not People"

flavor: Being a Mumbad sensie star means a glamorous life, though it is lived in constant fear of blackmail-or worse-from orgcrime.
text: When your turn begins, you may draw 3 cards if there is no ice protecting this server. If you do, add 1 card from HQ to the bottom of R&D.
name: Sensie Actors Union

flavor: "Money is speech and I am listening intently." -Krishnan Sareen
text: When your turn begins, gain 3[credit] if there is no ice protecting this server.
name: Commercial Bankers Group

flavor: Mumbad's public city corporation is tightly connected to all the other corporations.
text: [click]: Search R&D for an alliance card, reveal it, and play or install it (paying all costs). Shuffle R&D.
name: Mumbad City Hall

flavor: Efficiency means profiting from things everyone was doing anyway.
text:
Whenever the Runner breaks a subroutine on Bailiff, gain 1[credit].
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Bailiff

flavor: The political centre of Mumbad.
text: Whenever you rez a card in or protecting this server (not including Surat City Grid), you may rez another card, lowering the rez cost by 2. Limit 1 region per server.
name: Surat City Grid

flavor: "Hitting them when they are weakest sometimes means acting before you want to." -Alice Merchant
text: Make a run. If you have 2 or fewer cards in your grip, each installed icebreaker has +2 strength until the end of the run.
name: Pushing the Envelope

text: +2[mu] The first time each turn you access a card not in Archives and do not steal or trash it, the Corp must trash 1 card from HQ at random. Limit 1 console per player.
name: Maw

flavor: The Archivist tracks all the clans and their members, and official dealings clans have with the various corps. Half law clerk and half historian, he wields a tremendous amount of power doing a job no one else wants, but none can do without.
text: +1[link] Whenever the Corp scores an initiative or security agenda, force the Corp to "Trace 1 if unsuccessful, take 1 bad publicity."
name: The Archivist

flavor:
1) Find the weakness.
2) Exploit the weakness.
3) Repeat.
text:
Play only if you made a successful run on R&D, HQ, and Archives this turn.
Derez up to 3 pieces of ice.
name: Exploit

flavor: "So, yeah, I just reverse engineered a tracer, and then built it back up with some new lines of code. Pretty stellar." -Los
text: Expose 1 non-ice card, then make a run.
name: Spot the Prey

flavor: "You created a distributed AI replica of yourself and projected it into the network to run for you!?"
text: [trash]: Prevent all but 1 net damage.
name: Bio-Modeled Network

flavor: "To beat cautious sysops, you've got to get creative. Commandeering Network systems is like using their own strengths against them." -Kabonesa Wu
text: The install cost of each piece of ice that is not installed in the innermost position is increased by 1.
name: Network Exchange

text: Make a run. When this run ends, add Mad Dash to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point if you stole at least 1 agenda during the run; otherwise, suffer 1 meat damage.
name: Mad Dash

flavor: "The newest electronic-warfare rollout from NEXT Design has us sysops drooling." -Mason Bellamy
text: If there is a rezzed piece of NEXT ice when you score NEXT Wave 2, you may do 1 brain damage.
name: NEXT Wave 2

flavor: "Dismantle. Dissect. Is there really a difference?"
text:
The Runner can spend [click][click] to break up to 2 subroutines on Zed 2.0.
[subroutine] Trash 1 hardware.
[subroutine] Trash 1 hardware.
[subroutine] If the Runner has spent at least 1 [click] to break a subroutine during this run, do 2 brain damage.
name: Zed 2.0

text:
Defense Construct can be advanced.
[trash]: Add 1 facedown card from Archives to HQ for each advancement token on Defense Construct. Use this ability only during a run on Archives.
name: Defense Construct

text: The first time a subroutine on a piece of AP ice is broken each turn, do 1 net damage.
name: Synth DNA Modification

flavor: "The ultimate aim of martial arts is not having to use them." - Miyamoto Musashi
text:
When the Runner passes Kakugo, do 1 net damage.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Kakugo

text: Whenever the Runner avoids or removes 1 or more tags, you may draw 1 card.
name: Net Analytics

flavor: "'What does BRE stand for?' Have you seen its Net presence?" -Bernice Mai
text:
[subroutine]<trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
[subroutine]<trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, the Runner accesses 1 fewer card whenever he or she accesses cards for the remainder of this run.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.0</errata>
name: SYNC BRE

text: Whenever you forfeit an agenda, place 1 advancement token on a card and 1 additional token for each agenda point the agenda was worth.
name: Jemison Astronautics: Sacrifice. Audacity. Success.

text: Forfeit an agenda: Rez up to 3 pieces of ice, lowering the cost of each by 2[credit] for each printed agenda point on the forfeited agenda.
name: Quarantine System

text:
As an additional cost to rez Oberth Protocol, forfeit an agenda.
The first time you advance a card in or protecting this server each turn, place an additional advancement token on it.
name: Oberth Protocol

flavor: Senate staffers and clerks of the MCA can be seen thronging Khondi Plaza during break times.
text:
X[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to rez ice protecting this server. X is the number of remote servers.
name: Khondi Plaza

text: [trash]: Cards cannot be installed until the end of the run. Use this ability only during a run on this server.
name: Signal Jamming

flavor: With each passing day alone, Hoshiko found it harder to think. With each hour, the static grew louder.
text:
As an additional cost to play this event, trash an installed resource.
Gain 7[credit].
name: Isolation

flavor:
Step 1: Apply to Problem.
Step 2: No more Problem!
text: +1[mu] The trash cost of each Corp card is lowered by 1. The first time each turn you trash a Corp card, gain 1[credit]. Limit 1 console per player.
name: Demolisher

flavor: *tap* *tap* *tap*
text:
Install only on a piece of ice.
Host ice has -1 strength for each hosted virus counter.
When you encounter host ice, if its strength is 0 or less, trash it. Otherwise, place 1 virus counter on this program.
name: Chisel

flavor: "Net space is an abstraction, a white lie protecting fragile comprehensions. Do not limit yourself." -z\h/r
text: [click]: Run R&D. If successful, instead of accessing cards, reveal the top 3 cards of R&D. Trash 1 of the revealed cards. Use this ability only once per turn.
name: Stargate

flavor: Sing, sing as your heart desires!
text: X[credit]: Break X code gate subroutines. Use this ability only once per run. 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. Use this ability only if you have 3 or more installed virtual resources. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
name: Utae

text: When your turn begins, remove this resource from the game. Choose a server protected by ice. The Corp may trash a piece of ice protecting that server. If they do not, the first time this turn you access cards from either R&D or HQ, access 2 additional cards from that server.
name: Climactic Showdown

flavor: Friends break your walls.
text:
When your turn begins or you steal an agenda, place 1[credit] on this resource.
Whenever you make a successful run, you may spend hosted credits for the remainder of that run.
When your turn ends, if there are 3 or more hosted credits, you must pay 1[credit] or trash this resource.
name: Fencer Fueno

flavor: "...well, I'm laughing."
text: The first time each turn you install a virus program, place 2 virus counters on this resource. When your turn begins, you may remove any 2 virus counters from your installed cards. If you do, draw 2 cards unless the Corp trashes the top card of R&D.
name: The Nihilist

flavor: Friends hide your fears.
text:
When your turn begins or you steal an agenda, place 1[credit] on this resource.
Spend hosted credits to use programs during runs.
When your turn ends, if there are 3 or more hosted credits, you must take 1 tag or trash this resource.
name: Trickster Taka

flavor: "You're not listening."
text: The first job resource, connection resource, or piece of hardware you install each turn costs 1[credit] less to install.
name: Az McCaffrey: Mechanical Prodigy

flavor:
"Everyone told me she was reliable in a pinch."
 -Az McCaffrey
text: Run any server. When that run ends, if it was unsuccessful, you may run that server again, ignoring any additional costs to run. During the second run, when you encounter the last ice you encountered in the first run, bypass it.
name: Always Have a Backup Plan

flavor: Blue flames burn the hottest!
text: Look at the top 2 cards of your stack. You may add 1 of those cards to the bottom of your stack. Draw 2 cards.
name: Blueberry!™ Diesel

flavor: BMI switches let runners surface without a true disconnect. Handy for a break... immediately.
text:
You cannot use this hardware during the Corp's turn.
[trash]: Jack out.
[trash]: Remove 1 tag.
Whenever a trace initiates during your turn, you may [trash] to reduce the base trace strength to 0.
name: Flip Switch

flavor: Want to win a coinflip? Use a coin with two heads.
text: Remove this hardware from the game: Prevent a Corp card ability from ending the run. Use this ability only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn.
name: Lucky Charm

flavor:
v35: Springs to the mount ejectors (new feature)
v36: Reduced power to springs (x5)
text: +1[mu]. The first time each turn you install a piece of hardware, draw 1 card. Whenever a run begins, you may install a piece of hardware, paying 1[credit] more. Limit 1 console per player.
name: Masterwork (v37)

flavor: "Do the job. Get paid. Leave feelings at the door." -"Baklan" Bochkin
text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength. The first time each turn that you break all subroutines on a piece of ice you are encountering using only this program, gain 2[credit].
name: Bukhgalter

flavor: "Psh, let them gossip. The cat knows whose meat it has eaten." -"Baklan" Bochkin
text:
The first time each run you encounter a piece of ice, place 1 power counter on this resource.
[trash]: Derez the ice you are encountering if its strength is equal to or less than the number of hosted power counters. Take 1 tag.
name: "Baklan" Bochkin

flavor: "...but I am without compare."
text:
When the turn during which you installed this resource ends, draw 4 cards.
Immediately before you draw for the first time each turn, look at the top X cards of your stack. Add 1 of those cards to the bottom of your stack. X is equal to the number of cards you will draw plus 1.
name: The Class Act

text: When your turn ends, if you have the same number of cards in your grip as the Corp has in HQ, you may draw 1 card.
name: Lat: Ethical Freelancer

flavor: Do you know how many food deliveries I've missed this week?
text:
Play only as your first [click].
Whenever you install a card with a printed install cost of 1 or greater this turn, draw 1 card or gain 1[credit].
name: In the Groove

text: Run R&D. If successful, instead of accessing cards, choose a number greater than 0. For each installed card you have with a printed install cost matching that number, reveal 1 card from the top of R&D (max 6). Access one of the revealed cards, then the Corp shuffles R&D. You cannot access any other cards in R&D this run.
name: Khusyuk

flavor:
"There is never a wasted program. Someone, somewhere, will have a use for that code. Even corps are scrambling for quick fixes nowadays."
-Lat
text:
As an additional cost to play this event, trash an installed program.
Gain 4[credit] and draw 2 cards.
name: Spec Work

flavor: The Net is boundless, but the right access port is worth a road trip.
text: +2[mu] You have +1 maximum hand size. When your turn ends, if you and the Corp have the same number of credits, you may gain 2[credit]. Limit 1 console per player.
name: Supercorridor

flavor: It is not knowledge, but the act of learning, not posession, but the act of getting there, which grants the greatest enjoyment.
text: When you install this program, it gets +3 strength for the remainder of the turn. 1[credit]: Break barrier subroutine. 2[credit]: +2 strength.
name: Gauss

flavor: It makes sysops see red. And orange, yellow, green...
text: When you install this program, place 2 virus counters on it. Hosted virus counter: Choose an ice subtype. The ice you are encountering gains that subtype for the remainder of the encounter. Use this ability only once per turn.
name: Pelangi

flavor: "It takes such simple things to sustain us, the most important of which is to be thankful." -Lat
text: When your turn begins, gain 1[credit].
name: Rezeki

flavor: "...then let me paint you a picture."
text:
Use each ability on this resource only once per turn.
[click]: Gain 2[credit].
[click]: Install a program or piece of hardware, paying 1[credit] less.
name: The Artist

flavor: Get into the ducts on the roof and keep crawling till you hit that old network root. Dirty work, I know, but it beats playing by the rules.
text:
While you are resolving this event, each player's identity loses all abilities.
Run any server. When that run ends, you may shuffle this event into your stack.
name: Direct Access

flavor: I didn't say your hopper should be hauling garbage. I said it should be hauled away as garbage.
text: Add an installed program or piece of hardware to your grip. If you do, you may install a program or piece of hardware, paying X[credit] less. X is equal to the printed install cost of the uninstalled card.
name: Rejig

flavor: "Corporations are made of people; just normal people doing their 6-to-6. The right truths, the right critique, and they can be redeemed." -Lat
text: Whenever you make a successful run, you may trash this resource to name an agenda. The next time this run you access a copy of the named agenda, steal it, ignoring all costs. (You are no longer accessing it.)
name: Whistleblower

text: If the first, second, and third actions you take on your turn are different from each other, when the third completes, you may gain 1[credit] or take another different action, paying 1[click] less.
name: MirrorMorph: Endless Iteration

flavor:
"Early success should be rewarded, as it will encourage a culture of drive and competition."
-Corporate Leadership for Dummies
text: When you score this agenda, look at the top 5 cards of R&D. You may install and rez 1 of those cards, ignoring all costs.
name: Architect Deployment Test

flavor: Unit is holding .78 asimovs of stress potential in all three directive logic traps. Psychiatric session mandated during next maintenance cycle.
text:
[click]: Draw 2 cards. Use this ability only once per turn.
When the Runner trashes this asset, you may draw 2 cards.
name: Calvin B4L3Y

flavor: At the scale where nanobots cut glass, quantum mechanics dictate error. A silicon atom here, an oxygen there, an erbium out of place. Each bioroid is born unique.
text:
[click]: Gain 2[credit]. Use this ability only once per turn.
When the Runner trashes this asset, you may gain 2[credit].
name: Nanoetching Matrix

flavor: Old warriors have seen all the tricks; be forthright or fail.
text: This ice has -1 strength for each installed icebreaker. [subroutine] Trash 1 program that is not a decoder, fracter, or killer. [subroutine] End the run.
name: Hagen

flavor: Haas' unsecured servers were fortified just before the storm. Are their bioroid oracles that good, or were they tipped off?
text: Gain 2[credit] or draw 2 cards. Repeat this process for each remote server with at least 1 card in it and at least 1 piece of ice protecting it.
name: Fully Operational

flavor: Not all secrets lie in vaults.
text:
Resolve two of the following in any order:
  • Draw 2 cards.
  • Gain 2[credit].
  • Install up to 1 non-agenda card.
  • Gain [click].
name: Red Level Clearance

flavor: The Net abhors a vacuum. Any unexplained gap must be made.
text:
[click]: Place 1 power counter on this upgrade.
As an additional cost to run this server, the Runner must spend 1[click] and 1[credit] for each hosted power counter.
When your turn begins, remove all hosted power counters.
name: Cold Site Server

flavor: No Stone Unturned.
text:
The first time each turn you reveal a card, gain 1[credit].
[click]: Reveal a card from the grip at random or the top card of the stack.
name: Hyoubu Institute: Absolute Clarity

text: When you score this agenda, place 1 agenda counter on it for each advancement token on it over 3. Hosted agenda counter: Swap a card in HQ with a card in or protecting the attacked server. The Runner may jack out. Use this ability only during a run.
name: Project Yagi-Uda

flavor:
"'It is my nature,' said the scorpion."
-Conceptual Frameworks in Bio-Ethics and Synthetic Morality, Moser University Press
text: When a player scores or steals this agenda, do X net damage. X is equal to the number of copies of Sting! in the other player's score area plus 1.
name: Sting!

flavor: Hyoubu is our vanguard in the battle for hearts and minds.
text: When your turn begins, reveal the top card of R&D and gain 2[credit].
name: Public Health Portal

flavor: "Memory is a tangle of emotional threads. Pull one, it twists a second, unravels a third!" -Letheia Nisei
text: The first time each turn you trash (from any location) a card that matches the faction of the Runner's identity, place 1 power counter on this asset. [click], hosted power counter: Do 1 net damage.
name: Storgotic Resonator

text:
When the Runner encounters this ice, choose a card type. For the remainder of the encounter, whenever you trash a card of that type with net damage from a subroutine on this ice, do 1 net damage.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
name: Saisentan

text:
After you resolve this operation, your action phase ends.
Play only if the Runner has 3 or more agenda points and they made a successful run during their last turn.
Name a card, then do 1 net damage. If you trash a copy of the named card, repeat this process.
name: Complete Image

text: The first time each run the Runner approaches this server, you and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit] or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, you may trash this upgrade to force the Runner to approach the outermost piece of ice protecting this server.
name: Letheia Nisei

flavor:
Scrub-loving devs nerfed cannon rushes cause whiny bronzers complained. Left me four wins down in finals.
Anyway I won.
text: When you score this agenda, place 1 agenda counter on it. Hosted agenda counter: Place 1 advancement token on an installed card.
name: Remastered Edition

text:
Rez only during your action phase.
Whenever the Runner makes a successful run on this server, they gain 2[credit].
When your turn begins, gain 3[credit] if the Runner did not make any successful runs on this server during their last turn.
name: Daily Quest

flavor: Subscribe for 12 months to get that premium uplink you need to blaze ahead of the crowd!
text: The first time each turn a run begins, gain 1[credit].
name: Tiered Subscription

flavor: You are the ONE BILLIONTH visitor!
text:
When the Runner passes this ice, gain 1[credit].
[subroutine]Gain 2[credit]. The Runner gains 1[credit].
name: Congratulations!

flavor: Though many countries attempted to regulate digital loot boxes in the early 21st century, GameNET has managed to circumvent any such laws via explicit, transparent percentage rates... and some very determined lobbyists.
text:
[subroutine]End the run unless the Runner pays 2[credit].
[subroutine]Reveal the top 3 cards of the stack. Add 1 of those cards to the grip and gain credits equal to its install or play cost. The Runner shuffles the stack. Trash this ice.
name: Loot Box

flavor: "There's gonna be catering, right?"
text:
Play only if the Runner made a successful run during their last turn.
Choose a card type, then reveal the grip. You may pay X[credit] to place X advancement tokens on an installed card. X is equal to or less than the number of revealed cards of the chosen type.
name: Focus Group

flavor: It is pitch black. You are likely to be eaten by a Troll.
text: Play only if the Runner stole an agenda during their last turn. Choose a Runner card type. Trash all installed non-icebreaker cards of that type. The Runner may prevent any of those cards from being trashed by paying 3[credit] each. Take 1 bad publicity.
name: Game Over

flavor: Ultra-Mythic chance ↑!↑!↑! Free Vorpal Tommy Gun [epic] and pinstripe suit [cosmetic] with 10x buy-in!
text:
While the Runner is accessing this card from R&D, they must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses this card, remove 1 bad publicity unless they take 1 tag.
name: Increased Drop Rates

flavor: As the documents show, for eight months they have operated as an entirely independent fiscal entity. We are as appalled at the carelessness as you are, and fully support City Hall's investigation.
text: Whenever the Runner steals another agenda, you may forfeit this agenda to gain 5[credit] and add the stolen agenda to HQ.
name: Divested Trust

flavor: "Drones are precision instruments. Collateral damage is merely an undisclosed target." -Chief "Pinchy" Wilson
text:
As an additional cost to steal this agenda, the Runner must trash an installed program.
When you score this agenda, trash an installed program.
name: SDS Drone Deployment

flavor: "There's something about the human touch that androids will never replace." -Mila Braun
text: [click], [click], [click]: Gain 6[credit]. You may remove 1 bad publicity.
name: Roughneck Repair Squad

flavor: A choice occurs. The waveform collapses.
text:
While this ice is protecting HQ, the Runner cannot break more than 1 of its printed subroutines during each encounter.
[subroutine]The Runner loses 2[credit].
[subroutine]End the run.
name: Afshar

flavor: Effective, Cheap, Durable. Pick two.
text:
When the Runner encounters this ice, place 1 virus counter on it.
This ice has -1 strength for each hosted virus counter.
[subroutine]End the run.
name: Sandstone

text:
When you rez this ice, take 1 bad publicity.
[subroutine] Trash 1 installed Runner card.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 6</trace> If successful, the Runner cannot steal or trash Corp cards for the remainder of the run.
name: Trebuchet

flavor:
Secure Servers. Contain Infections. Protect Data.
-The SecTech Mantra
text: As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click]. Search R&D for a piece of ice and reveal it. (Shuffle R&D after searching it.) Install that ice protecting a central server, paying 3[credit] less.
name: Secure and Protect

text:
When you rez this upgrade, you may pay up to 4[credit] to place that many power counters on it.
As an additional cost to run this server, the Runner must pay 2[credit] for each hosted power counter.
Whenever the Runner makes a successful run on a central server, remove 1 hosted power counter.
name: Reduced Service

flavor: The Fracture was no different to any other crisis: Management's first instinct is to find someone to blame. Getting food up to Midway or He3 down to power Earthside hospitals are trivialities compared to the important work of salving Executive ego and keeping one's job.
text: You cannot score this agenda if you installed it this turn.
name: Vulnerability Audit

flavor:
"By matching funds on your donations, the Space Elevator Authority has already planted over eight million trees on the Pacific coast. Together we can restore New Angeles to its former glory."
-Elizabeth Mills
text: When your turn begins, you may draw 1 card.
name: CSR Campaign

text:
During runs on this server, you can rez this ice any time you could rez non-ice cards.
Each piece of ice protecting this server has +1 strength.
[subroutine] The Runner loses 1[credit].
name: Rime

flavor: The Past is the Future.
text:
Draft format only.
You can use agendas from all factions in this deck.
name: The Shadow: Pulling the Strings

flavor: "This war is far from over."
text: Draft format only.
name: The Masque: Cyber General

text:
Draft format only.
If you have more [anarch] cards installed than any other faction, whenever you trash a Corp card, shuffle the top card of your heap into your stack.
name: Wyvern: Chemically Enhanced

text:
Draft format only.
If you have more [criminal] cards installed than any other faction, when your turn begins, remove 1 tag.
name: Boris "Syfr" Kovac: Crafty Veteran

text:
Draft format only.
If you have more [shaper] cards installed than any other faction, when you install a card the first time each turn, draw 1 card.
name: Jamie "Bzzz" Micken: Techno Savant

text:
Draft format only.
If you have more [haas-bioroid] cards rezzed than any other faction, when the Runner's turn ends, shuffle 1 card in Archives into R&D.
name: Strategic Innovations: Future Forward

text:
Draft format only.
If you have more [jinteki] cards rezzed than any other faction, when your turn begins, you may swap 2 pieces of installed ice.
name: Synthetic Systems: The World Re-imagined

text:
Draft format only.
If you have more [nbn] cards rezzed than any other faction, whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, give the runner 1 tag.
name: Information Dynamics: All You Need To Know

text:
Draft format only.
If you have more [weyland-consortium] cards rezzed than any other faction, when the Runner's turn begins, place an advancement token on a piece of ice.
name: Fringe Applications: Tomorrow, Today

text:
Run a remote server. If successful, instead of accessing cards, trash all cards installed in that server.
<errata>Errata from CR 1.2</errata>
name: Singularity

text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
