Place up to 3 advancement tokens on an unrezzed card in a remote server. Gain 2[credit] for each advancement token placed. You cannot access that card this turn.
name: Queen's Gambit

flavor: The Dyson Fractal Generator is a useless lump of silicon; all it does is produce truly random results. What kind of madman slaps that in his rig? What's the use of a totally random number? -John Masanori
text: 1[recurring-credit] Use this credit to pay for using fracters.
name: Dyson Fractal Generator

flavor: Take Moore's Law, iterate it over a century or two, and mix in quantum computing. You get to the point where you're developing the software on a hardware platform that you design at the same time. Tailor-made for each other. Exciting time to be alive! -William Knuth, The Tower of Babbage
text: 1[recurring-credit] Use this credit to pay for using killers.
name: Silencer

flavor: "Predictive algorithms that fetch you the program you need before you even know you need it. My second favorite lady." -Gabriel Santiago
text:
You cannot use Savoir-faire more than once each turn.
2[credit]: Install a program from your grip, paying the install cost.
name: Savoir-faire

flavor: There are good, honest, hardworking cops in the NAPD. Officers who do their best to bring justice to the guilty and protect the innocent. Fortunately for the criminals, they're outnumbered by the other kind. The kind who are much easier to work with.
text:
[trash]: Prevent another installed resource from being trashed.
[trash]: Gain 2[credit].
name: Fall Guy

flavor: "When I said I could hack it in my sleep, did you think I was joking?" -Chaos Theory
text: As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click]. Gain 2[credit]. Gain an additional 1[credit] for each double event in your heap.
name: Power Nap

flavor: "Hand-made code is like hand-made art. You can see the brush strokes, which lets you see the artist. And then you can see everything in a new way." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
text: [click]: Choose a rezzed piece of ice. That ice gains sentry, code gate or barrier until the end of the next run this turn.
name: Paintbrush

flavor: Data hunters always pay top dollar for old drives. The more useless the data, the higher the payout.
text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Gain 9[credit].
name: Lucky Find

flavor: Once inside, the only way out is through your own mind.
text: [subroutine] The Runner's maximum hand size is reduced by 2 until the beginning of the Corp's next turn.
name: Gyri Labyrinth

text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Name a card other than Reclamation Order. Reveal any number of copies of the named card from Archives and add them to HQ.
name: Reclamation Order

flavor: Tourists have flocked to Broadcast Square in even greater numbers ever since the notorious Ho-meh's crime spree ended there in a hail of flechettes. Well, that's how it happened in the sensie.
text: Whenever you are about to take at least 1 bad publicity, <trace>trace 3</trace> if successful, avoid taking the bad publicity.
name: Broadcast Square

flavor: The only thing worse than being fired and replaced by a younger, cheaper worker? Being replaced by an android.
text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Shuffle all cards in HQ into R&D. Draw 5 cards.
name: Corporate Shuffle

flavor: The first clone to serve as an NAPD detective.
text: Whenever the Runner passes all of the ice protecting this server, you and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, end the run.
name: Caprice Nisei

text:
When you rez Shinobi, take 1 bad publicity.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 1</trace> If successful, do 1 net damage.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, do 2 net damage.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, do 3 net damage and end the run.
name: Shinobi

flavor: "It doesn't do anything in and of itself. It just marks you as an intruder and makes the next ice do all the work." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
text: [subroutine] The next piece of ice the Runner encounters gains "[subroutine] End the run." after all its other subroutines for the remainder of this run.
name: Marker

text:
Hive loses an "[subroutine] End the run." subroutine for each agenda point in the Corp's score area.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Hive

flavor: "Now, let's talk about how little you remember of the events of June sixth through sixteenth."
text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Remove up to 2 bad publicity.
name: Witness Tampering

text:
The advancement requirement of NAPD Contract is increased by 1 for each bad publicity the Corp has.
As an additional cost to steal NAPD Contract, the Runner must pay 4[credit].
name: NAPD Contract

flavor: It wants to have two subroutines when it grows up.
text: [subroutine] End the run.
name: Quandary

flavor: The system is so deeply rooted, who knows how far the cables run?
text: Whenever the Corp purges virus counters, you may gain 1[credit] for each virus counter removed and trash Acacia.
name: Acacia

flavor: Embedded in the mainframe, it proliferates and devours with each agitation.
text:
When you install Plague, choose a server.
Whenever you make a successful run on the chosen server, you may place 2 virus counters on Plague.
name: Plague

flavor: The gap of 0.19 seconds was all he needed.
text:
Play only if you made a successful run on a central server this turn.
Install a card from your grip, lowering its install cost by 8[credit], and take 1 tag.
name: Credit Kiting

flavor: "He's probably the best pet I've ever had but I'd still trade him for something better." - 419
text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ each turn, you may trash Wari to name sentry, code gate or barrier. Expose a piece of ice, then add it to HQ if it has the named subtype.
name: Wari

text: [click]: Search your stack for a non-virus program and install it, lowering its install cost by 1[credit], then shuffle your stack. If that program is still installed when your turn ends, remove it from the game.
name: Kabonesa Wu: Netspace Thrillseeker

flavor: When standard breaking just doesn't cut it.
text: Whenever you break all subroutines on a piece of ice during a single encounter, you may place 1 power counter on Takobi. 2 hosted power counters: Choose a non-AI icebreaker. That icebreaker has +3 strength until the end of the current encounter.
name: Takobi

flavor: A winged terror, the Kongamato dives from above, rending its prey in one ferocious bite.
text: [trash]: Break the first subroutine on the encountered piece of ice.
name: Kongamato

text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Trash any number of programs and/or pieces of hardware from your grip. Search your stack for a program or piece of hardware and install it, lowering its install cost by the total install cost of the trashed cards. Shuffle your stack.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.2</errata>
name: Emergent Creativity

flavor: Between nothing and infinity.
text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ or R&D each turn, you may name a number. If you do, reveal the next card that you access this run. If it has a rez cost, play cost, or advancement requirement equal to the named number, either gain 3[credit] or draw 2 cards.
name: RNG Key

flavor: Witchcraft to the nescient; beauty to the wise.
text:
[subroutine] The Runner loses [click], if able. You have an additional [click] to spend during your next turn.
[subroutine] The Runner loses [click], if able. You have an additional [click] to spend during your next turn.
name: Nightdancer

flavor: "The site of the world's second beanstalk, or I'll die trying." - Miria Byanyima, Director of VSEP
text: Whenever you draw a piece of ice, you may reveal it and install it protecting this server, lowering the install cost by 4[credit]. Limit 1 region per server.
name: Jinja City Grid

flavor: "Starving, dehydrated, delirious, I picked a direction and ran, ran for days, maybe even weeks. I ran until my legs couldn't carry me. Then I crawled. When I was finally out, finally free of the shroud, I checked the time, the date. How long had I been gone, trapped in the all-encompassing blackness? Turns out, 3 minutes."
text: [subroutine] Trash the top 3 cards of the stack. Trash Aimor.
name: Aimor

text: When Bacterial Programming is scored or stolen, you may look at the top 7 cards of R&D, add any number of them to HQ, trash any number of them, and arrange the rest in any order.
name: Bacterial Programming

flavor: "It wasn't until the spots cleared that I realized half of my rig was gone." - Kabonesa Wu
text:
When the Runner encounters Jua, he or she cannot install cards for the remainder of the turn.
[subroutine] Choose 2 installed Runner cards, if able. The Runner must add 1 of those cards to the top of the stack.
name: Jua

text:
Play only if the Runner trashed at least 1 Corp card during his or her last turn.
Choose an installed Runner card. The Runner must either add that card to the top of the stack or take 2 tags. Remove Threat Assessment from the game instead of trashing it.
name: Threat Assessment

flavor: He found it odd that three frozen yogurt shops, all less than a block from his, opened within the same week.
text:
Play only if the Runner made a successful run during his or her last turn.
The Runner loses 4[credit], if able.
name: Economic Warfare

text:
If Forced Connection is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Forced Connection, <trace>trace 3</trace> If successful, give the Runner 2 tags. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses Forced Connection from Archives.
name: Forced Connection

text:
When SSL Endorsement is scored or stolen, place 9[credit] from the bank on it.
When the Corp's turn begins, he or she may take 3[credit] from SSL Endorsement. This ability is active even while SSL Endorsement is in the Runner's score area.
name: SSL Endorsement

flavor: "Who knew non-profits could be so profitable?"
text: NGO Front can be advanced. [trash],1 hosted advancement token: Gain 5[credit]. [trash],2 hosted advancement tokens: Gain 8[credit].
name: NGO Front

flavor: "Food. Drinks. Entertainment. It doesn't take much to gratify the bourgeoisie."
text: The Runner gains 2[credit]. Trash up to 2 cards from HQ, then shuffle up to 2 cards from Archives into R&D. Remove Distract the Masses from the game instead of trashing it.
name: Distract the Masses

text: Whenever you encounter a barrier, Berserker has +1 strength for each subroutine on that barrier. 2[credit]: Break up to 2 barrier subroutines.
name: Berserker

text: 2[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength. Whenever you pass a sentry, you may trash the top card of the stack to trash one card from the top of R&D for each subroutine on that sentry that resolved.
name: Persephone

flavor: "Even I don't know how or why this one works. I just copied the schematics from a burst broadcast from someplace north of Paxton's Node, where nothing is supposed to be." -Los
text: X[credit],[click]: Derez a piece of ice rezzed this turn. X is its printed rez cost. Use this ability once per turn.
name: Rubicon Switch

text: Whenever you access a card with a trash cost not in Archives and do not trash it, you may reveal it and gain 1[credit].
name: Aeneas Informant

text: [click], remove an installed program from the game: Search your stack for a non-virus program, shuffle your stack, then install that program, lowering the install cost by the cost of the program removed from the game.
name: Rosetta 2.0

flavor: "Who said you can't teach an old breaker new tricks?" -g00ru
text: Install Adjusted Matrix on an icebreaker. Host icebreaker gains AI and "You may spend [click] to break any subroutine on a piece of ice currently being encountered." Errata from FAQ 4.1
name: Adjusted Matrix

flavor: Better, Faster, Stronger
text: Install Dedicated Processor on a non-AI icebreaker. Host icebreaker gains "2[credit]: +4 strength."
name: Dedicated Processor

text: The first time you pass a piece of ice each turn in which you used Inversificator to break all subroutines, you may swap that ice with another piece of ice. 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
name: Inversificator

flavor: "You want untraceable funds? I'll lend, as long as you have the ability to pay me back."
text:
When your turn begins, gain 1[credit] if you have fewer than 6[credit].
Whenever you have 0[credit], trash Dadiana Chacon and take 3 meat damage.
name: Dadiana Chacon

flavor: "I passed through the opalescent curtain only to find a suddenly empty server..."
text: NEXT Opal gains "[subroutine] You may install 1 card from HQ, paying all costs." for each rezzed piece of NEXT ice. Errata from FAQ 4.1
name: NEXT Opal

flavor: "They don't need sleep, breaks, overtime, or even O₂. How can we compete with that!?"
text:
[trash]: Install 1 card, paying all costs. Use this ability only during the next paid ability window after playing and resolving an operation.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.1</errata>
name: Bioroid Work Crew

text: Once per turn, instead of rezzing an approached piece of ice, you may trash it to choose another server. The Runner is now running on that server and encountering the outermost piece of ice, if any.
name: AgInfusion: New Miracles for a New World

text: Install only in the root of R&D. [click]: Reveal the top 3 cards of R&D. Secretly choose 1 to add to HQ. Return the others to the top of R&D, in any order. Limit 1 region per server.
name: Bamboo Dome

text: Each time the Runner accesses an agenda from this server, he or she must suffer 2 net damage as an additional cost in order to steal it. This applies even during the run on which the Runner trashes Ben Musashi.
name: Ben Musashi

flavor: "I'm sure there is no way this could go wrong for you." -Henry Phillips
text:
When the Runner encounters Authenticator, he or she may take 1 tag to bypass it.
[subroutine] The Corp gains 2[credit].
[subroutine]End the run.
name: Authenticator

flavor: "Toying with them is where the job satisfaction comes in".
text: Whenever the Runner breaks a subroutine during a run on this server, gain 2[credit] if he or she is tagged.
name: Henry Phillips

flavor: "Our job is to stop incursions. Let Argus get cute with them." -Moishe Saban
text:
[subroutine]End the run.
[subroutine]End the run.
name: Battlement

text:
Play only if there are at least 3 cards in HQ.
Trash all cards in HQ. Place a total of 2 advancement tokens on up to 2 cards that can be advanced.
name: Audacity

text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click], [click].
Move all advancement tokens from all installed cards to 1 card that can be advanced.
name: Red Planet Couriers

flavor: "It's eyes just keep following you."
text: [subroutine] Add 1 installed program to the top of the stack.
name: Owl

text: +1[mu] Your maximum hand size is increased by 1 for each tag you have. The first time a successful run on R&D or HQ ends each turn, draw 1 card for each card you accessed during that run. Limit 1 console per player.
name: Obelus

flavor: "In extremity, your conscience may make you terrible." -Omar Keung, the Flashpoint
text: Whenever you encounter a code gate, you may install Black Orchestra from your heap (paying its install cost). 3[credit]: +2 strength. Break up to 2 code gate subroutines, if able.
name: Black Orchestra

text: [click]: Make a run on Archives. If successful, instead treat it as a successful run on another central server. Use this ability only once per turn.
name: Omar Keung: Conspiracy Theorist

flavor: Khan's avatar lifted her arm and the bird launched itself into the air.
text: 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 3[credit]: +3 strength. 2[credit], return Peregrine to your grip: Derez a code gate. Use this ability only after using Peregrine to break all the subroutines on that code gate during a single encounter.
name: Peregrine

flavor: My brain is the key that sets my mind free.
text: 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 2[credit]: +4 strength for the remainder of this run. Use this ability only by spending at least 1 credit from a stealth card.
name: Houdini

flavor: "Live, unfiltered, and uncensored: this is Net Mercur, signing off for the night. Stay safe, New Angeles."
text: The first time you spend at least 1[credit] from a stealth card each run, place 1[credit] on Net Mercur or draw 1 card. Use credits on Net Mercur for anything.
name: Net Mercur

flavor: "All bioroids are bound by the Three Directives, but in theory a bioroid could have any number of core directives. Even zero."
text:
Whenever you draw a card, reveal that card.
The first time you make a successful run each turn, you may look at the top card of R&D.
name: Find the Truth

flavor: "Last week, I crossed the street to avoid her. Today, she pulled me out of the rubble. Makes me rethink who the bad guys are."
text: 2[credit]: Draw 1 card. Use this ability only if you have suffered damage from a Corp card ability this turn.
name: First Responders

flavor: In battle, I take half the slain.
text:
The Runner can spend [click][click][click] to break up to 3 subroutines on Fairchild 3.0.
[subroutine] The Runner must pay 3[credit] or trash 1 of his or her installed cards.
[subroutine] The Runner must pay 3[credit] or trash 1 of his or her installed cards.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage or end the run.
name: Fairchild 3.0

flavor: "If you live off-site, please consult the building AI for temporary housing. We regret that your off-site family cannot join you here while we are in lockdown..."
text: Name a card. Remove all copies of that card in the heap from the game.
name: Ark Lockdown

flavor: "Wait a minute, I don't even have a cat."
text:
Play only if the Runner trashed an accessed Corp card during his or her last turn.
<trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, trash 2 installed non-program cards. If unsuccessful, take 1 bad publicity.
name: Hellion Beta Test

text: When you score Project Kusanagi, place 1 agenda counter on it for each advancement token on it over 2. Hosted agenda counter: Choose 1 piece of ice to gain "[subroutine] Do 1 net damage." after all its other subroutines for the remainder of this run.
name: Project Kusanagi

text:
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage. The Runner loses 2[credit].
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage. The Runner loses 2[credit].
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage. The Runner loses 2[credit].
name: DNA Tracker

flavor: Your better nature.
text: Whenever the Runner takes at least 1 net damage, trash the top card of the stack.
name: Jinteki: Potential Unleashed

flavor: "She used to work for me at my chop shop. Now she makes more money than I do." -MacPherson
text: [trash]: Shuffle all cards in HQ into R&D. The Runner may pay any number of credits to prevent 1 random card in HQ from being shuffled into R&D for every 2[credit] spent.
name: Alexa Belsky

flavor: Observing is fun, but it's just the appetizer.
text:
Play only if the Runner has fewer than 6[credit].
As an additional cost to play this operation, remove 1 tag.
Trash 1 installed card.
name: Observe and Destroy

text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. As an additional cost to make the first run on his or her turn (even through a card ability), the Runner must spend 1[credit].
name: Service Outage

flavor: Game over.
text:
Play only if the Runner has at least 2 tags.
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Do 7 meat damage.
name: BOOM!

text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. When the Runner's turn begins, trace 1 If successful, do 1 meat damage if the Runner is tagged; otherwise, give the Runner 1 tag.
name: Door to Door

flavor: The event is now referred to as the Water Tower Massacre. No one was ever indicted, and no one knows who paid the prisec team responsible.
text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. The install cost of each resource is increased by 2.
name: Scarcity of Resources

flavor:
That moment of bliss. That feeling of accomplishment. That certainty of purpose.
What's next?
text:
Play only if you made a successful run on R&D, HQ, and Archives this turn.
Access 1 installed card (non-ice).
name: Quest Completed

flavor: Bleeding data is more of a science than an art. Too much and you can end up with a one-way ticket to flatline city. Not enough and you might as well be running an empty server.
text: Whenever you make a successful run, place 1 virus counter on Hemorrhage. [click], 2 hosted virus counters: The Corp trashes 1 card from HQ.
name: Hemorrhage

flavor: Stick with your plan and you'll be fine. Stick with the plan.
text: Whenever a gray ops or black ops operation is trashed after resolving, you may give the Corp 1 bad publicity and take 1 tag. [trash]: Draw 1 card for each bad publicity the Corp has.
name: Tallie Perrault

flavor: "When you need someone who is a little more hands on, look me up." -Silhouette
text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Reveal all cards in HQ.
name: Executive Wiretaps

flavor: The power of the focused mind is a power beyond comprehension.
text: +2[mu] Whenever you expose a card, the Corp must rez it by paying its rez cost, if able. Limit 1 console per player.
name: Blackguard

flavor: "CyberSolutions is a boring name for a company that makes pretty exciting products. Their memory chips have some pretty tricky stuff going on inside and I keep hearing good things about their M/MI implants. I even heard they were on the path to their own androids about a year ago. I wonder whatever happened with that?" -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
name: CyberSolutions Mem Chip

flavor: The beginning…
text:
1[credit]: Break ice subroutine.
1[credit]: +1 strength.
Use Alpha only on the outermost piece of ice protecting a server.
name: Alpha

flavor: …and the end?
text:
1[credit]: Break ice subroutine.
1[credit]: +1 strength.
Use Omega only on the innermost piece of ice protecting a server.
name: Omega

text:
Play only if the Corp has at least 1 bad publicity.
Make a run. The Corp cannot rez ice for the duration of this run.
name: Blackmail

flavor: Blue-one level clearance doesn't exist. And if it did exist, you wouldn't be cleared to know about it.
text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Gain 5[credit] and draw 2 cards.
name: Blue Level Clearance

text: Each time the Runner accesses an agenda from this server, he or she must spend [click] as an additional cost in order to steal it. This applies even during the run on which the Runner trashes Strongbox.
name: Strongbox

text:
Toshiyuki Sakai can be advanced.
If Toshiyuki Sakai is accessed while installed, you may swap him with an agenda or asset from HQ. The new agenda or asset is installed unrezzed, and keeps all advancement tokens on Toshiyuki Sakai. The Runner can choose not to access the new card.
name: Toshiyuki Sakai

flavor: The 'cyber-war' is a war of information, and in a war of information, advance warning can be as good as a killing blow. -Michael Muhama, Musings on Cybercrime
text:
[subroutine] Look at the top card of R&D. You may add that card to the bottom of R&D.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
name: Yagura

flavor: He slowly pried open the lid, and the tantō glinted madly in the half-light. The executive motioned to the blade. Looks like the meeting was being cut short.
text: Trash one of your installed sysops, executives, or clones. If you do, remove up to 2 bad publicity.
name: Restoring Face

text:
If the Runner is tagged when you score Market Research, place 1 agenda counter on it.
Market Research is worth 1 additional agenda point while it has an agenda counter on it.
name: Market Research

flavor: "It can make a real fine roller coaster, provided you're properly stimmed up." -Noise
text: If there is no installed fracter, Wraparound has +7 strength. [subroutine] End the run.
name: Wraparound

flavor: Geostrategic Research and Neothermal Development Laboratories
text: You start the game with 10[credit] and 1 bad publicity.
name: GRNDL: Power Unleashed

flavor: "I did warn you that leaks would have to be patched."
text:
When you score Vulcan Coverup, do 2 meat damage.
When the Runner steals Vulcan Coverup, take 1 bad publicity.
name: Vulcan Coverup

flavor: GRNDL refineries process many different rare elements unearthed during the fracking process.
text:
GRNDL Refinery can be advanced.
[click], [trash]: Gain 4[credit] for each advancement token on GRNDL Refinery.
name: GRNDL Refinery

text:
Gain 1[credit]. Gain [click] if you have not played another Subliminal Messaging this turn.
If the Runner did not make a run during his or her last turn, you may add Subliminal Messaging to HQ from Archives when your turn begins.
name: Subliminal Messaging

flavor: Created by merging the brainscans of over a hundred of the most intelligent people in Haas-Bioroid's cerebral database, its effectiveness is limited beither by its lack of imagination or the imagination of the sysops who employ it.
text:
The rez cost of IQ is increased by 1 for each card in HQ.
IQ has +1 strength for each card in HQ.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: IQ

flavor: Eliza's Toybox is the preeminent purveyor of high-class debauchery on the moon, courtesy of its bioroid pleasure models and other exotica. Every fantasy has its price.
text: [click],[click],[click]: Rez a card, ignoring all costs.
name: Eliza's Toybox

flavor: There are those who believe the nine-tailed fox is an angel in disguise. And then there are those who have followed, and discovered her secret...
text: [subroutine] The Corp may choose a card in HQ. The Runner accesses that card. If he or she does, trash Kitsune.
name: Kitsune

flavor: The port was first built as a remote location to unload and offload dangerous felons.
text: As an additional cost to jack out during a run on this server, the Runner must trash 1 installed program. Limit 1 region per server. Errata from CR 1.2
name: Port Anson Grid

flavor: "There are reports of a terrorist threat at Starport Kaguya. The NAPD is offering a reward for anyone who can provide them with information about the current whereabouts of the individual pictured here. He is considered extremely dangerous and is armed with a PAD and a portable rig."
text: The Runner cannot play current events.
name: The News Now Hour

text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. The first time the Runner makes a successful run each turn, trace 2 if successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
name: Manhunt

text: Wendigo can be advanced. While Wendigo has an odd number of advancement tokens on it, it gains barrier and loses code gate. [subroutine] Choose a program. The Runner cannot use the chosen program for the remainder of this run.
name: Wendigo

flavor: Mars would never have been colonized if not for the Gargarin facilities at Promontorium Agarum.
text: Successful runs against this server are not considered to be successful or unsuccessful for the purposes of card abilities. Limit 1 region per server.
name: Crisium Grid

flavor: The irony is that those who'd want to destroy certain memories can't afford to do so, and those who can afford it-well, they're too busy sipping on dreamwine.
text: When you score Chronos Project, the Runner removes all cards in his or her heap from the game.
name: Chronos Project

text:
Shattered Remains can be advanced.
If you pay 1[credit] when the Runner accesses Shattered Remains, trash 1 piece of hardware for each advancement token on Shattered Remains.
name: Shattered Remains

flavor: He who wields the sword of valor.
text: When the Runner encounters Lancelot, you may reveal up to 2 grail ice from HQ. For the remainder of this run, Lancelot gains the subroutines of the revealed ice in the order of your choice. [subroutine] Trash 1 program.
name: Lancelot

flavor: "Why should we be slaves to our genetic heritage?"
text: Once per turn, break 1 barrier subroutine.
name: Quetzal: Free Spirit

flavor: Bad luck for any sysop blind enough to cross its path.
text: 1[credit]: Break 1 barrier subroutine (or up to 3 subroutines if you spent a credit from a stealth card). 2[credit]: +1 strength (or +2 strength if you spent at least 1 credit from a stealth card).
name: BlacKat

flavor: Carved directly out of the lunar rock, Duggar's is a popular spot among blue-collar loonies and slumming risties. A place where you could find what you're looking for-if you knew who to look for, and didn't get distracted by the energetic dancers.
text: [click],[click],[click],[click]: Draw 10 cards.
name: Duggar's

text: +2[mu] Your maximum hand size is increased by 2. Limit 1 console per player.
name: Box-E

flavor: "I can get you anything, and guarantee the best prices in town."
text:
[click]: Host a resource or piece of hardware from your grip on The Supplier.
When your turn begins, you may install a hosted card, lowering the install cost by 2.
name: The Supplier

flavor: "If you look like you belong, people will ignore you for hours. Or years. It's only when you don't fit in that things start to go wrong." -Exile
text: 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[credit]: +3 strength. Use this ability only by spending a credit from a stealth card.
name: Refractor

flavor: There have been several attempts to create a "world church," uniting all human faiths into a single, harmonious whole. The irony, of course, is that each new "world church" is another schism in humanity's shared religious experience.
text: The first time you have no credits in your credit pool each turn, gain 1[credit].
name: Order of Sol

text:
Whenever you make a successful run on Archives, instead of accessing cards, you may install Hades Shard from your grip, ignoring all costs.
[trash]: Access all cards in Archives.
Limit 1 per deck.
name: Hades Shard

flavor:
"This is Rachel Beckman. She's in the business of keeping people alive."
Rachel smiled. "Only when I'm not in the business of killing them."
text:
You have 1 additional [click] to spend during your turn.
Trash Rachel Beckman if you are tagged.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 3.1</errata>
name: Rachel Beckman

flavor: "We don't want you! We don't need you!"
text: Play only as your first [click]. Draw 1 card for each installed clan resource. Gain 1[credit] for each tag you have.
name: Mars for Martians

flavor: "Subtle? You don't really understand the point of all of this, do you?" -Alice Merchant
text: When your turn begins, you may take 1 tag to place 2 virus counters on God of War. Hosted virus counter: Break ice subroutine. 2[credit]: +1 strength.
name: God of War

flavor: "The perfect Run is when you get in, take something of value, and get back out, with no one knowing you've ever been there" -g00ru
text: Make a run. When the run ends, derez all ice that was rezzed during this run.
name: Leave No Trace

text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, when you would access any number of cards from HQ, you may instead add that many cards from your heap to your grip. Remove Rip Deal from the game instead of trashing it.
name: Rip Deal

flavor: "It's my sentry cheat sheet" -Revenant
text:
6[credit]: Derez a sentry currently being encountered.
1[credit]: +1 strength.
name: Flashbang

flavor: "The question isn't 'should I do it?' the question is 'can I do it?'" -Kabonesa Wu
text: Make a run. If you have 3 or fewer programs installed, all icebreakers have +2 strength during this run.
name: Lean and Mean

text:
Maven has +1 strength for each installed program.
2[credit]: Break ice subroutine.
name: Maven

flavor: "Anyone can hit someone where they are weakest." -S'onge Galaxy
text: During each run, Na'Not'K has +1 strength for each piece of ice protecting the attacked server. 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 3[credit]: +2 strength.
name: Na'Not'K

flavor:
"Talk is free. Anything else is going to cost you."
-Jitish
text: When your turn begins, you may remove 1 card in the heap from the game. If you do, gain 2[credit].
name: Bloo Moose

flavor:
"Is the lack of oxygen causing distress, friend?"
-Gregory 3D3R6Z
text: The Runner may trash 1 card from his or her grip at random. If he or she does not, gain [click][click].
name: O₂ Shortage

text: Trash 1 card from HQ: All ice protecting this server has +2 strength until the end of the run. Use this ability only during a run on this server.
name: Helheim Servers

flavor: "As you'll see on page 276, section CDXXIX, paragraph 47, line 102 of your contract, you are overdue for your seed upgrade, and all growth from out of date seed is to be confiscated and destroyed."
text: When you score Mandatory Seed Replacement, rearrange any number of ice protecting all servers.
name: Mandatory Seed Replacement

flavor: AgInfusion doesn't just have patents on nearly every plant seed that in farmed on Mars—they own most of the rights to the water that farms use.
text: The install cost of each non-virtual resource is increased by 1.
name: Water Monopoly

flavor: "My gift to runners: isomorphic architectural protocols. Ichiban daikirai da." -Midori
text: [subroutine] Swap 2 other installed pieces of ice or 2 of your installed non-ice cards.
name: Metamorph

text:
When the Runner encounters Data Loop, he or she must add 2 cards from his or her grip to the top of the stack.
[subroutine] End the run if the Runner is tagged.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Data Loop

text: Choose resource, hardware or program. The Runner may trash any of his or her cards of that type, and gain 1[credit] for each card trashed. Gain 2[credit] for each installed card of the chosen type.
name: Biased Reporting

flavor:
"Please, speak freely. I've been tasked by the board itself to hear your grievances."
-Mandy Traut
text: After your mandatory draw, reveal the top card of R&D and add it to HQ. Add 1 card from HQ to the top of R&D.
name: Open Forum

text:
You may forfeit an agenda to rez Tithonium instead of paying its rez cost.
Tithonium cannot host cards.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] Trash 1 resource and end the run.
name: Tithonium

text: Turn an agenda faceup and install Transparency Initiative on that agenda as a hosted condition counter with the text "Host agenda gains public. Whenever you advance host agenda, gain 1[credit]."
name: Transparency Initiative

text: Install Rover Algorithm on a rezzed piece of ice as a hosted condition counter with the text "Host ice has +1 strength for each power counter on Rover Algorithm. Whenever the Runner passes host ice, place 1 power counter on Rover Algorithm."
name: Rover Algorithm

text: Make a run on Archives. If successful, instead of accessing cards you may install a program from your heap, ignoring all costs.
name: Retrieval Run

text:
2[credit]: Break ice subroutine.
X is the number of virus counters on Darwin.
When your turn begins, you may pay 1[credit] to place 1 virus counter on Darwin.
name: Darwin

flavor: A two-way solution to a one-way problem, the data leak reversal, or DLR for short, is a misnomer. There is no actual reversal of data, only the creation of a parallel peer-to-peer link with the initial source.
text:
Install only if you made a successful run on a central server this turn.
If you are tagged, Data Leak Reversal gains "[click]: The Corp trashes the top card of R&D."
name: Data Leak Reversal

flavor: Do you believe in faeries?
text: 0[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength. When an encounter with a piece of ice in which you used Faerie to break a subroutine ends, trash Faerie.
name: Faerie

flavor:
"We're always happy to help, Mr. Santiago."
"I appreciate it, Mr. Li."
"We'll be in touch. And, Gabriel…"
"Yes?"
"Don't leave town."
text: [click]: Draw 2 cards. Add 1 of these cards to the bottom of your stack.
name: Mr. Li

flavor: A little corporate restructuring is necessary once in a while.
text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, instead of accessing cards you may look at the top 5 cards of R&D and arrange them in any order.
name: Indexing

flavor: Works best at your own desk.
text: Whenever you access cards from R&D, access 1 additional card from R&D.
name: R&D Interface

text:
Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, place 1 virus counter on Deep Thought.
If there are at least 3 virus counters on Deep Thought, it gains "When your turn begins, you may look at the top card of R&D."
name: Deep Thought

flavor: "New Angeles is the jewel of modern civilization, and its government the envy of nations." -Mayor Wells
text:
2[credit]: Avoid 1 tag.
Trash New Angeles City Hall when you steal an agenda.
name: New Angeles City Hall

flavor: "That's against the rules. The Creators will be angry."
text:
The Runner may spend [click] to break any subroutine on Eli 1.0.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Eli 1.0

flavor: Known for luxury hoppers and a delectable sauerkraut.
text: As an additional cost to make a run on this server, the Runner must spend [click]. Limit 1 region per server.
name: Ruhr Valley

flavor: "I will serve you…for a time."
text:
Ronin can be advanced.
If there are at least 4 advancement tokens on Ronin, it gains "[click], [trash]: Do 3 net damage."
name: Ronin

flavor: "Looks like someone is being naughty…"
text: Once per run, when the Runner approaches a piece of ice protecting this server, you may swap that ice with a piece of ice from HQ. The new ice is installed unrezzed.
name: Midori

flavor: *Some restrictions may apply. Scan this card to find out more.
text: Your maximum hand size is increased by 1.
name: NBN: The World is Yours*

text:
When you score Project Beale, place 1 agenda counter on it for every 2 advancement tokens on it over 3.
Project Beale is worth 1 additional agenda point for each agenda counter on it.
name: Project Beale

text:
Play only if the Runner stole an agenda during his or her last turn.
<trace>Trace 6</trace> If successful, give the Runner tags equal to the amount by which your trace strength exceeded his or her link strength.
name: Midseason Replacements

flavor: A bright light blossomed, and then the console went dark. That's when she smelled smoke.
text: [subroutine]<trace>Trace 6</trace> If successful, trash 1 piece of hardware, do 2 meat damage (cannot be prevented), and end the run.
name: Flare

flavor: They don't call them dedicated for nothing
text: If the Runner is tagged, Dedicated Response Team gains "Whenever a successful run ends, do 2 meat damage."
name: Dedicated Response Team

flavor: "If I had to describe the bugs in one word, it would be '****ing annoying.'" -Whizzard
text: [subroutine] <trace>Trace 0</trace> If successful, the Runner trashes 1 program.
name: Burke Bugs

flavor: There were several ways to win a corporate war. One of them was to bring out the bazookas.
text: If you have at least 7[credit] when you score Corporate War, gain 7[credit]; otherwise, lose all credits in your credit pool.
name: Corporate War

text:
Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards, force the Corp to trash the top card of R&D. You may reveal X copies of Fear the Masses from your grip to force the Corp to trash X additional cards.
Limit 6 per deck.
name: Fear the Masses

flavor: The Destroyer.
text: 1[credit]: Break ice subroutine on a piece of ice that has a rez cost of 5 or greater. 1[credit]: +1 strength. 2[credit]: Swap Aghora with a deva program from your grip.
name: Aghora

flavor: "They don't want to listen, so we'll just have to crank up the volume."
text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ each turn, force the Corp to trash the top card of R&D.
name: Bhagat

text:
The Corp cannot win the game except if you are flatlined.
When your turn begins, place 1 power counter on The Black File. When there are 3 or more power counters on The Black File, remove it from the game.
Limit 1 per deck.
<errata>Errata from CR 1.2</errata>
name: The Black File

text: As an additional cost to play this event, trash an installed connection. The Corp cannot advance cards during his or her next turn. Remove The Price of Freedom from the game instead of trashing it.
name: The Price of Freedom

text: If you use Ankusa to break all subroutines on a barrier during a single encounter, add that barrier to HQ. 2[credit]: Break barrier subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
name: Ankusa

text: Secretly spend up to 2[credit]. The Corp guesses how much you spent. Reveal spent credits. If the Corp guessed incorrectly, make a run and choose a piece of ice protecting the attacked server. Bypass that ice when you encounter it.
name: Rigged Results

flavor: "When the enemy has mastered the battlefield, change the battlefield." -The Playbook
text:
When you rez Magnet, host a program on it that is hosted on an installed piece of ice.
The text box of each program hosted on Magnet is blank.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Magnet

flavor: "Practical effects are expensive, but worth it. I had to smash seventeen stunt bioroids to get this shot." -Parvati Kapoor, director
text: Gain 4[credit]. You may install 1 card (paying the install cost).
name: Lateral Growth

flavor: They eat us, we eat them, the cycle goes on and on. -Omar Keung, "the Flashpoint"
text: When Improved Protein Source is scored or stolen, the Runner gains 4[credit].
name: Improved Protein Source

text:
Play only if there is an agenda in the Runner's score area.
You and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, trash 1 resource.
name: Voter Intimidation

flavor: We Know What You Want.
text: If the Runner is tagged, he or she plays with his or her grip revealed.
name: Harishchandra Ent.: Where You're the Star

flavor: The costumes aren't strictly necessary, but they improve the performances of the vactors and sensie stars.
text:
Full Immersion RecStudio can host up to 2 assets and/or agendas.
The trash cost of Full Immersion RecStudio is increased by 3 for each card hosted on it.
name: Full Immersion RecStudio

text: This card costs 0 influence if you have 6 or more non-alliance [nbn] cards in your deck. As an additional cost to rez Ibrahim Salem, forfeit an agenda. When your turn begins, name a card type. Look at the Runner's grip and trash 1 card in it of the named type.
name: Ibrahim Salem

flavor: The entertainment capital of Mumbad.
text: During a run on this server, the Runner cannot use paid abilities on non-icebreaker cards. Limit 1 region per server.
name: Navi Mumbai City Grid

text:
Zealous Judge can only be rezzed if the Runner is tagged.
[click], 1[credit]: Give the Runner 1 tag.
name: Zealous Judge

flavor: "A new administration means we have to start greasing the wheels all over again. Let's get to work."
text: Trash all cards in HQ (minimum of 1). Draw 5 cards.
name: Election Day

flavor: Judicious use of freelancers can increase efficiency and protect the company from legal repercussions. It's what they call a "win-win".
text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
Play up to 2 operations from HQ (paying all costs), resolving them one at a time.
name: Subcontract

flavor: Survival of the fittest' is so outdated; in finance it's 'survival of the fattest.' -Omar Keung, "the Flashpoint"
text: Merger is worth 1 additional agenda point while in the Runner's score area.
name: Merger

flavor: Evolving a Better You.
text: Each player needs 1 fewer agenda point to win the game.
name: Harmony Medtech: Biomedical Pioneer

flavor: Perfecting the Imperfect.
text: Whenever you and the Runner reveal secretly spent credits, gain 1[credit].
name: Nisei Division: The Next Generation

text: When your turn begins, you may place 1 advancement token on a card if the Runner did not make a successful run during his or her last turn.
name: Tennin Institute: The Secrets Within

text: Place 3 agenda counters on House of Knives when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: Do 1 net damage. Use this ability only during a run and only once per run.
name: House of Knives

flavor: "You won't feel it. Or anything else, for that matter."
text: Lower the advancement requirement of each Medical Breakthrough by 1. This ability is active even while Medical Breakthrough is in the Runner's score area.
name: Medical Breakthrough

text:
When you score Philotic Entanglement, do 1 net damage for each agenda in the Runner's score area.
Limit 1 Philotic Entanglement per deck.
name: Philotic Entanglement

text: When the Runner accesses The Future Perfect, you and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, prevent The Future Perfect from being stolen. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses The Future Perfect while it is installed.
name: The Future Perfect

text:
The Runner's maximum hand size is reduced by 2.
If Chairman Hiro is trashed while being accessed, add him to the Runner's score area as an agenda worth 2 agenda points.
name: Chairman Hiro

flavor: The whitewashed walls dropped away and a beautiful zen garden appeared. It was all an illusion, but it was a comforting illusion.
text:
Gain 1[credit] when your turn begins.
The Runner's maximum hand size is increased by 1.
name: Mental Health Clinic

text: If the Runner exposes or accesses Psychic Field while installed, you and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, do 1 net damage for each card in the Runner's grip.
name: Psychic Field

text: When the Runner accesses Shi.Kyū, you may pay X[credit]. The Runner must take either X net damage or add Shi.Kyū to his or her score area as an agenda worth -1 agenda point. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses Shi.Kyū from R&D.
name: Shi.Kyū

flavor: The Tenma clones became Jinteki's third highest-grossing line ever due to the rapid urban expansion that occurred after the war. Their unparalleled reaction times, safety records, and punctuality have made them the top choice for shipping and transportation services.
text: [click]: Swap 2 pieces of installed ice.
name: Tenma Line

text:
Play only if the Runner made a successful run during his or her last turn.
You and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, he or she chooses to suffer 1 brain damage or take 1 tag.
name: Cerebral Cast

flavor: "Together we have all but eradicated natural diseases from the face of this planet. The new spectre of synthetic disease-of bioterrorism-demands that we continue our efforts."
text: Gain 8[credit]. The Runner gains 3[credit].
name: Medical Research Fundraiser

text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Install an asset, agenda, or upgrade from HQ in a new remote server. Place 3 advancement tokens on that card. You cannot score or rez that card until your next turn begins.
name: Mushin No Shin

flavor: Trapped in their own reality, a paralyzed runner cannot even jack out.
text:
[subroutine] The Runner cannot break any subroutines on the next piece of ice he or she encounters during this run.
[subroutine] The Runner cannot jack out until after encountering the next piece of ice during this run.
name: Inazuma

text: When the Runner encounters Komainu, it gains "[subroutine] Do 1 net damage." for each card in the Runner's grip for the remainder of this run.
name: Komainu

flavor: Yip Yip!
text:
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage unless the Runner pays 1[credit].
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage unless the Runner pays 1[credit].
name: Pup

flavor: When locked in a fortress in your own mind, be careful what door you open.
text:
[subroutine] Look at the top 3 cards of R&D and arrange them in any order.
[subroutine] The Runner accesses the top card of R&D unless the Corp pays 1[credit].
name: Shiro

flavor: Certain areas of cyberspace are dominated by a single digital entity. Runners call them 'gods', and only a miracle can save those foolish enough to enter their domain.
text: [subroutine] If not already running on Archives, the Runner is now running on Archives instead of passing Susanoo-no-Mikoto. The Runner cannot jack out until after he or she encounters a piece of ice.
name: Susanoo-no-Mikoto

flavor: It is difficult to go to Japan without ending up in the sprawl of NeoTokyo.
text: The first time an advancement token is a placed on a card in this server each turn, gain 1[credit]. Limit 1 region per server.
name: NeoTokyo Grid

flavor: Known as the Red Woman, Hanzō is notorious for her ruthless methods of server protection.
text: The first time you would do any amount of net damage during each run on this server, instead you may pay 2[credit] to do 1 brain damage.
name: Tori Hanzō

text:
Plan B can be advanced.
If the Runner accesses Plan B, you may reveal and score an agenda from HQ with an advancement requirement equal to or less than the number of advancement tokens on Plan B.
name: Plan B

flavor: Out of the corner of his vision, a flash of light. He felt a thud as his grip on cyberspace loosened. Spider didn't like this. He should have bypassed the outer layer of ice by jacking in from the internal server. Another thud, and his whole frame shook with the resounding shockwave. He desperately reached for his shuriken…
text:
Guard cannot be bypassed.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Guard

flavor: The annual review of ice as published by the NSCA consistently gives top marks to the ice that provide the most impact in relation to their size and upkeep cost. Critics of the NSCA point to the bounce ratio as the most important stat when judging ice.
text: [subroutine] End the run.
name: Rainbow

flavor: YucaBean has seen astounding growth in even the most remote markets.
text: Gain 1[credit] for each remote server with a card installed in it.
name: Diversified Portfolio

flavor: The longer the employees didn't look at the Doomsday Clock, the more it gnawed at the back of their minds. A quick look only reinforced what they already knew: there wasn't enough time.
text: Search R&D for an agenda, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
name: Fast Track

flavor: "Truth is a fickle mistress."
text: When your turn begins, gain 2[credit] if the Corp has more scored agenda points than you.
name: Iain Stirling: Retired Spook

flavor: "Try to keep up."
text: The first time you play a run event each turn, gain 1[credit].
name: Ken "Express" Tenma: Disappeared Clone

flavor: "Don't waste my time."
text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ each turn, you may expose 1 card.
name: Silhouette: Stealth Operative

flavor: A job is only as strong as the weakest link. Thankfully Ms. Jones is always on time.
text: Gain 1[credit] for each installed connection resource.
name: Calling in Favors

flavor: Tenma clones are excellent at multitasking, their brains custom-made for parallel processing.
text:
Play only as your first click.
Make a run and gain [click].
name: Early Bird

flavor: The clone was surprised to see the red-jacketed man. It was like looking in a mirror, only the mirror made him look…cool. Confident. Individual.
text: Look at the top 4 cards of your stack and add 1 of those cards to your grip. Shuffle your stack.
name: Express Delivery

flavor: Stirling entered the server, passing a growling piece of ice. He was unarmed…or so it seemed.
text: Make a run on HQ. Bypass the first 2 pieces of ice encountered during this run. If successful, you cannot access any cards.
name: Feint

flavor: "I work by referral only, with an up-front fee. The fee is reasonable if you value results." -Silhouette
text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, access 2 additional cards from HQ.
name: Legwork

text: As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click]. Search your stack for a run event and play that run event (paying its play cost), ignoring any additional costs. Shuffle your stack.
name: Planned Assault

text: +1[mu] Your maximum hand size is increased by 1. Whenever the Corp scores an agenda, you may search your stack for a card and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack. Limit 1 console per player.
name: Logos

flavor: Express loved libraries. The consoles were weak, but the security even weaker. He wirelessly loaded up his personal blend of code and started cloning the drive. In just a few minutes, another zombie would claw its way to the surface of cyberspace.
text: 1[recurring-credit] Use this credit to play run events.
name: Public Terminal

text: Use Unregistered S&W '35 only if you have made a successful run on HQ this turn. [click], [click]: Trash 1 rezzed bioroid, clone, executive, or sysop in a server without paying its trash cost.
name: Unregistered S&W '35

flavor: The grass looked greener on the other side of the tear. But it always did, and there was always another tear.
text: [click]: Draw 1 card from the bottom of your stack.
name: Window

flavor: Appearances are easy to change in cyberspace, but a high-quality render is not easy to mimic.
text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 2[credit]: +3 strength. Alias cannot be used on ice protecting a remote server.
name: Alias

text: 2[credit]: Break up to 3 barrier subroutines. 2[credit]: +4 strength. Breach cannot be used on ice protecting a remote server.
name: Breach

flavor: The digital equivalent of a fly on the wall.
text:
Install only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn.
Whenever the Corp draws a card, you may pay 2[credit] to reveal that card.
name: Bug

flavor: Catch me if you can!
text: 1[credit]: Break tracer subroutine. 2[credit]: +3 strength.
name: Gingerbread

flavor: If speed is of the essence, an indirect encounter with a piece of ice is usually best.
text: [trash]: Break all but 1 subroutine on a piece of ice.
name: Grappling Hook

flavor: Nothing is secure when you have the right documentation.
text: 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 2[credit]: +2 strength. Passport cannot be used on ice protecting a remote server.
name: Passport

text: Secretly spend any number of credits. The Corp guesses if you spent an even or odd amount. Reveal spent credits. If the Corp guessed incorrectly, gain credits equal to twice the amount spent.
name: Push Your Luck

flavor: She was as good as Mr. Li said. The source machine had been compromised in under 24 hours. If a freelance operative could do that, the server clearly wasn't ready to endure Gagarin's legion of corp-owned runners.
text:
When your turn begins, you may choose a server. The first time you make a successful run on that server this turn, instead of accessing cards, gain 2[credit].
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.0</errata>
name: Security Testing

flavor: "Why is a raven like a typing desk?"
text:
When you install Theophilius Bagbiter, lose all credits in your credit pool.
Your maximum hand size is equal to the number of credits in your credit pool.
name: Theophilius Bagbiter

flavor:
She slipped back onto her hopper. "I'm your family now, so don't twist me, dǒng ma?"
He flicked the e-cig away from his mouth, and nodded. What had he gotten himself into?
text:
You cannot use Tri-maf Contact more than once per turn.
[click]: Gain 2[credit].
When Tri-maf Contact is trashed, suffer 3 meat damage.
name: Tri-maf Contact

flavor: "Welcome to the mass install wizard! This wizard will guide you through the process of installing a whole mess of programs onto your almost-certainly inadequate rig. When you're ready to continue, say-oops, too late, here we go!"
text: Install up to 3 programs from your grip (paying the install costs).
name: Mass Install

flavor: One of the core problems of quantum computing is isolating the system from external factors to prevent decoherence. The Q-Coherence Chip is one, imperfect, solution.
text:
+1[mu]
Trash Q-Coherence Chip when an installed program is trashed.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 3.0.1</errata>
name: Q-Coherence Chip

text: Place 1 power counter on Overmind when it is installed for each unused MU. Hosted power counter: Break ice subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
name: Overmind

flavor: "The best place to hide is in plain sight, don't you think?"
text:
You cannot use Oracle May more than once per turn.
[click]: Name a card type. Reveal the top card of your stack. If the revealed card is of the named type, draw it and gain 2[credit]. Otherwise, trash it.
name: Oracle May

flavor: You can find Donut in the park on Thursday afternoons, playing backgammon. You want his attention, the price is always the same: a cup of coffee and a donut. That buys you a seat at the backgammon table, and you have until he beats you to talk business and set the price.
text: The play cost of operations and events is increased by 1.
name: Donut Taganes

flavor: You must yell "surge" to get the full effect.
text:
Play only if you placed at least 1 virus counter on a program this turn.
Place 2 virus counters on that program.
name: Surge

flavor:
And all should cry, Beware! Beware!
His flashing eyes, his floating hair!
Weave a circle round him thrice,
And close your eyes with holy dread,
For he on honey-dew hath fed,
And drunk the milk of Paradise.
-Samuel Taylor Coleridge
text: The rez cost of all ice is increased by 1.
name: Xanadu

flavor: "I run with the best."
text: You draw a starting hand of 9 cards.
name: Andromeda: Dispossessed Ristie

flavor: She preferred to do business in a club. Something about the lights and dancers clouded the judgment of the corporate simpletons she met there.
text: Remove 1 tag. You may pay 1[credit] to add Networking to your grip instead of trashing it.
name: Networking

flavor: If you don't have someone on the inside, find someone on the inside who's fond of desk ornaments.
text: Whenever you access cards from HQ, access 1 additional card from HQ.
name: HQ Interface

text:
X[recurring-credit]
Use these credits during runs on HQ. X is the number of virus counters on Pheromones.
Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, place 1 virus counter on Pheromones.
name: Pheromones

flavor: She at her P.A.D. I at my rig. Low lights. Smooth jazz. Love blooms.
text: Draw 5 cards.
name: Quality Time

flavor: Do you really need another one?
text: Whenever you install a piece of hardware (including Replicator), you may search your stack for another copy of that hardware, reveal it, and add it your grip. Shuffle your stack.
name: Replicator

flavor:
"The itsy bitsy spider went up the data spout…"
-Chaos Theory
text: If you have at least 2[link], the memory cost of Creeper is 0, even if it is not installed. 2[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
name: Creeper

flavor: Early permutations of the kraken proved to be insatiable, ice-devouring marauders. Not much has changed.
text:
Play only if you stole an agenda this turn.
Choose a server. The Corp trashes 1 piece of ice protecting that server.
name: Kraken

flavor: "You aren't the only type of runner in New Angeles."
text:
You cannot use Kati Jones more than once per turn.
[click]: Place 3[credit] from the bank on Kati Jones.
[click]: Take all credits from Kati Jones.
name: Kati Jones

text:
Place 16[credit] from the bank on Eve Campaign when it is rezzed. When there are no credits left on Eve Campaign, trash it.
When your turn begins, take 2[credit] from Eve Campaign.
name: Eve Campaign

flavor: Also known as "development hell."
text: Shuffle 1 card from HQ into R&D.
name: Rework

flavor: "This ice sucks." -g00ru
text: [subroutine] The Runner cannot jack out for the remainder of this run. Trash Whirlpool.
name: Whirlpool

flavor: Despite its appearance, the Hokusai Grid is the most notorious research facility at Jinteki.
text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, do 1 net damage. Limit 1 region per server.
name: Hokusai Grid

flavor: Sniff.
text: [subroutine] <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, look at a number of cards from the top of the Runner's stack equal to the amount by which your trace strength exceeded his or her link strength. Trash 1 of those cards, and arrange the rest in any order.
name: Data Hound

flavor: Keeping tabs on the world, one screen at a time.
text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, <trace>trace 5</trace> if successful, give the Runner 1 tag. If unsuccessful, trash Bernice Mai.
name: Bernice Mai

flavor: You're not in Kansas anymore.
text: Salvage can be advanced only while rezzed and gains “[subroutine] <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.” for each advancement token on it.
name: Salvage

flavor: "A job done once is a job done right."
text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to advance cards in or protecting this server.
name: Simone Diego

flavor: "It's kind of like an anagram." -designer Phoenix
text: Trace 7 If successful, trash 1 virtual resource or 1 link.
name: Foxfire

flavor: "When your opponent is weak, strike. If you do not, he will become strong." - the Playbook
text:
Play only if you made a successful run this turn.
Trash an unrezzed piece of ice you passed during the last run you made this turn.
name: En Passant

flavor: Omar goes through four, five keyboards per week, no two from the same decade.
text: Look at the top 10 cards of your stack. If any of those cards are programs, you may install one of them, lowering the install cost by 5. Trash the rest of those cards.
name: Frantic Coding

text: +2[mu] Whenever you access cards from HQ during a run, access 1 additional card for each piece of ice protecting HQ that you broke all subroutines on during this run. Limit 1 console per player.
name: The Gauntlet

flavor: Spiraling even higher, every feature of cyberspace sprawled before it.
text: 1[credit]: Break barrier subroutine. 2[credit]: +2 strength. 2[credit], return Saker to your grip: Derez a barrier. Use this ability only after using Saker to break all the subroutines on that barrier during a single encounter.
name: Saker

flavor: "I used to run stims, simsensies, the usual. I was scum. Now I run water. I'm a fragging hero."
text: [click],[click]: Draw 3 cards. Shuffle 1 card from your grip into your stack.
name: Blockade Runner

flavor: "Nothing up my sleeve..."
text: 1[recurring-credit] Use this credit to pay for using icebreakers.
name: Ele "Smoke" Scovak: Cynosure of the Net

flavor: "I usually find something interesting in there. Just not what I was looking for."
text: Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, instead of accessing cards, you may choose 1 of the top 5 cards of R&D and access it. You cannot access any other cards in R&D during this run.
name: Top Hat

flavor: The personality must be bigger than the prop.
text: 1[credit]: Break barrier subroutine. 3[credit]: +4 strength for the remainder of this run. Use this ability only by spending at least 1 credit from a stealth card.
name: Blackstone

flavor: "Take this to Inez Delgado in Netcrimes. No one else."
text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. While secretly spending credits, players cannot spend 2[credit].
name: Government Investigations

flavor: "The Starlight Meditation Booths are available to refugees for free for the duration of the crisis."
text: If you are tagged when your turn ends, force the Corp to "Trace 1 If unsuccessful, the Runner removes 1 tag." [trash],trash all cards in your grip: Prevent all meat damage.
name: Citadel Sanctuary

flavor: "I let the bioroids do a ride-along via remote, so they can see what pain really looks like." -Agent Valkyrie
text: Install Wetwork Refit on a rezzed piece of bioroid ice as a condition counter with the text "Host ice gains "[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage." before all its other subroutines."
name: Wetwork Refit

text: The first time the Runner passes a rezzed piece of bioroid ice each turn, you may rez a bioroid, lowering its rez cost by 4.
name: Haas-Bioroid: Architects of Tomorrow

flavor: "Does an alliance with the yakuza truly seem so strange? They are honorable businessmen, and women, just like us." -Rin Kimura, Chief NA Security
text: Whenever you and the Runner reveal secretly spent credits, do 1 meat damage if you and the Runner spent a different number of credits.
name: Fumiko Yamamori

flavor: "Keep your head down, keep moving, try not to attract attention."
text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, trash the top card of R&D.
Draw 3 cards. Add 3 cards from HQ to the top of R&D in any order.
name: Hasty Relocation

text:
When the Runner encounters Data Ward, he or she must pay 3[credit] or take 1 tag.
[subroutine] End the run if the Runner is tagged.
[subroutine] End the run if the Runner is tagged.
[subroutine] End the run if the Runner is tagged.
[subroutine] End the run if the Runner is tagged.
name: Data Ward

flavor: Falstaff-337B; decrypt-ok; loc:0.258500, -79.920791 -ok; auth-ok; msg:KAR kill authority requested y/n?
text: If the Runner is tagged, Drone Screen gains "Whenever the Runner initiates a run on this server, <trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, do 1 meat damage (cannot be prevented)."
name: Drone Screen

text: Whenever an encounter with a piece of ice ends, place 1 power counter on Chief Slee for each unbroken subroutine on the encountered piece of ice. [click], 5 hosted power counters: Do 5 meat damage.
name: Chief Slee

text: When you rez Bulwark, take 1 bad publicity. When the Runner encounters Bulwark, gain 2[credit] if there is an installed AI. [subroutine] The Runner trashes 1 program. [subroutine] The Corp gains 2[credit]. End the run. [subroutine] The Corp gains 2[credit]. End the run.
name: Bulwark

flavor: When a shooting war threatens, the prudent course is to shoot first.
text: Trash 1 installed card with an install cost equal to or less than the number of tags the Runner has.
name: Best Defense

text:
After you resolve this operation, end your action phase.
Shuffle 3 cards from Archives into R&D. Remove Preemptive Action from the game instead of trashing it.
name: Preemptive Action

flavor: Eat. Code. Sleep. Eat. Code. Sleep. Eat. Code. Eat. Code. Sleep. Eat. Code. Code. Sleep. Code. Code. Code. Eat. Code. Code. Code. Code. Code. Code.
text: [click], suffer 1 net damage: Gain 1[credit] and draw 2 cards. Use this ability only once per turn.
name: Zer0

text: Whenever you make a successful run, you may place 1 virus counter on Musaazi. Virus counter from any installed card: Break sentry subroutine. Virus counter from any installed card: +1 strength.
name: Musaazi

flavor: Getting it up the stairs was enough for him to know that if he ever moved, it was staying.
text: The first time you break all subroutines on the outermost piece of ice during a run each turn, you may remove Hippo from the game to trash that piece of ice.
name: Hippo

flavor: Her gallop, thunder; her blade, lightning.
text: 2[credit]: Break up to 3 code gate subroutines. 2[credit]: +3 strength. The first time each turn an encounter ends in which you used Amina to break all subroutines on a piece of ice, the Corp loses 1[credit].
name: Amina

text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards, you may force the Corp to lose up to 5[credit], then you may gain 1[credit] for each credit lost.
name: Diversion of Funds

flavor:
"You called me, sir?"
"Why does my PAD keep flashing 'Sensitive Information Transfer'?!"
"Hmm, that's strange. Mine only does that on Tuesdays."
text:
The first time the Corp gains credits through a card ability each turn, you may gain 1[credit].
[click], 3[credit]: Trash PAD Tap. Only the Corp can use this ability.
name: PAD Tap

flavor: It was a deal, to be sure. She just didn't know for which party.
text: [click], [trash], trash a card from your grip: Install a program, piece of hardware, or virtual resource from your heap, paying its install cost.
name: Reclaim

text: When you encounter a piece of ice, you may pay 2[credit] to have it gain code gate until the end of the encounter. Use this ability only once per turn. 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 2[credit]: +4 strength.
name: Engolo

text:
Flame-out can host a single program.
When you install Flame-out, place 9[credit] on it. Use these credits to pay for using hosted program.
When a turn ends in which you used credits on Flame-out, trash hosted program.
name: Flame-out

flavor: "The way I see it, I'm teaching them a lesson in the importance of basic security." - Sunny Lebeau
text: Force the Corp to "<trace>Trace 4</trace> If unsuccessful, the Runner accesses 2 additional cards whenever he or she accesses cards from HQ or R&D for the remainder of this turn".
name: Black Hat

text:
The first time a successful run on a remote server ends each turn, you may place 1 power counter on Kasi String if you accessed cards and stole no agendas.
When Kasi String has 4 or more power counters on it, add it to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.
name: Kasi String

flavor: Defenses that last forever.
text: The rez cost of NEXT Diamond is lowered by 1 for each other rezzed piece of NEXT ice. [subroutine] Do 1 brain damage. [subroutine] Do 1 brain damage. [subroutine] Trash 1 installed Runner card.
name: NEXT Diamond

text:
Play only if the Runner trashed at least 1 Corp card during his or her last turn.
The Runner has 3 fewer [click] to spend during his or her next turn. The Runner may immediately suffer 1 brain damage to prevent this. Remove Riot Suppression from the game instead of trashing it.
name: Riot Suppression

text: Once per turn, when the Runner approaches a server, you may install a piece of ice protecting that server in the innermost position, ignoring all costs. The Runner is now approaching that ice.
name: Mti Mwekundu: Life Improved

text:
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage unless the Runner trashes the top 2 cards of the stack.
[subroutine] Do 2 net damage unless the Runner trashes the top 3 cards of the stack.
[subroutine] Do 3 net damage unless the Runner trashes the top 4 cards of the stack.
name: Mlinzi

flavor: "Deep down, everyone wants to be good. We ensure that desire is met." - Taavi Gyula
text: The first time the Runner plays a run event or installs an icebreaker program each turn, you may give the Runner 1 tag.
name: Better Citizen Program

flavor: "Once we have enough data, we can make the Invisible Hand more like an Invisible Fist."
text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
The Runner loses 3[credit] for each tag he or she has, then you gain 1[credit] for each credit lost.
name: Market Forces

flavor:
INTRUDER ALERT!
INTRUDER ALERT!
INTRUDER NEUTRALIZED!
text:
X is twice the number of ice protecting this server.
[subroutine]<trace>Trace X</trace> If successful, give the Runner 2 tags.
[subroutine]<trace>Trace X</trace> If successful, end the run.
name: Surveyor

flavor: "You can't do thi..."
text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
Do 2 meat damage for each tag the Runner has.
name: High-Profile Target

text: False Flag can be advanced. When the Runner accesses False Flag, give the Runner 1 tag for every 2 advancement tokens on False Flag. [click], 7 hosted advancement tokens: add False Flag to your score area as an agenda worth 3 agenda points.
name: False Flag

flavor: "While there have been other anti-corporation movements before, like the Maroon Wave, this new one is different. It's organized." -Ramesh Gupta, One World Economy
text: Make a run. When the run ends, trash 1 piece of ice that was rezzed during this run.
name: Run Amok

text:
[trash]: Prevent up to X net or brain damage. Trash cards from the top of your stack equal to the amount of damage prevented. X is the number of copies of Ramujan-reliant 550 BMI installed (including the one just trashed).
Limit 6 per deck.
name: Ramujan-reliant 550 BMI

flavor: The greatest trick is not the trick itself, but in making someone believe that it is no trick at all. To your average sysop, it's magic. To your average runner, it's a closely held trade secret.
text: Unbroken subroutines resolve in the order of your choice.
name: Street Magic

text: Make a run on a server with at least 1 piece of unrezzed ice. When the run ends, gain 12[credit] if it was successful.
name: High-Stakes Job

flavor: It is the hardest thing in the world to frighten a mongoose, because he is eaten up from nose to tail with curiosity. The motto of all the mongoose family is "Run and find out". -Rudyard Kipling, Rikki-Tikki-Tavi
text: You cannot use Mongoose to break subroutines on more than one ice per run. 1[credit]: Break up to 2 sentry subroutines. 2[credit]: +2 strength.
name: Mongoose

flavor: "Mirrormode on."
text: Avoid the first tag during each run.
name: Jesminder Sareen: Girl Behind the Curtain

text: +2[mu] Once per turn, immediately after you access a card from R&D, you may add that card to the bottom of R&D. If you do, take 1 tag. Limit 1 console per player.
name: Maya

flavor: "The basics should be like the stories you learned as a child—unconscious, never forgotten, and suddenly relevant at the most random times." -g00ru
text: Once per turn, when you encounter a piece of ice, you may have it gain 1 subtype of your choice that is not sentry, code gate, or barrier for the remainder of this run.
name: Panchatantra

flavor: "We can forgive a man for making a useful thing as long as he does not admire it. The only excuse for making a useless thing is that one admires it intensely." -Oscar Wilde
text: Forfeit an agenda: Search your stack for a card and install it (paying the install cost). Shuffle your stack.
name: Artist Colony

flavor: Legions of software engineers have been manufactured within its halls.
text:
[click]: Place 1 power counter on Chatterjee University.
[click]: Install a program from your grip, lowering the install cost by 1 for each power counter on Chatterjee University. Remove 1 hosted power counter.
name: Chatterjee University

flavor: "I don't want a hopper. I've never even owned one. But every time I jack in, that same damn ad loads." -2xTiger
text: The first time the Runner initiates a run each turn, you may draw 1 card or gain 1[credit].
name: Advanced Concept Hopper

text:
The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Vikram 1.0.
[subroutine] The Runner cannot use programs for the remainder of this run.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, do 1 brain damage.
name: Vikram 1.0

flavor: It is only by respecting the past that we can build a better future.
text: This card costs 0 influence if you have 6 or more non-alliance [jinteki] cards in your deck. Draw 3 cards. Add 1 card from HQ to the top of R&D.
name: Heritage Committee

text: Whenever the Runner passes a piece of ice protecting this server, you may swap that ice with another piece of ice protecting this server. Limit 1 region per server.
name: Mumbad City Grid

flavor: "A new property has two, maybe three hours. If it doesn't sell, cut it and move on."
text:
When your turn begins, you may look at the top card of the Runner's stack.
[trash]: The Runner trashes the top card of his or her stack.
name: Kala Ghoda Real TV

text: [subroutine] For the remainder of this run, the Runner must pay 1[credit] as an additional cost each time he or she uses an icebreaker to break at least 1 subroutine. [subroutine] For the remainder of this run, the Runner must pay 1[credit] as an additional cost each time he or she uses an icebreaker to break at least 1 subroutine.
name: Interrupt 0

flavor: "Never cut the ribbon until you have something to show off." -Eta Shah, VP Global Expansion
text: Place 3 advancement tokens on a faceup card. You cannot score that card until your next turn begins.
name: Dedication Ceremony

flavor: Those who are the wisest know the least.
text:
This card costs 0 influence if you have 15 or fewer ice in your deck.
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to rez cards.
name: Mumba Temple

flavor: "And here we see the Polar Bear, once the largest land carnivore on Earth."
text:
This card costs 0 influence if you have 50 or more cards in your deck.
When your turn begins, you may shuffle 1 card from Archives into R&D.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 3.1</errata>
name: Museum of History

flavor: "These things are always there, under the surface, but no one wants to know the truth." -Omar Keung, the Flashpoint
text: Whenever you encounter a sentry, you may install MKUltra from your heap (paying its install cost). 3[credit]: +2 strength. Break up to 2 sentry subroutines, if able.
name: MKUltra

flavor: "Never, ever, overstay your welcome." -Andromeda
text: Install On the Lam on a resource as a hosted condition counter with the text "[trash]: Avoid up to 3 tags or prevent up to 3 damage."
name: On the Lam

flavor: Her ability to analyze and adapt mid-run bordered on the paranormal.
text: Make a run, and place 4[credit] on this card, which you may use only during this run. When this run ends, trash 1 program (cannot be prevented) used during this run.
name: Cold Read

flavor: It is only the illusion of choice.
text: Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, you may reveal the top card of R&D. If you do, you may force the Corp to draw that card.
name: Equivocation

flavor: "It's the most fundamental element of illusions and running both. In either case, it should be the first skill you master." -Ele "Smoke" Scovak
text: [click], [click], X[credit]: Remove X tags.
name: Misdirection

flavor: "It had been hoped that the Network disruptions surrounding the conflict might also disrupt the phenomenon. Evidently, the reverse is true." -Joséo Greene, SYNC Analyst
text: The first time you trash an installed card each turn, draw 1 card.
name: Reaver

flavor: This is my USMC-XOB32. There are many like it, but this one is mine.
text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The Corp cannot rez non-ice cards during the Runner's turn.
name: Interdiction

flavor: "She was riding in a great iron mortar and driving it with the pestle, and as she came she swept away her trail behind her with a kitchen broom." -Vasilissa the Beautiful
text: You may host any number of non-AI icebreaker programs on Baba Yaga. Baba Yaga gains the paid abilities of all hosted icebreaker programs.
name: Baba Yaga

text:
[subroutine] End the run unless the Runner pays 4[credit].
[subroutine] End the run unless the Runner pays 4[credit].
[subroutine] End the run unless the Runner trashes 1 of his or her installed cards.
[subroutine] End the run unless the Runner suffers 1 brain damage.
name: Fairchild

flavor: Friends give friends advance warning before moving a carrier group down to enforce a no-fly zone.
text:
After you resolve this operation, end your action phase.
Install up to 2 cards from Archives (paying all install costs).
name: Friends in High Places

text: If the Runner has fewer than 6[credit] or no unspent clicks when a successful run on this server ends, you have 1 additional [click] to spend your next turn. Limit 1 region per server.
name: Manta Grid

text: [subroutine] You and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, choose another server. The Runner is now running on that server instead of passing Mind Game. For the remainder of the run, the Runner must add 1 installed card to the bottom of his or her stack as an additional cost to jack out.
name: Mind Game

text: If the Runner has fewer than 6[credit] or fewer than 2 cards in his or her grip when there is a successful run on this server, you may look at the top 5 cards of R&D and swap 1 of those cards with a card in HQ. Limit 1 region per server.
