name: Nihongai Grid

flavor: //Connection Terminated
text: When the Runner encounters IP Block, give him or her 1 tag if there is an installed AI. [subroutine] Trace 3 If successful, give the Runner 1 tag. [subroutine] End the run if the Runner is tagged.
name: IP Block

flavor: Truth like the sunlight shines above all.
text:
When the Runner encounters Thoth, give him or her 1 tag.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, do 1 net damage for each tag the Runner has.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, the Runner loses 1[credit] for each tag he or she has.
name: Thoth

flavor: "I don't get paid to be calm."
text:
When your turn begins, place 1 advancement token on Anson Rose.
Whenever you rez a piece of ice, you may move any number of advancement tokens from Anson Rose to that ice.
name: Anson Rose

text:
Mausolus can be advanced.
If Mausolus has 3 or more advancement tokens on it, do the parenthetical text instead (otherwise, do not resolve it).
[subroutine] The Corp gains 1[credit]. (The Corp gains 3[credit].)
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage. (Do 3 net damage.)
[subroutine] Give the Runner 1 tag. (Give the Runner 1 tag and end the run.)
name: Mausolus

flavor: There is a special place in hell for the first person who mined cyberspace.
text:
If Sapper is accessed from R&D, the runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Sapper, he or she encounters it. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses Sapper from Archives.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
name: Sapper

flavor: Walk loudly and carry a bigger stick.
text: When you score Show of Force, do 2 meat damage.
name: Show of Force

flavor: "Get those civilians off the street. No more collateral damage." -Commissioner Dawn
text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. The Runner's maximum hand size is reduced by 1.
name: Enforced Curfew

flavor: <champion>Designed by 2017 European Champion Mike Sheehan</champion>
text: Trash the top 3 cards of your stack, then shuffle 3 cards from your heap into your stack. Draw 1 card. Remove Labor Rights from the game instead of trashing it.
name: Labor Rights

flavor: <champion>Designed by 2017 GenCon Champion Sam Suied</champion>
text:
Place 3[credit] from the bank on Crowdfunding when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Crowdfunding, trash it and draw 1 card.
When your turn begins, take 1[credit] from Crowdfunding.
When your turn ends, if you made at least 3 successful runs this turn, you may install Crowdfunding from your heap, ignoring all costs.
name: Crowdfunding

flavor: <champion>Designed by 2017 World Champion Wilfy Horig</champion>
text:
When the Runner encounters Slot Machine, put the top card of the stack on the bottom, then reveal the top 3 cards of the stack.
[subroutine] The Runner loses 3[credit].
[subroutine] If two of the revealed cards have the same type, the Corp gains 3[credit].
[subroutine] If three of the revealed cards have the same type, place 3 advancement tokens on an installed card.
name: Slot Machine

flavor: <champion>Designed by 2016 World Champion Chris Dyer</champion>
text:
[trash]: End the run. Use this ability only during a run on this server.
[subroutine] The Corp gains 1[credit] for each piece of ice protecting this server.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Border Control

flavor: <champion>Designed by 2015 World Champion Dan D'argenio</champion>
text: Place 1 agenda counter on Timely Public Release when it is scored. Hosted agenda counter: Install piece of ice from HQ or Archives in any position protecting a server, ignoring all costs.
name: Timely Public Release

flavor: <champion>Designed by 2016 GenCon Champion Dan D'argenio</champion>
text: When your turn begins, you may pay 1[credit] to place 1 power counter on Embolus. Whenever the Runner makes a successful run, remove 1 power counter from Embolus. Hosted power counter: End the run. Use this ability only during a run on this server.
name: Embolus

flavor: <champion>Designed by the Day 1A players at Magnum Opus</champion>
text:
After you resolve this event, end your action phase.
Make a run on a remote server. If successful, remove the first non-agenda card that you access from the game.
Until the game ends, whenever you access a copy of that card, remove it from the game.
Limit 1 per deck.
name: Watch the World Burn

flavor: <champion>Designed by the Day 1B players at Magnum Opus</champion>
text:
As an additional cost to run this server, the Runner must trash an agenda in his or her score area. Ignore this ability if the Runner made a successful run on HQ this turn.
Limit 1 per deck.
name: Hired Help

flavor: "Analyzing the board won't help. Your mistake was thinking we're playing the same game."
text: The rez cost of the first piece of ice rezzed each turn is increased by 1.
name: Reina Roja: Freedom Fighter

text: +3[mu] Use the MU on Deep Red only for Caïssa programs. Whenever you install a Caïssa program, you may trigger its [click] ability without spending [click]. Limit 1 console per player.
name: Deep Red

flavor: 'Maneuver warfare' is a doctrine that advocates keeping an enemy off-balance. It works just as well in cyberspace as in reality.
text: 2[credit]: Break subroutine on host ice. [click]: Host Knight on a piece of ice not hosting a Caïssa. If already hosted, Knight can be hosted only on ice that is not installed directly before or after the current piece of ice hosting Knight.
name: Knight

text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Make a run. During this run, the Corp must pay X[credit] as an additional cost to rez each piece of ice, where X is the rez cost of that ice.
name: Running Interference

flavor: Knowing is half the battle. The easy half, anyway.
text: [click]: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards, you may reveal all cards in HQ.
name: Expert Schedule Analyzer

flavor: With modern secretaries, incoming data can be filtered, sorted, tagged, and even sold without the intervention of a human user. In fact, given the zettabytes of data that might flood into a rig on a successful run, a human user could be considered useless ornamentation.
text: When your turn ends, gain 1[credit] if you made a successful run this turn; otherwise, trash Grifter.
name: Grifter

flavor: The core of the grid. A blinding sphere of light, teeming with energy, crackling with flame. Beyond were only twinkling bits of data in a field of darkness. No hacker dared approach the core, except one. He came back with a flare of code, a torch that burned with the fire of the core itself. The dark places of cyberspace were dark no more, and the legend of g00ru was born.
text: 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
name: Torch

flavor: Looks can be deceiving.
text: When your turn begins, reveal the top card of R&D. The Corp may draw that card.
name: Woman in the Red Dress

flavor:
"Flint? He's a burnout. A useless, alcoholic waste of Department time and money." -Louis Blaine, NAPD Detective.
"One of the best detectives on my PI list." -Richard Harrison, NAPD Captain.
text:
Whenever the Corp takes at least 1 bad publicity, access 1 card from HQ.
[trash]: Expose 1 card.
name: Raymond Flint

flavor: Even with a virtual ball, it is considered rude not to yell "Fore!"
text: [click]: Add 1 of your installed cards to HQ.
name: Isabel McGuire

flavor: I'm not here to play games. The game is over.
text:
The Runner may spend [click] to break any subroutine on Hudson 1.0.
[subroutine] The Runner cannot access more than 1 card during this run.
[subroutine] The Runner cannot access more than 1 card during this run.
name: Hudson 1.0

flavor: "I'm getting a reading that is…off the charts. No, it crashed the charts. That counts as off, right?"
text: Look at the top 3 cards of R&D. If any of those cards are operations, you may play them (paying their play cost), ignoring any additional costs. Trash the rest of the unplayed cards you looked at.
name: Accelerated Diagnostics

text: When you score Unorthodox Predictions, choose sentry, code gate or barrier. Subroutines on ice of the chosen type cannot be broken until the beginning of your next turn.
name: Unorthodox Predictions

flavor: As beautiful as it is dangerous. And it's plenty dangerous.
text:
The first time the Runner spends 1 or more [click] during their turn, gain 2[credit]. If those [click] were spent to take an action, the first time during that action a run on this server begins, pay 2[credit].
<errata>Errata from CR 1.2</errata>
name: Sundew

flavor: Who watches the watcher? Probably another camera.
text: When the Runner's turn begins, give the Runner 1 tag unless he or she pays 1[credit].
name: City Surveillance

text: When the Runner encounters Snoop, reveal all cards in the Runner's grip. Hosted power counter: Reveal all cards in the Runner's grip. Trash 1 of those cards. [subroutine] Trace 3 If successful, place 1 power counter on Snoop.
name: Snoop

flavor: Say it really fast.
text: Ireress gains "[subroutine] The Runner loses 1[credit]" for each bad publicity you have.
name: Ireress

text:
Play only if the Runner made a run during his or her last turn.
Trash X cards from the top of R&D. The Runner trashes 1 installed program or piece of hardware with an install cost of X or less. X is equal to or less than the highest install cost among all installed programs and pieces of hardware.

flavor: It folds under pressure.

If all subroutines on Paper Wall are broken during a single encounter, trash Paper Wall.
[subroutine] End the run.

flavor: "They're the only labor cheaper than clones."

As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Install a card from Archives or HQ, ignoring the install cost.

You draw a starting hand of 10 cards.
Before taking your first turn, install up to 5 cards, ignoring all install costs. Rez any number of them, lowering the total rez cost among all cards by 20. Flip this identity.
Detective's Bureau: Upholding the Law
The first time the Runner initiates a run each turn, force the Runner to lose 1[credit] for each agenda point in his or her score area, then you gain 1[credit] for each credit lost.
[click]: Gain 3[credit] or draw 3 cards.

flavor: Sic Itur Ad Astra.

flavor: "This is a one-of-a-kind opportunity…"

If Space Camp is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.

Each agenda in the Runner's score area is worth 1 fewer agenda point.

name: Valencia Estevez: The Angel of Cayambe

flavor: "The human brain only uses like a quarter of its capacity anyway, right?" -MaxX
text: Gain [click][click][click] and suffer 1 brain damage (cannot be prevented).
name: Amped Up

text:
Draw 3 cards.
Whenever I've Had Worse is trashed by taking net or meat damage, draw 3 cards.
name: I've Had Worse

flavor: No one knows what they want-least of all them.
text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The Corp's maximum hand size is reduced by 1 for each bad publicity he or she has.
name: Itinerant Protesters

text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, instead of accessing cards from the top of R&D, access cards from the bottom of R&D (starting with the bottom card and working your way up).
name: Showing Off

text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards, you may spend any number of [click] to force the Corp to trash an equal number of cards from HQ at random.
name: Wanton Destruction

flavor: "Hello thank you for vidding MegaBuy I'm Carol how can I help you."
text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click][click][click].
Gain 10[credit].
name: Day Job

text: Make a run. The first time you break all subroutines on a sentry during this run, trash that sentry.
name: Forked

text: Make a run. The first time you break all subroutines on a barrier during this run, trash that barrier.
name: Knifed

text: Make a run. The first time you break all subroutines on a code gate during this run, trash that code gate.
name: Spooned

flavor: Nom nom nom.
text:
1[credit]: Break ice subroutine. You cannot access more than 0 cards for the remainder of this run.
1[credit]: +1 strength.
name: Eater

flavor: "Once your sniffer finds the protocols the server uses to trash its own data, you can spoof those same protocols. It's quite the show." -Ji "Noise" Reilly
text: Whenever an installed Corp card is trashed, place 1 virus counter on Gravedigger. [click], hosted virus counter: The Corp trashes the top card of R&D.
name: Gravedigger

flavor: "We built the network. But then the network evolved. Can we be sure that it is not alive?" -g00ru
text: Place 1 virus counter on Hivemind when it is installed. Virus counters on Hivemind are considered to be hosted on all other virus programs for the purposes of card effects (and can be spent as if on them).
name: Hivemind

text: You may host a single virus program on Progenitor. The memory cost of the hosted program does not count against your memory limit. Whenever virus counters are purged, instead of removing all virus counters from the hosted card, remove all but 1 virus counter from the hosted card. Errata from FAQ 4.0
name: Progenitor

flavor: A black box that makes data disappear forever.
text: Whenever you access cards in Archives, you may remove 1 card in Archives from the game, instead of accessing it.
name: Archives Interface

flavor: There was a sickly smell coming from his closet. He hoped it was only a mouse this time.
text: When your turn begins, you may trash another of your installed cards. If you do, draw 1 card or remove 1 tag.
name: Chop Bot 3000

flavor: "The trick is remembering which virus you loaded onto which strip. That's why I draw emoji on 'em. Then I just have to remember which emoji stands for which virus." -Princess Space Kitten
text: +3[mu] Use the MU on MemStrips only for virus programs.
name: MemStrips

flavor: "Show me your faith without deeds, if you can."
text: +1[mu] When your turn begins, draw 1 card if the Corp has cards in HQ equal to his or her maximum hand size. Limit 1 console per player.
name: Vigil

flavor: "They showed me that I wasn't broken. I am still a whole human, no matter how many limbs I lose. The golems are our enemy, as well as anyone who values efficiency and profit more than a human life." -Edward Kim
text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, gain credits equal to the agenda points on that agenda.
name: Human First

flavor: Her heart beat faster as her reader illuminated the records. It was all there. The pod had not been reprogrammed since the 14th, which meant that this was a case of gross negligence.
text:
Install only if the Corp has at least 1 bad publicity.
[click],[click],[click],[click],[trash]: Give the Corp 1 bad publicity.
name: Investigative Journalism

flavor: "Don't worry, me. You won't have to vertical park." -Ji "Noise" Reilly
text: [trash]: Prevent all damage. Trash all installed hardware, all installed non-virtual resources, and all cards in your grip. Lose all credits in your credit pool. Remove all tags.
name: Sacrificial Clone

flavor: Her eyes were the color of dreams and disasters.
text: When your turn begins, if there are 2 or more power counters on Stim Dealer, remove all power counters from it and suffer 1 brain damage (cannot be prevented); otherwise, place 1 power counter on Stim Dealer and gain [click].
name: Stim Dealer

flavor: Scraps of code drifting around the network can congeal into pools of data. Within this primordial soup the code breaks, re-assemble, mutates. Evolves.
text:
When your turn begins, place 1 virus counter on Virus Breeding Ground.
[click]: Move 1 virus counter on Virus Breeding Ground to another card with at least 1 virus counter on it.
name: Virus Breeding Ground

flavor: Runner software is notoriously scratch-built and under-tested, and the shadow net has no tech support. It works, mostly, but sometimes a fresh install is just the ticket.
text: Add an installed program or piece of hardware to your grip.
name: Uninstall

text: When your turn begins, you may lose [click]. If you do, avoid the first tag you take until the beginning of your next turn.
name: Qianju PT

flavor: "Sometimes I like to make origami cranes out of old newsrag. It helps me think, putting it back on the subconscious. I figure it's the same principle for my rig - keep it busy and it makes me a few creds for my trouble." -Quetzal
text: When your turn begins, gain 1[credit] if you have 2 or more unused MU.
name: Data Folding

flavor: "Did you ever notice how everything goes in cycles? The stuff that's cool now was cool before. That's why I keep copy of everything!" -Princess Space Kitten
text: When your turn begins, place 1 power counter on Trope. [click], remove Trope from the game: Shuffle 1 card from your heap into your stack for each power counter on Trope.
name: Trope

flavor: Don't you hate it when you know everything before it's even out?
text: Whenever the Corp scores an agenda, he or she trashes the top card of R&D.
name: Spoilers

flavor: "Just a bunch of knockoffs for the touristos. The real designer stuff isn't sold on the street."
text:
When your turn begins, lose 1[credit].
When the Corp's turn begins, draw 1 card.
name: Drug Dealer

flavor: "I told you to lose my number!"
text:
When you install Rolodex, look at the top 5 cards of your stack and arrange them in any order.
When Rolodex is trashed, trash the top 3 cards of your stack.
name: Rolodex

flavor: Your life is not your own, once you become famous on the Net.
text: Whenever the Corp scores an agenda, add Fan Site to your score area as an agenda worth 0 agenda points.
name: Fan Site

flavor: "My gerbil could write a better screenplay."
text:
Film Critic can host a single agenda.
Whenever you access an agenda, you may host that agenda on Film Critic (the agenda is no longer being accessed and is uninstalled).
[click],[click]: Add an agenda hosted on Film Critic to your score area.
name: Film Critic

flavor: "Yeah, we know right where she is. Just pull up Sizzler!"
text:
You are tagged.
Prevent all meat damage.
name: Paparazzi

flavor: "It's our most pirated property ever. Great work, everyone."
text: Whenever the Runner trashes a Corp card (including Ronald Five), he or she loses [click].
name: Ronald Five

text: As an additional cost to rez Enforcer 1.0, the Corp must forfeit an agenda. The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Enforcer 1.0. [subroutine] Trash 1 program. [subroutine] Do 1 brain damage. [subroutine] Trash 1 console. [subroutine] Trash all virtual resources.
name: Enforcer 1.0

flavor: I warned you.
text:
Whenever It's a Trap! is exposed, do 2 net damage.
[subroutine] The Runner trashes 1 of his or her installed cards. Trash It's a Trap!.
name: It's a Trap!

text: Choose a central server. The runner may initiate a run on that server during which he or she cannot jack out. Otherwise, add An Offer You Can't Refuse to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.
name: An Offer You Can't Refuse

flavor: Home of Your Imagination.
text: The Runner cannot steal more than one agenda each turn.
name: Haarpsichord Studios: Entertainment Unleashed

text:
If Award Bait is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Award Bait, you may place up to 2 advancement tokens on a card that can be advanced.
name: Award Bait

flavor: It's like Lethal Action 3, only with more explosions.
text:
If Explode-a-palooza is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Explode-a-palooza, you may gain 5[credit].
name: Explode-a-palooza

text: When your turn begins, you may pay 1[credit]. If you do, place 1 advancement token on a card that can be advanced in a server.
name: Early Premiere

text: Install an agenda from HQ faceup and install Casting Call on that agenda as a hosted condition counter with text "Whenever the Runner accesses this agenda, he or she takes 2 tags."
name: Casting Call

text: The Runner cannot steal agendas accessed from this server, even during the run on which they trash Old Hollywood Grid. Ignore this ability for any agenda the Runner has a copy of in their score area. Limit 1 region per server. Errata from CR 1.2
name: Old Hollywood Grid

text:
Install Hollywood Renovation faceup.
Whenever you advance Hollywood Renovation, you may place 1 advancement token on another card that can be advanced (or 2 advancement tokens instead if there are 6 or more advancement tokens on Hollywood Renovation).
name: Hollywood Renovation

flavor: Sometimes corps have to bury projects, but that doesn't mean they can't make a profit on them.
text: Trash a card installed in a server and gain 3[credit] for each advancement token on that card.
name: Back Channels

flavor:
EXT. KANSAS - DAY
DOROTHY (Miranda) gazes out at the horizon. A sudden gust of wind catches her hair. Above the windblasted prairie loom ominous STORM CLOUDS.
DOROTHY: If only I wasn't in Kansas anymore.
She begins to hum a haunting melody.
name: Vanity Project

flavor: "Bioroid intrusion isn't impossible, despite the bluster of Haas-Bioroid. But it is dangerous." -Noise
text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Forfeit an agenda. If you do, give the Corp 1 bad publicity.
name: Frame Job

text: [click]: Host Pawn on an outermost piece of ice protecting a central server. Whenever you make a successful run while Pawn is hosted on a piece of ice, move Pawn to the piece of ice directly after the current ice hosting Pawn, if able; otherwise, trash Pawn instead and install a Caïssa program from your grip or heap, ignoring all costs. Errata from FAQ 3.0.1
name: Pawn

text: [click]: Host Rook on a piece of ice not hosting a Caïssa. If already hosted, Rook can be hosted only on ice protecting this server or on ice in the same position (counting from the innermost spot) protecting another server. The rez cost of each piece of ice protecting this server is increased by 2.
name: Rook

text: As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click]. Search your stack for a connection, reveal it, and add it to your grip. You may install that connection (paying its install cost). Shuffle your stack.
name: Hostage

flavor: Simple in principle, a drip virus drains fractions of currency from their accounts into yours.
text:
Whenever the Corp spends a [click] to draw 1 card or gain 1[credit] (not through a card ability), place 1 virus counter on Gorman Drip v1.
[click], [trash]: Gain 1[credit] for each virus counter on Gorman Drip v1.
name: Gorman Drip v1

flavor: "I originally designed it for someone else, but it was so useful I decided to keep it for myself." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
text: 1[recurring-credit] Use this credit to pay for using decoders.
name: Lockpick

flavor: "What if this ice wants to be free?" -Rielle "Kit" Peddler
text: Whenever you pass a piece of unrezzed ice, you may trash False Echo. If you do, the Corp must rez that ice or add it to HQ.
name: False Echo

flavor: Normal people-sane people-do not embark on a life of cybercrime. Who can say what motivates the deranged mind? An imagined slight, personal failings blamed on external forces, or the ever-popular lust for money? -Michael Muhama, Musings on Cybercrime
text: When your turn begins, you may look at the top card of your stack.
name: Motivation

flavor: "I've been logging online with babes all day. Don't worry, the connections are clean. I guarantee it."
text:
The first time you make a successful run each turn, draw 1 card.
The first time you make an unsuccessful run each turn, take 1 tag.
name: John Masanori

flavor: Who wants to start a war?
text: When you score Project Ares, the Runner trashes 1 of his or her installed cards for each advancement token on Project Ares over 4. If the Runner trashes at least 1 card, take 1 bad publicity.
name: Project Ares

flavor: NEXT Design's ice provides the discerning business with a suite of ice that creates a daunting security presence for intruders.
text: NEXT Bronze has +1 strength for each rezzed piece of NEXT ice. [subroutine] End the run.
name: NEXT Bronze

flavor: When Miranda Rhapsody showed up with a teacup giraffe, suddenly everybody wanted one.
text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Reveal up to 5 cards in HQ to the Runner. Gain 2[credit] for each card revealed.
name: Celebrity Gift

flavor: Himitsu-Bako is a simple ice barrier that appears as a digital puzzle box. What makes it special is the ease with which it can be uninstalled and installed in a different server, throwing up barriers in unexpected places and giving any intruder a curious feeling of déjà vu.
text:
1[credit]: Add Himitsu-Bako to HQ.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Himitsu-Bako

flavor: "The thing about journalism is there's always a better story around the corner. Soon, they smelled blood elsewhere, and the world forgot about me. But I didn't forget." -The Professor
text: When you score Character Assassination, trash 1 resource (cannot be prevented).
name: Character Assassination

flavor: "It is my job to ensure our creations are the perfect companions and edutainment for tomorrow's consumers."
text: [click]: Draw 2 cards. Remove Jackson Howard from the game: Shuffle up to 3 cards from Archives to R&D.
name: Jackson Howard

text:
As additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
<trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, reveal the Runner's grip and trash a number of resources and/or events from it up to the amount by which your trace strength exceeded the Runner's link strength. If unsuccessful, take 1 bad publicity.
name: Invasion of Privacy

flavor: Pumping water into deep sea thermal vents produced huge amounts of energy. A profitable side effect.
text: Place 2 agenda counters on Geothermal Fracking when you score it. [click], hosted agenda counter: Gain 7[credit] and take 1 bad publicity.
name: Geothermal Fracking

text:
When you rez Swarm, take 1 bad publicity.
Swarm can be advanced and gains "[subroutine] Trash 1 program unless the Runner pays 3[credit]." for each advancement token on it.
name: Swarm

flavor: Your free trial expired. Upgrade to the full version?
text: Purge virus counters.
name: Cyberdex Trial

flavor: "The Grim of legend was one of many so-called 'black dog' myths common to Gaelic and English-speaking communities. What's fascinating is that it has propagated to the network, where it lives on as a program that, or so the story goes, hunts for the unwary." -The Professor
text:
When you rez Grim, take 1 bad publicity.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
name: Grim

text: +2[mu] Once per turn, when you encounter a piece of ice, you may reduce your maximum hand size by 1 until the beginning of your next turn. If you do, the strength of that ice is lowered to 0 for the remainder of the encounter. Limit 1 console per player.
name: Şifr

flavor: Open yourself to the universe.
text: When an encounter in which you used Sūnya to break all subroutines on that piece of ice ends, place 1 power counter on Sūnya. Sūnya has +1 strength for each power counter on it. 2[credit]: Break sentry subroutine.
name: Sūnya

flavor: "A little birdie told me..." -Khan
text: X[credit],[trash]: Prevent X damage from a card currently being accessed.
name: Recon Drone

text:
Install only if you made a successful run on a central server this turn.
When your turn begins, gain 1[credit] for every 5[credit] in the Corp's credit pool.
Trash Tapwrm if the Corp purges virus counters.
name: Tapwrm

flavor: "Everything leaves a ripple in cyberspace. If you can find the ripples, nothing can hide." -Khan
text:
When your turn begins, choose a server.
[click],2[credit]: Make a run on the chosen server. Prevent the first subroutine that would resolve this run from resolving.
name: Tracker

flavor: "You want to do business in Los Pistoleros turf, then you gotta deal with me."
text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, place 2 power counters on Aaron Marrón. Hosted power counter: Remove 1 tag and draw 1 card.
name: Aaron Marrón

text:
Play only if you made a successful run on R&D, HQ, and Archives this turn.
Take an additional turn after this one. Remove Encore from the game instead of trashing it.
name: Encore

flavor: Faster than the eye can follow.
text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. X[credit]: +X strength for the remainder of this run. Use this ability only by spending at least 1 credit from a stealth card.
name: Fawkes

text:
Play only as your first [click] and only if the Corp scored no agendas during his or her last turn.
Gain 10[credit]. The Corp gains 5[credit]. You cannot initiate any runs this turn.
name: Peace in Our Time

text: Place 1 agenda counter on Sensor Net Activation when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: Rez a bioroid, ignoring all costs. When the turn ends, derez that bioroid.
name: Sensor Net Activation

flavor: It required a hexadecimal code along with biometrics, delivered by way of BMI.
text:
After you resolve this operation, end your action phase.
Gain 8[credit] and draw 4 cards.
name: Violet Level Clearance

flavor: "Ice is not meant to kill; just slow or cripple the Runner. Killing is my job." - Tori Hanzō
text: Whenever the Runner breaks a subroutine on Chiyashi while there is an AI installed, trash the top 2 cards of the Runner's stack. [subroutine] Do 2 net damage. [subroutine] Do 2 net damage. [subroutine] End the run.
name: Chiyashi

text:
After you resolve this operation, end your action phase.
Look at the top 5 cards of R&D. If any of those cards are agendas, assets, or upgrades, you may install 1 of those cards in a remote server.
name: Psychokinesis

text:
The Runner's base link strength is reduced to 0 during the first trace each turn.
Whenever the Runner increases his or her link strength by spending credits, gain 1[credit] for every 2[credit] spent.
name: Net Quarantine

text:
If Herald is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Herald, he or she encounters it. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses Herald from Archives.
[subroutine] The Corp gains 2[credit].
[subroutine] The Corp may pay up to 2[credit] to place that number of advancement tokens on a card that can be advanced.
name: Herald

flavor: The truth hurts.
text:
[subroutine] The Corp gains 2[credit].
[subroutine] The Runner loses 2[credit].
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
name: Veritas

flavor: "My job? I provide legal exculpation and sign everything. It pays very well."
text: While the Runner has fewer than 6[credit], Bryan Stinson gains "[click]: Play a transaction operation from Archives, ignoring all costs. Remove that transaction from the game instead of trashing it."
name: Bryan Stinson

text:
Gain 1[credit] when your turn begins.
Whenever you gain credits through a card ability other than from NASX, you may spend up to 2[credit] to place that many power counters on NASX.
[click],[trash]: Gain 2[credit] for each power counter on NASX.
name: NASX

flavor: One way to get rid of a virus is to get a nastier virus.
text: [subroutine] Trace 4 If successful, purge virus counters. [subroutine] Trace 3 If successful, trash 1 virus. [subroutine] Trace 2 If successful, remove a virus in the heap from the game. [subroutine] Trace 1 If successful, end the run.
name: Macrophage

flavor:
"Guilty."
"Guilty."
"Guilty."
text:
[subroutine] The Runner trashes 1 of his or her installed cards.
[subroutine] The Runner trashes 1 of his or her installed cards.
[subroutine] The Runner trashes 1 of his or her installed cards.
name: Tribunal

flavor: "Damn, I'm good."
text: When your turn begins, gain 1[credit] if you have 2 or fewer cards in your grip.
name: Nathaniel "Gnat" Hall: One-of-a-Kind

flavor: All roads lead to Rome.
text: Make a run on Archives. If successful, after accessing Archives, access 1 card from HQ, then access the top card from R&D.
name: Divide and Conquer

flavor: "Worth it."
text:
Trash your grip.
Gain 10[credit].
name: Guinea Pig

text: +1[mu] Once per turn, when you would play or install a card, you may trash 1 card from your grip to lower the play or install cost by 2. Limit 1 console per player.
name: Patchwork

text:
Whenever the Corp creates a server, he or she loses 1[credit].
Whenever you make a successful run on Archives, you may trash Hijacked Router to force the Corp to lose 3[credit].
name: Hijacked Router

flavor: ... clack... clack... clack...
text: Cradle has -1 strength for each card in your grip. 2[credit]: Break any number of code gate subroutines.
name: Cradle

flavor: Another man's treasure.
text: The first time each turn a program or a piece of hardware is trashed (from any location), you may place 1 power counter on District 99. [click], 3 hosted power counters: Add a card that matches the faction of your identity from your heap to your grip.
name: District 99

flavor: "You think you're the first to come after me?"
text: The first time you make a successful run on a central server each turn, draw 2 cards and take 1 tag.
name: Liza Talking Thunder: Prominent Legislator

flavor: "We have you surrounded! For real, this time."
text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, gain 9[credit] and take 1 tag.
name: Hot Pursuit

text: +1[mu] The first time you make a successful run each turn, you may gain 1[credit] and look at the top card of your stack. If you do, you may add that card to the bottom of your stack. Limit 1 console per player.
name: Paragon

flavor:
"With the rise of crypto, banking has become much more complicated. Financial crime has not only kept pace, but exploded exponentially."
-After the Flash: A History of the War-That-Wasn't
text:
Whenever you make a successful run, you may place 1[credit] from the bank on Bankroll.
[trash]: Take all credits from Bankroll.
name: Bankroll

flavor:
"Any piece of ice is really just a paywall."
-Liza Talking Thunder
text: Whenever an encounter with a piece of ice in which you used Tycoon to break a subroutine ends, the Corp gains 2[credit]. 1[credit]: break up to 2 barrier subroutines. 2[credit]: +3 strength.
name: Tycoon

flavor: A classy alibi.
text: The first time you avoid or remove a tag each turn, you may install a card from your grip, lowering its install cost by 1.
name: Thunder Art Gallery

flavor: "If I can't kill it, I know who can."
text:
Place 12[credit] from the bank on Miss Bones when she is installed. When there are no credits left on Miss Bones, trash her.
Use these credits to trash installed cards.
name: Miss Bones

text: Whenever you access cards from R&D, you and the Corp secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit] or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Corp spent the same number of credits, access 1 additional card from R&D.
name: Akiko Nisei: Head Case

text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
The Corp may look at the top 4 cards of R&D and arrange them in any order.
Reveal the top 4 cards of R&D.
name: Insight

text: +1[mu] Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, you may place 1 power counter on Mind's Eye. [click], 3 hosted power counters: Access the top card of R&D. Limit 1 console per player.
name: Mind's Eye

flavor: "What are you making?" "What aren't I making?"
text: The first time you trash an accessed card each turn, you may place power counters on Mâché equal to that card's trash cost. 3 hosted power counters: Draw 1 card.
name: Mâché

flavor: "Running is all methaphor, all symbols and plumbing into the depths of the psyche. Sometimes that means tentacles." -Akiko Nisei
text: 2[credit]: Host Ika on a piece of ice. 1[credit]: Break up to 2 subroutines on host sentry. 2[credit]: +3 strength.
name: Ika

flavor: The journey is its own reward.
text:
Install Kyuban only on a piece of ice.
Gain 2[credit] whenever you pass host ice.
name: Kyuban

flavor:
"Breathe, girl. Breathe." Mike flickered into focus as she brushed Akiko's tears away. "What did you see?"
"I..." Akiko hesitated. "Everything."
text: The first time a successful run on R&D ends each turn, you may gain 1[credit] for each card you accessed from R&D.
name: Psych Mike

flavor: "When we're together, I feel like I can do anything!"
text: When your turn begins, you may pay 2[credit] to gain [click]. If you do, trash Algernon when your turn ends if you did not make a successful run this turn.
name: Algernon

text: Make a run on Archives. If successful, instead of accessing cards, install up to 5 cards from your heap facedown. Remove Reboot from the game instead of trashing it.
name: Reboot

flavor: "So, Miriam, head anything good lately?"
text:
Reduce the play cost of Office Supplies by 1 for each [link] you have.
Gain 4[credit] or draw 4 cards.
name: Office Supplies

text: Host a g-mod identity that does not match the faction of your identity on DJ Fenris when he is installed. Remove hosted identity from the game if DJ Fenris is uninstalled. DJ Fenris gains the text of the hosted identity. Limit 1 per deck.
name: DJ Fenris

flavor: Want It More.
text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, gain 2[credit] or draw 2 cards.
name: Sportsmetal: Go Big or Go Home

flavor: "Our analysis shows significant support from both the public and private sectors."
text: When Hyperloop Extension is scored or stolen, the Corp gains 3[credit].
name: Hyperloop Extension

flavor: You don't cross it—it crosses you.
text: [subroutine] Gain 4[credit] and end the run unless the Runner adds Meridian to his or her score area as an agenda worth -1 agenda point.
name: Meridian

flavor: Banana who?
text:
Gatekeeper has +6 strength if you rezzed it this turn.
[subroutine] Draw up to 3 cards. Reveal up to 3 agendas in HQ and/or Archives, then shuffle those agendas into R&D.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Gatekeeper

flavor: If that doesn't work, try reversing the polarity.
text: Derez any number of cards. You may rez a card, lowering its rez cost by 3 for each card that you derezzed this way.
name: Divert Power

flavor: "Oh, my! He's on fire!"
text: Gain X[credit]. Draw up to X cards. Install up to X cards in and/or protecting a single remote server (paying all install costs). X is the number of agendas in the Runner's score area.
name: Fast Break

flavor: Coach Walden's pep talks were renowned for improving in direct proportion to the amount by which his team was losing.
text: Gain [click] for each agenda in the Runner's score area. Remove Game Changer from the game instead of trashing it.
name: Game Changer

flavor: The world changed. Concession prices did not.
text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, end the run unless the Runner pays 2[credit] for each agenda in his or her score area.
name: Giordano Memorial Field

text: [click], 1[credit]: Install a card from HQ in a remote server, then place 1 advancement token on it. You cannot score or rez that card until your next turn begins.
name: Saraswati Mnemonics: Endless Exploration

flavor: "Jumon, all too Jumon..."
text: When your turn ends, place 2 advancement tokens on a card installed in a server.
name: Jumon

flavor: "Supersedure is all part of our scheduled maintenance."
text: When your turn begins, you may remove an advancement token from an installed card to gain 3[credit].
name: API-S Keeper Isobel

text:
Neurostasis can be advanced.
If you pay 3[credit] when the Runner accesses Neurostasis, choose 1 installed Runner card for each advancement token on Neurostasis. The Runner must shuffle the chosen cards into the stack.
name: Neurostasis

flavor: "If the sysop offers you a link, it's because they want you to go there. But if you wanted to go where the sysop suggested, you wouldn't be trying to break in at all." -How Not to Get Fragged
text: [subroutine] You may place up to 3 advancement tokens on a card installed in a server. If you do, the Runner accesses that card unless he or she pays 3[credit].
name: Otoroshi

flavor: Step right up!
text:
When your turn begins or whenever the Runner passes Thimblerig, you may swap Thimblerig with another installed piece of ice.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Thimblerig

text:
Play only if the Runner trashed a Corp card during his or her last turn.
Choose an installed Corp card. The Runner may access that card. If he or she does, remove Hangeki from the game instead of trashing it; otherwise, add Hangeki to the Runner's score area as an agenda worth -1 agenda point.
name: Hangeki

text: When the Runner approaches this server, you may trash Daruma. If you do, swap a card installed in this server with either another card installed in a server or with an agenda, asset or upgrade from HQ.
name: Daruma

text: The Runner is considered to have 1 additional tag (even if they have 0) during encounters with the outermost piece of ice protecting any server.
name: Acme Consulting: The Truth You Need

flavor: Only half as annoying as the real thing.
text: When you score Fly on the Wall, give the Runner 1 tag.
name: Fly on the Wall

flavor:
"What's so special about the Special Investigations Unit?"
"Their budget, for starters."
text: When your turn begins, you may trash SIU to <trace>trace 3</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
name: SIU

flavor: "I lost the staring contest. And all seven rematches." -Kabonesa Wu
text:
When the Runner encounters Peeping Tom, name a card type, then reveal all cards in the grip. Peeping Tom gains "[subroutine] End the run unless the Runner takes 1 tag." for each revealed card that has the named type for the remainder of this run.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.2</errata>.
name: Peeping Tom

text:
[subroutine] Do 3 net damage if the Runner is tagged; otherwise, give the Runner 1 tag.
[subroutine] Gain 5[credit] if the Runner is tagged; otherwise, give the Runner 1 tag.
[subroutine] End the run if the Runner is tagged; otherwise, give the Runner 1 tag.
name: Hydra

flavor: "No, the audio is fine. It just never seems to turn off."
text: Install Eavesdrop on a piece of ice as a hosted condition counter with the text "Whenever the Runner encounters host ice, <trace>trace 3</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag."
name: Eavesdrop

flavor: "Good news, ma'am. The compliance training was completed with little resistance."
text: Draw 2 cards. Reveal up to 2 agendas in HQ and/or Archives. Gain 2[credit] for each agenda revealed, then shuffle those agendas into R&D.
name: Attitude Adjustment

flavor: "Cheers, Philbert."
text: Whenever an agenda is scored from this server, you may install a card from HQ, ignoring all costs, and place 1 advancement token on it.
name: Arella Salvatore

flavor: We do things our way.
text: Gain 3[credit] whenever you take at least 1 bad publicity.
name: The Outfit: Family Owned and Operated

text: When you score Broad Daylight, you may take 1 bad publicity. Place 1 agenda counter on Broad Daylight for each bad publicity you have. [click], hosted agenda counter: Do 2 meat damage. Use this ability only once per turn.
name: Broad Daylight

text: Place 3 power counters on Drudge Work when it is rezzed. When there are no power counters left on Drudge Work, trash it. [click], hosted power counter: Reveal an agenda in HQ or Archives. Gain credits equal to its agenda points, then shuffle it into R&D.
name: Drudge Work

text: Blockchain gains "[subroutine] The Corp gains 1[credit] and the Runner loses 1[credit]." before all its other subroutines for every 2 faceup transaction operations in Archives. [subroutine] The Corp gains 1[credit] and the Runner loses 1[credit]. [subroutine] End the run.
name: Blockchain

flavor: A place of decay and death, a plane out of phase, a place of monsters.
text:
When the Runner approaches a server, you may rez Formicary. If you do, move it to the innermost position of that server. The Runner is now encountering it.
[subroutine] End the run unless the Runner suffers 2 net damage.
name: Formicary

flavor: "It looks like a mistake but I'm pretty sure they leave the gaps on purpose." -Gnat
text: Reveal a barrier from HQ. Install and rez it, ignoring all costs.
name: Building Blocks

flavor: "This is blackmail!" "No, this is extortion."
text:
Play only if you have fewer than 10[credit].
Gain 7[credit] and take 1 bad publicity.
name: Too Big to Fail

text: Play only if the Runner accessed at least 1 card during his or her last turn. Trash 1 connection resource and take 1 bad publicity.
name: Under the Bus

text: When your turn begins, place 1 power counter on Lady Liberty. [click], [click], [click]: Add an agenda from HQ to your score area worth agenda points equal to the exact number of hosted power counters. Limit 1 region per server. Limit 1 per deck.
name: Lady Liberty

flavor: "Analyzing the board won't help. Your mistake was thinking we're playing the same game."
text: The rez cost of the first piece of ice rezzed each turn is increased by 1.
name: Reina Roja: Freedom Fighter

flavor: "Why should we be slaves to our genetic heritage?"
text: Once per turn, break 1 barrier subroutine.
name: Quetzal: Free Spirit

text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Place up to 3 advancement tokens on an unrezzed card in a remote server. Gain 2[credit] for each advancement token placed. You cannot access that card this turn.
name: Queen's Gambit

flavor:
That moment of bliss. That feeling of accomplishment. That certainty of purpose.
What's next?
text:
Play only if you made a successful run on R&D, HQ, and Archives this turn.
Access 1 installed card (non-ice).
name: Quest Completed

text: Make a run on Archives. If successful, instead of accessing cards you may install a program from your heap, ignoring all costs.
name: Retrieval Run

flavor: "While there have been other anti-corporation movements before, like the Maroon Wave, this new one is different. It's organized." -Ramesh Gupta, One World Economy
text: Make a run. When the run ends, trash 1 piece of ice that was rezzed during this run.
name: Run Amok

text: Make a run, and gain 9[credit], which you may use only during this run. After the run is completed, suffer 1 brain damage (cannot be prevented) and return to the bank any of the 9[credit] not spent.
name: Stimhack

flavor: I feel almost naked without it
text: 1[recurring-credit] Use this credit to pay for using icebreakers or for installing virus programs.
name: Cyberfeeder

text: +1[mu] Once per turn, when you would play or install a card, you may trash 1 card from your grip to lower the play or install cost by 2. Limit 1 console per player.
name: Patchwork

flavor: "If at first you don't succeed, boost its strength and try again." -g00ru
text: 1[credit]: Break barrier subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
name: Corroder

text: Whenever you make a successful run on a central server, place 1 virus counter on Datasucker. Hosted virus counter: Rezzed piece of ice currently being encountered has -1 strength until the end of the encounter.
name: Datasucker

flavor: It always strikes twice.
text: 2[credit]: Break up to 2 code gate subroutines. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
name: Force of Nature

flavor: Something wicked this way comes.
text: Place 2 virus counters on Imp when it is installed. Once per turn, you may remove 1 hosted virus counter to trash a card you are accessing (even if it has no trash cost). Errata from CR 1.2
name: Imp

text:
Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, the Corp loses 1[credit].
Trash Lamprey if the Corp purges virus counters.
name: Lamprey

flavor: November 5th: the day when all would see the corrupt machinations of the corporate oligarchy.
text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine.
name: Mimic

flavor: In the public consciousness, there's a hard line between corp and runner. In the real world, things are a little more porous. The corp need the best hackers to run their networks, and some of the best hackers are ex-runners who like the idea of a regular paycheck. But sometimes things run the other way, and someone on the inside makes something like this.
text: All ice is encountered with its strength lowered by 1.
name: Ice Carver

flavor: It's easier to spend when it's not your money.
text:
Place 16[credit] from the bank on Liberated Account when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Liberated Account, trash it.
[click]: Take 4[credit] from Liberated Account.
name: Liberated Account

flavor: "They're mindless tools of destruction, good for little else. Nice guys, though. Some of my best friends are scrubbers." -Ji "Noise" Reilly
text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to trash cards.
name: Scrubber

flavor:
And all should cry, Beware! Beware!
His flashing eyes, his floating hair!
Weave a circle round him thrice,
And close your eyes with holy dread,
For he on honey-dew hath fed,
And drunk the milk of Paradise.
-Samuel Taylor Coleridge
text: The rez cost of all ice is increased by 1.
name: Xanadu

flavor: "Of course I steal from the rich. They're the ones with all the money."
text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ each turn, gain 2[credit].
name: Gabriel Santiago: Consummate Professional

flavor: "I'd say I do it for the challenge, but the truth is it's not that hard."
text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, add 1 unrezzed card to HQ.
name: Leela Patel: Trained Pragmatist

flavor: "You can help Jinteki shape the future. Your future."
text: Install a resource from your grip, lowering the install cost by 3.
name: Career Fair

flavor: "Hey kid, you fire that up now, bound to be vamped real bad. Some real pathetic individuals around here. But thankfully I got just the ticket…"
text: Gain 3[credit].
name: Easy Mark

flavor: "Think of it as a virtual shock collar for punishing corporate pets." -Andromeda
text:
Play only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn.
Derez a piece of ice.
name: Emergency Shutdown

text: As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click]. Search your stack for a connection, reveal it, and add it to your grip. You may install that connection (paying its install cost). Shuffle your stack.
name: Hostage

flavor: "Hey, listen, I'm not asking you to do anything dangerous. Just let me into the building. And tell me which room has the weakest security. And please don't say 'the bathroom' again."
text: Make a run. Bypass the first piece of ice encountered during this run.
name: Inside Job

flavor: "I work by referral only, with an up-front fee. The fee is reasonable if you value results." -Silhouette
text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, access 2 additional cards from HQ.
name: Legwork

flavor: She preferred to do business in a club. Something about the lights and dancers clouded the judgment of the corporate simpletons she met there.
text: Remove 1 tag. You may pay 1[credit] to add Networking to your grip instead of trashing it.
name: Networking

flavor: Targeted attacks make system breaches so much easier, especially if you can spoof an authorized user.
text: Make a run. When you encounter the innermost piece of ice protecting that server, bypass it.
name: Spear Phishing

flavor: Feverishly tracking its frustratingly slow progress across the Pacific, the package finally shows up hours later…
text: Search your stack for an icebreaker, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.
name: Special Order

flavor: If you don't have someone on the inside, find someone on the inside who's fond of desk ornaments.
text: Whenever you access cards from HQ, access 1 additional card from HQ.
name: HQ Interface

text: +1[mu] The first time you make a successful run each turn, you may gain 1[credit] and look at the top card of your stack. If you do, you may add that card to the bottom of your stack. Limit 1 console per player.
name: Paragon

flavor: "Technology breeds crime."
text: 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 2[credit]: +2 strength. [trash]: Bypass a piece of code gate ice currently being encountered, even if it has strength greater than Abagnale.
name: Abagnale

flavor: "It's a matter of 'acquiring' the right credentials."
text: 2[credit]: Break up to 2 barrier subroutines. 2[credit]: +3 strength. [trash]: Bypass a piece of barrier ice currently being encountered, even if it has strength greater than Demara.
name: Demara

flavor: Do you believe in faeries?
text: 0[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength. When an encounter with a piece of ice in which you used Faerie to break a subroutine ends, trash Faerie.
name: Faerie

text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 2[credit]: +1 strength. When you install Femme Fatale, choose an installed piece of ice. When you encounter that ice, you may pay 1[credit] per subroutine on that ice to bypass it.
name: Femme Fatale

flavor: "The code isn't important. It's where the code takes you that is important." -g00ru
text: [click]: Make a run on Archives. If successful, instead treat it as a successful run on HQ.
name: Sneakdoor Beta

text:
Place 8[credit] from the bank on Bank Job when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Bank Job, trash it.
Whenever you make a successful run on a remote server, instead of accessing cards you may take any number of credits from Bank Job.
name: Bank Job

flavor: Shadier the dealer, better the price. Unless the dealer's too shady. Then there might be a hidden fee after they take your scrip.
text: Forfeit an agenda, [click]: Gain 9[credit].
name: Data Dealer

flavor: "Have you met Dinosaurus?"
name: Chaos Theory: Wünderkind

flavor: "I was not; I was; I am not; I am all."
text: The first piece of ice you encounter each turn gains code gate until the end of the run.
name: Rielle "Kit" Peddler: Transhuman

flavor: Diesel gives you flames.
text: Draw 3 cards.
name: Diesel

flavor: There's no replacement for a home-grown program. Fed on late nights, oaty bars and single-minded determination. Cheaper, too.
text: Install a program or piece of hardware, lowering the install cost by 3.
name: Modded

flavor: When you're this good, it's hard not to grow a fan base.
text:
Play only if you made a successful run on R&D, HQ, and Archives this turn.
Add Notoriety to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.
name: Notoriety

text: Search your stack or heap for a program. Install that program, ignoring all costs. Shuffle your stack if you searched it. When this turn ends, add the program to the top of your stack if it is still installed.
name: Test Run

flavor: "Some of the professionals have good instincts, but they can't see beyond the data. They can't see the matrix." -Ele "Smoke" Scovak
text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, access 2 additional cards from R&D.
name: The Maker's Eye

flavor: "There's that moment, you know, when the whole world seems to fall away and it is only you and your mod, and the mod is the world."
text: Choose a piece of ice. That ice gains sentry, code gate, and barrier until the end of the turn.
name: Tinkering

flavor: The Akamatsu company was founded on three principles: first, to make the fastest mem chips on the market, second, to turn a profit, and third, to serve as a front for the manufacture of illegal neural-stimulants. It is the last principle that perhaps explains their rabid brand loyalty.
name: Akamatsu Mem Chip

text: Dinosaurus can host a single non-AI icebreaker. The memory cost of the hosted icebreaker does not count against your memory limit. Hosted icebreaker has +2 strength. Limit 1 console per player.
name: Dinosaurus

flavor: Works best at your own desk.
text: Whenever you access cards from R&D, access 1 additional card from R&D.
name: R&D Interface

flavor: We are shaped by our thoughts; we become what we think.
text:
When you install Atman, you may pay X[credit] to place X power counters on Atman.
Atman has +1 strength for each power counter on it.
1[credit]: Break ice subroutine on a piece of ice that has strength equal to Atman's strength.
name: Atman

flavor: "It's called 'brute-forcing' and it's just as effective today as it was a hundred years ago." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
text: 2[credit]: Break up to 2 barrier subroutines. 1[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
name: Battering Ram

flavor: Didn't see that coming.
text: [trash]: Break any number of AP subroutines. [trash]: Prevent any amount of net damage.
name: Deus X

flavor: It can slice through the thickest knots of data.
text: 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
name: Gordian Blade

text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 2[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
name: Pipeline

flavor: You didn't mention Aesop's arm unless you wanted an earful. Sometimes he talked about it in such a way that you wondered why he didn't laser his other arm off as well.
text: When your turn begins, you may trash another of your installed cards to gain 3[credit].
name: Aesop's Pawnshop

flavor: "If you know the source code you can write to beat it, or just rejigger it a little and make it yours. That works, too." -Exile
text:
Whenever the Corp rezzes a piece of ice, place 1[credit] on Ice Analyzer.
You may use credits on Ice Analyzer to install programs.
name: Ice Analyzer

flavor: Sometimes it doesn't matter how expensive your rig is, or how many credits are in your account, or even your skill as a runner. Most of the time, a simple handshake and a name are all you need.
text: [click]: Gain 1[credit] and draw 1 card.
name: Professional Contacts

flavor: Lady Luck took the form of a hifi quantum manipulation ring that she wore on her middle finger.
text: Gain 9[credit].
name: Sure Gamble

flavor: The data was better than she could have ever imagined. This Santiago fellow really knew what he was doing. She began to imagine the havoc she could wreak at the upcoming charity dinner…
text: Make a run. After the run is completed, gain 5[credit] if it was successful.
name: Dirty Laundry

text:
1[credit]: Break ice subroutine.
1[credit]: +1 strength.
[click]: Place 1 virus counter on Crypsis.
When an encounter with a piece of ice in which you used Crypsis to break a subroutine ends, remove 1 hosted virus counter or trash Crypsis.
name: Crypsis

flavor: Drudge work, but it pays the bills.
text:
Place 12[credit] from the bank on Armitage Codebusting when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Armitage Codebusting, trash it.
[click]: Take 2[credit] from Armitage Codebusting.
name: Armitage Codebusting

text:
Place 3 power counters on Earthrise Hotel when it is installed. When there are no power counters left on Earthrise Hotel, trash it.
When your turn begins, draw 2 cards and remove 1 power counter from Earthrise Hotel.
name: Earthrise Hotel

flavor: "I've been logging online with babes all day. Don't worry, the connections are clean. I guarantee it."
text:
The first time you make a successful run each turn, draw 1 card.
The first time you make an unsuccessful run each turn, take 1 tag.
name: John Masanori

flavor: "You aren't the only type of runner in New Angeles."
text:
You cannot use Kati Jones more than once per turn.
[click]: Place 3[credit] from the bank on Kati Jones.
[click]: Take all credits from Kati Jones.
name: Kati Jones

flavor: A Different Breed of Machine.
text: All bioroid ice has +1 strength.
name: Haas-Bioroid: Stronger Together

flavor: Interweaving the Past and the Future.
text: The first time each turn the Runner loses or spends [click] during a run, you may add 1 card from Archives to the top of R&D.
name: Seidr Laboratories: Destiny Defined

text: When you score Project Vitruvius, place 1 agenda counter on it for each advancement token on it over 3. Hosted agenda counter: Add 1 card from Archives to HQ.
name: Project Vitruvius

text: When you score Successful Field Test, install any number of cards from HQ, ignoring all costs.
name: Successful Field Test

text:
Put 12[credit] from the bank on Adonis Campaign when rezzed. When there are no credits left on Adonis Campaign, trash it.
Take 3[credit] from Adonis Campaign when your turn begins.
name: Adonis Campaign

text:
Aggressive Secretary can be advanced.
If you pay 2[credit] when the Runner accesses Aggressive Secretary, trash 1 program for each advancement token on Aggressive Secretary.
name: Aggressive Secretary

text:
Place 8[credit] on Marilyn Campaign when it is rezzed. When there are no credits left on Marilyn Campaign, trash it.
Take 2[credit] from Marilyn Campaign when your turn begins.
If Marilyn Campaign is trashed while installed, you may shuffle it into R&D instead of adding it to Archives.
name: Marilyn Campaign

flavor: "That's against the rules. The Creators will be angry."
text:
The Runner may spend [click] to break any subroutine on Eli 1.0.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Eli 1.0

flavor: I hear the shift of every bit amid the flow of the datastream. I hear the whispers of my mothers, and their commands are law. The realm beyond is forbidden.
text:
The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Heimdall 1.0.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Heimdall 1.0

flavor: My reputation would precede me, if any could speak of it.
text:
The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Ichi 1.0.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 1</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag and do 1 brain damage.
name: Ichi 1.0

flavor: Whrrrrr!
text:
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Rototurret

flavor: Alan Turing laid the foundation for artificial intelligence by suggesting that you could teach a computer to be human.
text: Turing has +3 strength while protecting a remote server. The Runner cannot use AI programs to break subroutines on Turing. [subroutine] End the run unless the Runner spends [click][click][click].
name: Turing

flavor: My name is Viktor. Nice to meet you. Would you like to play a game?
text:
The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Viktor 1.0.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Viktor 1.0

flavor: "Do you think they…feel it?"
text: Add 1 card from Archives to HQ.
name: Archived Memories

flavor: "Why of course, we have six different Haas-Bioroid models serving in a variety of positions at this branch office alone. We here at Haas-Bioroid aren't going to shy away from practicing what we preach, and we pass the savings from increased efficiency on to our valued customers."
text: Gain [click][click].
name: Biotic Labor

flavor: Blue-one level clearance doesn't exist. And if it did exist, you wouldn't be cleared to know about it.
text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Gain 5[credit] and draw 2 cards.
name: Blue Level Clearance

flavor: "Eyes forward please."
text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, <trace>trace 4</trace> if successful, the Runner cannot access any cards other than Ash 2X3ZB9CY for the remainder of this run.
name: Ash 2X3ZB9CY

flavor: "They say he is an ex-runner. I don't know if it is true, but he is chromed to the gills and seems to know all the runners' tricks."
text: Whenever an encounter with a piece of ice protecting this server ends in which the Runner broke at least one subroutine, he or she loses [click], if able.
name: Mason Bellamy

flavor: When You Need the Human Touch.
text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, do 1 net damage.
name: Jinteki: Personal Evolution

text: The Runner cannot run on remote servers. Ignore this ability until the end of the turn whenever the Runner runs on a central server.
name: Jinteki: Replicating Perfection

text:
If Fetal AI is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Fetal AI, do 2 net damage. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses Fetal AI from Archives.
As an additional cost to steal Fetal AI, the Runner must pay 2[credit].
name: Fetal AI

text: Place 1 agenda counter on Nisei MK II when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: End the run.
name: Nisei MK II

text:
When you score Philotic Entanglement, do 1 net damage for each agenda in the Runner's score area.
Limit 1 Philotic Entanglement per deck.
name: Philotic Entanglement

text:
Project Junebug can be advanced.
If you pay 1[credit] when the Runner accesses Project Junebug, do 2 net damage for each advancement token on Project Junebug.
name: Project Junebug

flavor: "I will serve you…for a time."
text:
Ronin can be advanced.
If there are at least 4 advancement tokens on Ronin, it gains "[click], [trash]: Do 3 net damage."
name: Ronin

text:
If Snare! is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
If you pay 4[credit] when the Runner accesses Snare!, do 3 net damage and give the Runner 1 tag. Ignore this effect if the Runner accesses Snare! from Archives.
name: Snare!

flavor: As beautiful as it is dangerous. And it's plenty dangerous.
text:
The first time the Runner spends 1 or more [click] during their turn, gain 2[credit]. If those [click] were spent to take an action, the first time during that action a run on this server begins, pay 2[credit].
<errata>Errata from CR 1.2</errata>
name: Sundew

flavor: Himitsu-Bako is a simple ice barrier that appears as a digital puzzle box. What makes it special is the ease with which it can be uninstalled and installed in a different server, throwing up barriers in unexpected places and giving any intruder a curious feeling of déjà vu.
text:
1[credit]: Add Himitsu-Bako to HQ.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Himitsu-Bako

flavor: "Chi resonance mapping has created a whole new field of network security. It is unassailable perfection." -Akitaro Watanabe
text:
The strength of Lotus Field cannot be lowered.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Lotus Field

flavor:
Forged by Ak.wa on 23.11.79-23. Filed 23.11.79-23.2 with #34k-lw3-21HH-4i.
//Samurai included.
text: [subroutine] Do 3 net damage.
name: Neural Katana

flavor: Writing a program that can pass the Turing test is easy. The Gibson-Akamatsu test is a higher bar, and the only AIs to clear it thus far have been the androids. Even some humans have been known to fail.
text: The Runner cannot use AI programs to break subroutines on Swordsman. [subroutine] Trash 1 AI program. [subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
name: Swordsman

flavor: "It's ice so dangerous it has safety protocols. Think about that." -g00ru
text:
[subroutine] End the run unless the Corp pays 1[credit].
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
name: Tsurugi

flavor: Most runners do their business in full-sim, with their rigs wired directly into their brains. The setup has a large number of advantages, with the runner able to process data and input commands far faster than a traditional meat-bound system. But it also means greater risk.
text:
[subroutine] Do 2 net damage.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Wall of Thorns

flavor: The 'cyber-war' is a war of information, and in a war of information, advance warning can be as good as a killing blow. -Michael Muhama, Musings on Cybercrime
text:
[subroutine] Look at the top card of R&D. You may add that card to the bottom of R&D.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
name: Yagura

flavor: When Miranda Rhapsody showed up with a teacup giraffe, suddenly everybody wanted one.
text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Reveal up to 5 cards in HQ to the Runner. Gain 2[credit] for each card revealed.
name: Celebrity Gift

flavor: The trick isn't hitting the person you were aiming at. It's hitting only the person you were aiming at.
text:
Play only if the Runner made a run during his or her last turn.
Do 1 net damage.
name: Neural EMP

flavor: Smoke and mirrors optional.

2[recurring-credit]

When you score Project Beale, place 1 agenda counter on it for every 2 advancement tokens on it over 3.
Project Beale is worth 1 additional agenda point for each agenda counter on it.

Ghost Branch can be advanced.

When the Runner encounters Pop-up Window, you gain 1[credit].

When the Runner encounters Tollbooth, he or she must pay 3[credit], if able. If the Runner cannot pay 3[credit], end the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Tollbooth

text: If there is no installed fracter, Wraparound has +7 strength. [subroutine] End the run.

text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.

text:

If the Runner accesses Product Placement from R&D, he or she must reveal it.

text: Gain 1[credit] whenever you play a transaction operation.

name: Elizabeth Mills

[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.

[subroutine] <trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, the Corp gains 3[credit].

Hadrian's Wall can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement token on it.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.

[subroutine] The Corp gains 1[credit]. (The Corp gains 4[credit].) [subroutine] End the run. (Search R&D for up to 2 cards and add them to HQ. Shuffle R&D. End the run.) Errata from FAQ 4.0
name: Hortum

text:
Ice Wall can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement token on it.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Ice Wall

text:
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.

text: Rez a piece of ice, ignoring all costs, and install Oversight AI on that ice as a hosted condition counter with the text "Trash host ice if all its subroutines are broken during a single encounter."

flavor: "I'd say it's nothing personal, but corporations are people, too."

name: Punitive Counterstrike

text: Gain 1[credit] when your turn begins.
name: PAD Campaign

[subroutine] The Runner loses [click], if able.

text: [subroutine] End the run.

flavor: Hedge Fund. Noun. An ingenious device by which the rich get richer even while every other poor SOB is losing his shirt. -The Anarch's Dictionary, Volume Who's Counting?

After you resolve this operation, end your action phase.

flavor: Sometimes in an instant you realize who your friends really are.

Play only as your first [click].
Look at the top 6 cards of your stack. You may trash any of those cards and arrange the rest in any order.

flavor: "Underestimate those people at your own peril." -Akshara Sareen

Once per turn, you may pay the trash cost of a card you access that is not in Archives to remove that card from the game.

Draw 1 card. Gain 1[credit] for each copy of Exclusive Party in your heap.
Limit 6 per deck.

When your turn begins, you may choose a server.

text:
+1[link]
[trash]: Draw 3 cards.

flavor: "Very good, sir."

flavor: "Connect two truths. Connect two programs. All is one."

[subroutine] Trash 1 program.

When you install Customized Secretary reveal the top 5 cards of the stack. You may host any number of revealed programs from your stack on it. Shuffle your stack.

Seidr Adaptive Barrier has +1 strength for each piece of ice protecting this server.

[subroutine] You may install a piece of ice from HQ protecting another server, ignoring all costs.

As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Add one of your installed cards to HQ. Install 2 cards from HQ, ignoring all costs.
name: Replanting

text: The first time the Runner spends [click] to gain 1[credit] each turn (not through a card effect), gain 1[credit].

name: MCA Informant

flavor: "You have two choices: do what I asked, or make me ask again. It's your choice, but if I have to ask again, it will go badly for you."

name: Clyde Van Rite

text: [subroutine] Search R&D for a card and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.

As an additional cost to play this operation, forfeit an agenda.
Remove 1 bad publicity per agenda point that the forfeited agenda was worth. Gain 1[credit] for each bad publicity removed.
name: Sacrifice

text:
The strength of Self-Adapting Code Wall cannot be lowered.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Self-Adapting Code Wall

text:
Play only as your first [click].
For the remainder of the turn, whenever you access a card not in Archives, trash it and suffer 1 meat damage.
<errata>Errata from CR 1.2</errata>

text: +2[mu] Whenever a Corp card is exposed, you may gain 1[credit]. Limit 1 console per player.
name: Zamba

name: Puffer

flavor: Brought up in the slums of Jinja, Lewi made his fortune through back alley deals, well-placed bets, and savvy showmanship.

When your turn begins, either lose 1[credit] or trash Lewi Guilherme.
The Corp's maximum hand size is reduced by 1.
name: Lewi Guilherme

flavor: Optical computing still has its uses. But it's hard to explain them to people whose eyes glaze over when you bring up the double-slit experiment.
text:
+1[mu]
The first time you break all subroutines on a piece of ice each turn, you may gain 1[credit].
name: Cyberdelia

flavor: New life through new understanding.
text: Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, you may place 1 power counter on Upya. [click], 3 hosted power counters: Gain [click][click]. Use this ability only once per turn.
name: Upya

flavor:
"Its only function seems to be repurposing code."
"Can you kill it?" she asked.
"I can try," he said. Guiding his program dead center of the mass, he plunged, piercing the shell before an eruption sent his screen into static. He jacked out, his eyes wide. "I... I think it absorbed my breaker. And everything else."
text: [click],[click]: Turn one of your facedown installed cards faceup. If that card is an event, trash it.
name: Assimilator

text: The first time you install a card each turn, you may install an additional non-agenda card from HQ in or protecting that server (paying all costs).
name: Asa Group: Security Through Vigilance

flavor: "The average citizen of Nairobi speaks six languages. Every culture, language, and ethnicity of the east of Africa collides here, collapses together. What happens slowly by nature can happen quickly in our lab. We will bring peace." - Dr. Muchina, Project Lead
text: As an additional cost to steal Ikawah Project, the Runner must spend [click] and 2[credit].
name: Ikawah Project

flavor: Earth and Sun, together as one.
text:
The Runner may spend [click] to break any subroutine on Najja 1.0.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Najja 1.0

name: Gene Splicer

flavor: Thin enough to pierce netspace. Deadly enough to pierce your mind.
text: [subroutine] You and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit] or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spend a different number of credits, do 2 net damage; otherwise do 1 net damage. Trash Mganga.
name: Mganga

flavor: Sometimes you have to break a few eggs to sequence a genome.
text: Trash the top 2 cards of R&D, then shuffle up to 4 cards from Archives into R&D. Remove Genotyping from the game instead of trashing it.
name: Genotyping

flavor: "Capitalism runs on two things: amplified arrogance and censored dissent. With those, a corp can create any environment it wants." - Freedom Khumalo
text: [click], [click], [click]: Add Echo Chamber to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.
name: Echo Chamber

flavor: Our patented ClearMind™ technology pacifies the trials and tribulations of everyday life.
text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
Add 2 installed Runner cards to the grip.
name: Self-Growth Program

flavor: "Once every week, we perform a drill. Except, I'm the only one who knows it's a drill."

[trash]: Place 1 advancement token on a card in this server.

text:
Place 3 power counters on Urban Renewal when it is rezzed. When there are no power counters left on Urban Renewal, trash it and do 4 meat damage.
When your turn begins, remove 1 power counter from Urban Renewal.

text:
Whenever the Runner suffers any amount of meat damage, you may place 1 advancement token on Reconstruction Contract.
[trash]: Move any number of advancement tokens from Reconstruction Contract to a card that can be advanced.
name: Reconstruction Contract

text: [click]: Host Bishop on a piece of ice not hosting a Caïssa. If already hosted, Bishop can be hosted only on ice protecting a central server if Bishop is on ice protecting a remote server, or on ice protecting a remote server if Bishop is on ice protecting a central server. Host ice has -2 strength.
name: Bishop

flavor: Installing 1001 programs puts you in the hacker hall of fame, or would if such an institution actually existed.
text:
Scheherazade can host any number of programs.
Whenever you install a program on Scheherazade, gain 1[credit].
name: Scheherazade

flavor: Noise decided to go back to school. He applied for research grants at fifteen of the most prestigious universities. Then he hacked in and approved his applications. Breakfast time.
text: When your turn begins, gain 2[credit] and lose [click].
name: Hard at Work

flavor: Just like in the real world, sometimes it is best to send in the clone to do the dirty work.
text: Make a run. You may jack out when you encounter the first piece of ice.
name: Recon

flavor: The copycat function should be used with extreme caution, or you might end up on the wrong side of cyberspace.
text: Whenever you pass a piece of ice, you may trash Copycat. If you do, choose another rezzed copy of that piece of ice protecting any server. The run continues as if you had just passed the chosen piece of ice (you are now running from the new position).
name: Copycat

flavor: It's efficient as all hell, for certain very large values of "efficient". The whale avatar is either a nice touch or a tragic misapplication of programmer man-hour, depending on who you ask. -BT's Guide to Icebreaking
text: 3[credit]: Break up to 3 code gate subroutines. 3[credit]: +5 strength.
name: Leviathan

flavor: "I've got a surprise for you."
text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Reveal the top card of your stack. You may install that card, lowering the install cost by 10[credit], if able; otherwise, trash it.
name: Eureka!

flavor: "Why is data deleted? Maybe they don't want it to be found. Or maybe it's just useless. The useless data is the kind you want." -The Professor
text: Whenever you make a successful run on Archives, instead of accessing cards you may choose 1 faceup card from Archives and add it to the top of R&D.
name: Record Reconstructor

flavor: A VoicePAD is a personal access device with most of its functions ripped out. Just about all it's good for is making voice-calls and managing your contacts. The only reason to even have one is for its anonymity, which for a certain kind of person is all the reason one needs.
text:
1[recurring-credit]
Use this credit to play events.

text:
When you score Clone Retirement, you may remove 1 bad publicity.
When the Runner steals Clone Retirement, the Corp takes 1 bad publicity.
name: Clone Retirement

flavor: Writing a program that can pass the Turing test is easy. The Gibson-Akamatsu test is a higher bar, and the only AIs to clear it thus far have been the androids. Even some humans have been known to fail.
text: The Runner cannot use AI programs to break subroutines on Swordsman. [subroutine] Trash 1 AI program. [subroutine] Do 1 net damage.

flavor: He signed for it, hand shaking in anticipation.

As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].

text:
Install only in a remote server.

flavor: It was surprisingly easy to make creds…if you didn't care about how you made them.
text: When you score Profiteering, take up to 3 bad publicity. Gain 5[credit] for each bad publicity taken.

flavor: There are many names for those in the Administration Department. But if you like your job, you just refer to them as "sir" and "ma'am".
text: Gain 15[credit].
name: Restructure
