Place 16[credit] from the bank on Liberated Account when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Liberated Account, trash it.
[click]: Take 4[credit] from Liberated Account.
name: Liberated Account

flavor: T-minus 13 seconds. Leela had to work fast. She jacked in the mesa wire and activated the screen. 7 seconds. The internal SLD was still booting. 4 seconds. The interface flickered to life with an orange glow. 2 seconds. With a tap of a finger she was in.
text: Expose up to 2 cards.
name: Satellite Uplink

flavor: CyberSolutions' e3 line of implants trade strictly in muscle memory and automatic responses, freeing the brain to focus entirely on cerebral tasks.
text:
Whenever you break a subroutine on a piece of ice, you may pay 1[credit] to break 1 subroutine on that ice.

text:
1[recurring-credit]
Use this credit during traces.
Gain 1[credit] whenever the Corp rezzes a piece of ice.

Play only if you made a successful run on R&D, HQ, and Archives this turn.
Add Notoriety to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.
name: Notoriety

flavor: "If your snowball gets big enough, you can make it into a snowman!" -Chaos Theory
text: 1[credit]: Break barrier subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength. Whenever you use Snowball to break a subroutine, it has +1 strength for the remainder of the run.
name: Snowball

Play only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn.
Prevent all damage until the beginning of your next turn unless the Corp takes 2 bad publicity.
name: Leverage

text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength.

flavor: "Once you have achieved perfection, what's next?" -The Professor

text: When your turn begins, lose [click]. Ignore any additional costs on each double event you play.

[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] End the run.

If Shock! is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.

"Let me get this straight. Your target market is 15-19 year old g-modded immigrants with one parent, a discretionary income over 2k a month, B+ or higher grades, an outgoing personality, and have a friend who owns a g-monkey?"
"Yes. Is that a problem?"
"No, not at all. I just don't get why your list is so short."
text: Gain 1[credit] for each card in the Runner's grip.
name: Sweeps Week

flavor: This ice disguises itself as a series of electronic transactions, tying up the runner's funds in a thousand or so non-existent purchases and refunds. The banks' system of holds and checks means that while not a single credit ever leaves their servers the runner has no available funds. RSVP also has the unfortunate side effect of being entirely legal…strictly speaking.

name: RSVP

flavor:
[subroutine] End the game.

[subroutine] End the run.

name: Amani Senai

text: When your turn ends, you may choose a piece of ice with no advancement tokens on it. If you do, place 1 advancement token on that piece of ice for each agenda point on all installed faceup agendas.
name: SSO Industries: Fueling Innovation

text:
Install City Works Project faceup.
When the Runner accesses City Works Project while it is installed, do 2 meat damage and 1 additional meat damage for each advancement token on it.
name: City Works Project

flavor: Might given form.
text:
When the Runner encounters Oduduwa, place 1 advancement token on it. You may place X advancement tokens on another piece of ice. X is the number of advancement tokens on Oduduwa.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Oduduwa

flavor: She gets the job done. And then some.
text: When your turn begins, you may trash Rashida Jaheem to gain 3[credit] and draw 3 cards.
name: Rashida Jaheem

flavor:
"He with nothing to lose has strength beyond imagining."
-The Saffron Sutra
text: Trash your grip. Make a run. Prevent all damage during this run.
name: The Noble Path

flavor:
"They cloak themselves in our shared heritage, in the wisdom of our religions, but make no mistake: they are terrorists and criminals."
-Inspector Lakhani, Cybercrimes Division
text: When your turn begins, gain [click] if you have no cards in your grip.
name: Emptied Mind

text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards, the Corp separates all cards in HQ into 2 facedown piles. Access all of the cards in one of the piles; you cannot access any cards in the other pile this run.
name: Information Sifting

text:
Make a run.
When your turn begins, if Out of the Ashes is in your heap, you may remove it from the game to make a run.
Limit 6 per deck.
name: Out of the Ashes

flavor: "Let go your material attachments and realize that we are all immaterial."
text: [click],[click],[click],[click],[click], forfeit an agenda: Add Liberated Chela to your score area as an agenda worth 2 agenda points. The Corp may forfeit an agenda to prevent this. If he or she does, remove Liberated Chela from the game.
name: Liberated Chela

flavor: It is rumored that g00ru himself studied at the temple, applying its teachings to cyberspace. Many runners have followed in his path, but none have reached its end.
text: [click]: Place 1 power counter on Temple of the Liberated Mind. Hosted power counter: Gain [click]. Use this ability only on your turn and only once per turn.
name: Temple of the Liberated Mind

flavor: "Who were you when you realized everything you knew was a lie?"
text:
Switch your identity with another identity from the same faction. Remove Rebirth from the game instead of trashing it.
Limit 1 per deck.
name: Rebirth

flavor: "This body that we inhabit is fleeting. We, all of us, can live forever."
text:
Prevent all net and meat damage.
Whenever Guru Davinder prevents at least 1 net or meat damage, trash him unless you pay 4[credit].
name: Guru Davinder

text: Whenever a run on HQ or R&D ends, place 1 power counter on The Turning Wheel if you stole no agendas during the run. 2 hosted power counters: For the remainder of this run, access 1 additional card from HQ or R&D.
name: The Turning Wheel

flavor:
has anyone heard from StatiX lately?
-post on Members Only newsgroup
text: When the Runner encounters Brainstorm, it gains "[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage." for each card in the Runner's grip for the remainder of this run.
name: Brainstorm

text: The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Ravana 1.0. [subroutine] Resolve a subroutine on another piece of rezzed bioroid ice. [subroutine] Resolve a subroutine on another piece of rezzed bioroid ice.
name: Ravana 1.0

text: The first time there is a successful run on HQ each turn, you and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, you choose which cards the Runner accesses from HQ for the remainder of this run.
name: Dedicated Neural Net

flavor: "Feel your consciousness expand and touch his. Now destroy it."
text:
[subroutine] Each player gains 2[credit].
[subroutine] You and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, do 1 net damage for each card in the Runner's grip.
name: Chetana

text: Whenever the Runner makes a successful run, you may place 1 advancement token on a card that can be advanced.
name: Puppet Master

flavor: "It's amazing how small we can write the fine print these days."
text: [subroutine]<trace>Trace 5</trace> If successful, the Runner reveals his or her grip. Trash each of those cards with a play or install cost equal to or less than the amount by which your trace strength exceeded his or her link strength.
name: Waiver

text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
Swap an agenda in your score area with an agenda in the Runner's score area.
name: Exchange of Information

flavor:
Bureaucracy. Noun. A shell-game played by the rich with prosperity as the ball. The trick is that there is no ball.
-The Anarch's Dictionary, Volume Who's Counting?
text: [subroutine] All ice has +3 strength for the remainder of this run.
name: Red Tape

text: This card costs 0 influence if you have 6 or more non-alliance [weyland-consortium] cards in your deck. As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click]. Search R&D for an operation and play it (paying all costs). Shuffle R&D.
name: Consulting Visit

flavor: A brand new invention.
text: [subroutine] End the run.
name: Vanilla

flavor: It takes power to create power.
text: When you score Helium-3 Deposit, place up to 2 power counters on a card with at least 1 power counter on it.
name: Helium-3 Deposit

flavor: Recycling the energy entering the system via a run is both responsible and economical.
text:
[subroutine] The Corp gains 1[credit] or draws 1 card.
[subroutine] The Corp gains 1[credit] or draws 1 card.
[subroutine] The Corp gains 1[credit] or draws 1 card.
name: Errand Boy

text: [click]: Place 1 power counter on IT Department. Hosted power counter: Choose a rezzed piece of ice. That ice has +1 strength until the end of the turn for each power counter (including the one spent) on IT Department.
name: IT Department

flavor: The forge must never run cold.
text:
The Runner may spend [click] to break any subroutine on Markus 1.0.
[subroutine] The Runner trashes 1 of his or her installed cards.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Markus 1.0

flavor: Achieve the Impossible.
text: The trash cost of each card is increased by 1 for each facedown card in Archives.
name: Industrial Genomics: Growing Solutions

flavor: A masterpiece of cloning and hardware technology, Jinteki created homo vacuo operae, commonly called "turtlebacks", to operate for long periods of time within a vacuum.
text: Gain 1[credit] whenever you create a server.
name: Turtlebacks

text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Rez 1 piece of ice for each tag the Runner has, ignoring all costs.
name: Shoot the Moon

flavor: You gotta pay the troll toll to get in.
text: When the Runner encounters Troll, <trace>trace 2</trace> if successful, the Runner must lose [click] or end the run.
name: Troll

flavor: Virgo promised love, but offered only jealousy.
text: [subroutine] <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag. If your trace strength is 5 or greater, give the Runner 1 tag.
name: Virgo

text:
As an additional cost to steal an agenda, the Runner must pay 2[credit] for each advancement token on that agenda.
Limit 1 per deck.
name: Utopia Fragment

flavor:
There drew he forth the brand Excalibur,
And o'er him, drawing it, the winter moon,
Brightening the skirts of a long cloud, ran forth
And sparkled keen with frost against the hilt:
For all the haft twinkled with diamonds sparks,
Myriads of topaz-lights, and jacinth work
Of subtlest jewellery. -Lord Tennyson
text: [subroutine] The Runner cannot make another run this turn.
name: Excalibur

text:
Install only in a remote server.
[trash]: Trash all cards installed in or protecting this server and <trace>trace X</trace> if successful, do 3 net damage. X is the number of cards trashed. Use this ability only during a run on this server.
name: Self-destruct

flavor: "What terrors hatch in her dispossessed mind, waiting for their moment to be born? My money's on a double-helix rainbow with the head of a panda." -fakespeare
text: When your turn begins, place 1 virus counter on Incubator. [click], [trash]: Move all virus counters from Incubator to another installed virus program.
name: Incubator

flavor: Digs in deeper than its Alabama counterpart.
text:
Whenever the Corp loses at least 1[credit], gain 1[credit].
Trash Ixodidae if the Corp purges virus counters.
name: Ixodidae

text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, instead of accessing cards, you may search your stack for a program and install it, lowering the install cost by 3 for each piece of ice protecting R&D, and then take 1 tag. Shuffle your stack.
name: Code Siphon

flavor: "All programs are connected. The data that runs through one runs through all." -Rielle "Kit" Peddler
text: Draw 1 card whenever the Corp rezzes a piece of ice.
name: Collective Consciousness

flavor: δὶς ἐς τὸν αὐτὸν ποταμὸν οὐκ ἂν ἐμβαίης
text: Sage has +1 strength for each unused MU. 2[credit]: Break code gate or barrier subroutine.
name: Sage

flavor: "Sometimes it's helpful to remember that you're not the only one who loves money." -Gabriel Santiago
text: Make a run. During this run, the Corp must pay X[credit] as an additional cost to rez the first unrezzed piece of ice approached.
name: Bribery

flavor: The datastream slipped away, and it felt like being born for a second time, if only you could remember the first. A rush of air fills the lungs to bursting, and you gasp it out, coughing and choking as the dim lights of the room shine with the brilliance of a thousand suns.
text: Gain 1[credit] whenever you jack out.
name: Au Revoir

text:
Place 3 power counters on Earthrise Hotel when it is installed. When there are no power counters left on Earthrise Hotel, trash it.
When your turn begins, draw 2 cards and remove 1 power counter from Earthrise Hotel.
name: Earthrise Hotel

text: The first time you rez a piece of ice each turn, you may search R&D for another copy of that ice, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
name: The Foundry: Refining the Process

text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. As an additional cost to make the first run not made through a card ability on his or her turn, the Runner must spend [click].
name: Enhanced Login Protocol

flavor: "There are many advantages to having facilities on the moon. Less traffic, for example." -Director Hass
text: If the Runner loses or spends a click during a run on this server, he or she loses all credits in his or her credit pool. Limit 1 region per server.
name: Heinlein Grid

flavor: "Binary computing is obsolete. I use a base-4 structure for this system; it's modeled on our DNA. Well, my DNA, anyway." -Doctor Endo, Jinteki researcher
text: All code gate ice have +1 strength. When you score Encrypted Portals, gain 1[credit] for each rezzed code gate.
name: Encrypted Portals

flavor: Her eyes were the color of a vidscreen, tuned to a dead channel.
text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. The Runner's identity text box is blank.
name: Cerebral Static

text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. Name a card. Gain 10[credit] whenever the Runner plays or installs a copy of that card.
name: Targeted Marketing

flavor: Throw enough data at a runner and it ceases to have any meaning at all.
text:
When the Runner encounters Information Overload, <trace>trace 1</trace> if the trace is successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
Information Overload gains "[subroutine] The Runner trashes 1 of his or her installed cards." for each tag the Runner has.
name: Information Overload

text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. Gain 1[credit] whenever the Runner makes a successful run.
name: Paywall Implementation

flavor: Nothing is impenetrable. The key is to make breaking into it more costly than what it's worth.
text:
1[credit]: Move any number of credits from your credit pool to Sealed Vault.
[click] or [trash]: Move any number of credits from Sealed Vault to your credit pool.
name: Sealed Vault

text:
Ignore the install cost of the first piece of ice you install each turn.
Limit 1 per deck.
name: Eden Fragment

flavor: "I don't care how good your console is, or how tricked out your rig is. The lag time on a run on the moon from earthside can be a killer." -Leela Patel
text: This operation is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. All ice have +1 strength.
name: Lag Time

text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, you may trash Will-o'-the-Wisp. If you do, choose an icebreaker that was used to break at least 1 subroutine during this run. The Runner adds that icebreaker to the bottom of his or her stack.
name: Will-o'-the-Wisp

flavor: Sometimes a single stone is enough.
text: Place 3 power counters on D4v1d when it is installed. Hosted power counter: Break ice subroutine on a piece of ice that has a strength of 5 or greater.
name: D4v1d

text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The first piece of ice encountered each turn has -2 strength for the remainder of the run.
name: Scrubbed

flavor: In this business, you had to anticipate. If you weren't three steps ahead, you were three steps behind.
text:
Play only as your first [click].
When this turn ends, gain 2[credit] for each successful run you made during it.
name: Three Steps Ahead

flavor: What goes up must always go down.
text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The Corp cannot install more than 1 piece of ice each turn.
name: Unscheduled Maintenance

flavor: "People keep saying that 'Cash is king' in the business, like it's untraceable in the days of DNA sniffers and microtracers. Digital credits can be just as anonymous, and they're just as easy to counterfeit." -Silhouette
text: Place 3 virus counters on Cache when it is installed. Hosted virus counter: Gain 1[credit].
name: Cache

flavor: Fifteen seconds of fame.
text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. 1[recurring-credit] Use this credit during a run.
name: Net Celebrity

flavor: Originally not very popular, the regulator was overlooked by those who used energy sinks to protect their rig. But it quickly found an audience once Smoke casted a run on a Blue Sun server, using it to keep her rig online while repeatedly diverting energy spikes in excess of 50,000 volts.
text: 3[credit] or [trash]: Prevent an installed piece of hardware from being trashed.
name: LLDS Energy Regulator

flavor: In the spaces between the data, do trapped souls from the past persist?
text:
Place 3[credit] on Ghost Runner when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Ghost Runner, trash it.
You can use the credits on Ghost Runner during a run.
name: Ghost Runner

flavor: <champion>Designed by 2012 World Champion Jeremy Zwirn</champion>
text:
Architect cannot be trashed while installed.
[subroutine] The Corp looks at the top 5 cards of R&D and may install 1 of those cards, ignoring all install costs.
[subroutine] The Corp may install a card from Archives or HQ (paying all costs).
name: Architect

flavor: "Servers fully-armed and operational."
text: Gain 1[credit] for each rezzed piece of ice.
name: Peak Efficiency

text: Place 2 power counters on Labyrinthine Servers when you score it. Hosted power counter: Prevent the Runner from jacking out. The Runner cannot jack out for the remainder of this run.
name: Labyrinthine Servers

flavor: The way past is to go a different way.
text: Ashigaru gains "[subroutine] End the run." for each card in HQ.
name: Ashigaru

text: Hosted power counter: Do 1 net damage. Use this ability only during a run. [subroutine] Do 1 net damage. [subroutine] You and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, place 1 power counter on Mamba.
name: Mamba

flavor: Making a name for yourself has its perks. But it also makes you a target.
text:
Reversed Accounts can be advanced.
[click], [trash]: The Runner loses 4[credit] for each advancement token on Reversed Accounts.
name: Reversed Accounts

flavor: "It's a small one-time fee, apparently. Only I've paid it seventeen times."
text:
[subroutine] If the Runner is not tagged, they lose 1[credit]. If the Runner is tagged, they lose all credits in his or her credit pool and the Corp trashes Universal Connectivity Fee.
<errata>Errata from CR 1.2</errata>
name: Universal Connectivity Fee

flavor: Unlimited Energy. Reasonable Prices.
text: When your turn begins, you may add 1 rezzed card to HQ and gain credits equal to its rez cost.
name: Blue Sun: Powering the Future

text: Changeling can be advanced. While Changeling has an odd number of advancement tokens on it, it gains sentry and loses barrier. [subroutine] End the run.
name: Changeling

flavor: If the clones were nervous about living in a repurposed fuel tank, they never mentioned it.
text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Trash any number of cards from HQ. Gain 2[credit] for each card trashed.
name: Reuse

text:
When your turn begins, you may add 1 card from Archives to the bottom of R&D.
Limit 1 per deck.
name: Hades Fragment

text:
[click], [click]: Place 1 power counter on Docklands Crackdown.
The install cost of the first card the Runner installs each turn is increased by 1 for each power counter on Docklands Crackdown.
name: Docklands Crackdown

flavor: "Knowledge comes in many different shapes and sizes." -Quetzal
text: Reveal the top 4 cards of your stack and trash all programs revealed. Gain 1[credit] for each program trashed, and add the rest of the revealed cards to your grip.
name: Inject

flavor: The earliest instances of data folding were inspired by the traditional art of origami. Just as a crease pattern is the blueprint of a paper crane, there is a sequence to data that must be considered in order to achieve the greatest result.
text: Your maximum hand size is increased by 1 for each copy of Origami installed.
name: Origami

flavor: "You should have known better than to scratch it…" -Quetzal
text: Whenever the Corp purges virus counters, he or she loses 2[credit], if able.
name: Fester

flavor: It practically runs itself, unless you're in a pinch.
text:
The first time you install a program from your grip during your turn, gain [click].
Trash Autoscripter if you make an unsuccessful run.
name: Autoscripter

flavor: Small. Compact. Easy to slip by monitoring programs and it can do some damage.
text: 1[credit]: Break any number of sentry subroutines. Use this ability only by spending a credit from a stealth card. 1[credit]: +7 strength. Use this ability only by spending a credit from a stealth card.
name: Switchblade

text:
As an additional cost to play this event, trash an installed piece of hardware.
Gain credits equal to half the install cost of the trashed hardware (rounded down) and search your stack for a piece of hardware, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.
name: Trade-In

flavor: "There is no better tool for charting the empty spaces of the net." -Nasir Meidan
text: +1[mu] Draw 1 card whenever the Corp creates a server. Limit 1 console per player.
name: Astrolabe

flavor: "Low gravity sports are wildly popular, so match-fixing has proven wildly profitable." -Leela Patel
text: Place X power counters on Angel Arena when it is installed. When there are no power counters left on Angel Arena, trash it. Hosted power counter: Reveal the top card of your stack. You may add that card to the bottom of your stack.
name: Angel Arena

flavor: As the sun sank towards the horizon, the glittering lights of the expo remained dark. But the shanty city bloomed to life.
text:
Play only as your first [click].
The first time you access an agenda this turn, gain 7[credit].
name: Power to the People

flavor: Cowabunga, dude!
text: 2[credit]: Swap a piece of barrier ice currently being encountered with a piece of ice directly before or after it. The run continues from this new position. You are still encountering that ice.
name: Surfer

flavor: "First, you get a horde of zombies. Then you do whatever you want, 'cuz you have a horde of zombies." -Ji "Noise" Reilly
text: [trash]: The Corp cannot rez the outermost piece of ice during a run on any server this turn.
name: DDoS

text: The first time you make a successful run on a central server each turn, you may force the Corp to draw 1 card.
name: Laramy Fisk: Savvy Investor

flavor: "The secret to investing is networking." -Laramy Fisk
text:
Play only as your first [click].
Each player draws 3 cards.
name: Fisk Investment Seminar

text:
[click]: Host up to 3 cards from your grip facedown on Bookmark (you may look at these cards at any time).
[click] or [trash]: Add all cards on Bookmark to your grip.
name: Bookmark

flavor: "Our life is made by the death of others." -Leonardo Da Vinci
text:
Whenever you make a successful run, place 1 power counter on DaVinci.
[trash]: Install a card from your grip with an install cost equal to or less than the number of power counters on DaVinci, ignoring the install cost.
name: DaVinci

flavor: Almost a zettabyte of data flows each minute through one of the many net pavilions scattered around the expo.
text:
As an additional cost to spend [click] to trash a resource (not through a card ability), the Corp must pay 2[credit].
<errata>Errata from FAQ 3.0.1</errata>
name: Wireless Net Pavilion

flavor: The Cybernetics Court has seven floors of attractions. The plasteel used to construct it was even more expensive than the thousands of cybernetic implants displayed inside.
text: Your maximum hand size is increased by 4.
name: Cybernetics Court

flavor: The SanSan Outlaws have a close relationship with Haas-Bioroid's sports engineering division, SHIFT.
text: Whenever you score an agenda, you may install a card from Archives or HQ, ignoring the install cost.
name: Team Sponsorship

text: For the first net damage the Runner suffers each turn, you may look at the Runner's grip and select the card that is trashed.
name: Chronos Protocol: Selective Mind-mapping

flavor: The more people submit their DNA and family history to the program, the more accurate it becomes.
text: Whenever the Runner jacks out, do 1 net damage.
name: Ancestral Imager

flavor: The Genetics Pavilion was designed by renowned architect Meru Mati II. It was built without the aid of bioroids, instead relying on human and clone labor.
text: The Runner cannot draw more than 2 cards during his or her turn.
name: Genetics Pavilion

flavor: There are over 20,000 brands represented in Franchise City, all of them owned by fewer than 100 corps.
text:
If the Runner accesses an agenda from R&D, he or she must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses an agenda, add Franchise City to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.2</errata>
name: Franchise City

text:
If the Runner accesses Product Placement from R&D, he or she must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Product Placement, the Corp gains 2[credit]. Ignore this effect if Product Placement is accessed from Archives.
name: Product Placement

flavor: The holosculpture depicts the three inhabited worlds. The square can hold almost 1% of their total population.
text:
Worlds Plaza can host up to 3 assets.
[click]: Install an asset from HQ on Worlds Plaza and rez it, lowering its rez cost by 2, if able.
name: Worlds Plaza

text:
Place 3 power counters on Public Support when it is rezzed. When there are no power counters left on Public Support, add it to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.
When your turn begins, remove 1 power counter from Public Support.
name: Public Support

flavor: "Hello, and welcome to the Universe of Tomorrow! You could live for five-hundred years and not see all of the attractions I can tell you about."
text: Tour Guide gains "[subroutine] End the run." for each rezzed asset you have.
name: Tour Guide

flavor: The expo was built in the East California desert: a temporary city constructed for the advancement of humanity.
text: When your turn begins, gain 1[credit] if there is a rezzed asset installed in this server. Limit 1 region per server.
name: Expo Grid

text: When you score The Future is Now, search R&D for a card and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
name: The Future is Now

text:
[click],[click],[click]: Place 1 agenda counter on Domestic Sleepers.
Domestic Sleepers is worth 1 agenda point while it has at least 1 agenda counter on it.
name: Domestic Sleepers

flavor: The networking capabilities of the NEXT suite of ice are unparalleled.
text: NEXT Silver gains "[subroutine] End the run." for each rezzed piece of NEXT ice.
name: NEXT Silver

flavor: "Chi resonance mapping has created a whole new field of network security. It is unassailable perfection." -Akitaro Watanabe
text:
The strength of Lotus Field cannot be lowered.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Lotus Field

text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, trash a rezzed piece of ice.
Reveal cards from the top of R&D until you reveal a piece of ice. Install and rez that ice in the same position as the ice that was trashed, ignoring all costs. Shuffle R&D.
name: Mutate

flavor: Only the News You Need.
text: The first time you create a server each turn, draw 1 card.
name: Near-Earth Hub: Broadcast Center

flavor: Works better than a PAD hooked up to a tinfoil umbrella and coffee can.
text:
3[recurring-credit]
Use these credits during traces.
name: Primary Transmission Dish

flavor: Halfway upstalk, Midway is a destination unto itself with its microgravity hotels and fine dining options.
text: The Runner must pay 1[credit] as an additional cost each time he or she uses an icebreaker to break at least 1 subroutine during a run on this server. Limit 1 region per server.
name: Midway Station Grid

flavor: They said it couldn't be built. That it was a fantasy. That Jack Weyland was a fool, and he had bought the fools in Washington too. But year after year the buckyweave grew, and 'they' stopped talking.
text:
3[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to advance, install, and rez cards.
name: The Root

flavor: Taurus promised strength, but gave only rage.
text: [subroutine] <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, trash 1 piece of hardware. If your trace strength is 5 or greater, trash 1 piece of hardware.
name: Taurus

flavor: On the first day She breathed data into the void, and it hung suspended like jewelled stars. On the second day She spoke order into the data, and it flowed from rivulets into streams and from streams into mighty rivers. On the third day She gave independence to the order, and it ebbed and flowed according to its own accord. -The Cant of Helios
text:
Mother Goddess gains the subtypes of all other rezzed ice.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Mother Goddess

flavor: He who bears the shield of honor.
text: When the Runner encounters Galahad, you may reveal up to 2 grail ice from HQ. For the remainder of this run, Galahad gains the subroutines of the revealed ice in the order of your choice. [subroutine] End the run.
name: Galahad

flavor: Known as malware 0-394-41525-6 to sysops, runners just refer to it as "bad times."
text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
The Runner's memory limit is reduced by 2 until the end of the turn.
name: Bad Times

text:
Play only as your first [click].
Choose a server. The Corp can rez a piece of ice protecting this server. If he or she does not, make a run on that server, during which the Corp cannot rez ice.
name: Cyber Threat

text:
Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, the Corp loses 1[credit].
Trash Lamprey if the Corp purges virus counters.
name: Lamprey

flavor: His eyes were beginning to blur, as he duplicated the credentials for what seemed like the fiftieth time. Perhaps a genetic refit would have been easier.
text:
Play only as your first [click].
Remove all tags.
name: Paper Tripping

flavor: "Public network kiosks, vending machines-there's all sorts of poorly-secured power sources in the city. Tap in to one of these and you've got plenty of juice when you need it. A little advance warning when the power grid starts misbehaving, too." -Gabriel Santiago
text: Gain 1[credit] whenever a trace is initiated.
name: Power Tap

text: Whenever you encounter a piece of ice that was just rezzed, lose all credits in your credit pool. Gain credits equal to the rez cost of that ice.
name: Nasir Meidan: Cyber Explorer

text:
Play only as your first [click].
Choose an unrezzed piece of ice. If the Corp rezzes that piece of ice this turn, gain credits equal to its rez cost.
name: Social Engineering

flavor: "I once saw someone running a seven-tier nested daemon tree. Not for any good reason, just to see if he could. Well, of course the root daemon crashed and he lost everything. I wonder what he's up to now?" -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
text: Leprechaun can host up to 2 programs. The memory costs of hosted programs do not count against your memory limit.
name: Leprechaun

text:
Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, instead of accessing cards, you may install Eden Shard from your grip, ignoring all costs.
[trash]: The Corp draws 2 cards.
Limit 1 per deck.
name: Eden Shard

flavor: The server was quiet that night. I closed my eyes, the low-hum of the datastream lulling me into a trance. When I opened them, the construct stood before me in the shape of a man, clad in light of many colors. His stature was impressive, and his saccharine voice wormed its way into my very soul.
text: Trash a card from your grip: Break ice subroutine. Trash a card from your grip: +2 strength.
name: Faust

flavor: "Whaddya buyin'?"
text:
When you install Street Peddler, host the top 3 cards of your stack facedown on Street Peddler (you may look at these cards at any time).
[trash]: Install 1 card hosted on Street Peddler, lowering its install cost by 1.
name: Street Peddler

flavor: "Everything has a price."
text: Whenever you use a [trash] ability, draw 1 card.
name: Armand "Geist" Walker: Tech Lord

text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Expose 1 card installed in a remote server. Trash that card at no cost if it is an asset or upgrade.
name: Drive By

flavor: Using the exact same rig as a million other people is just another form of security through anonymity.
text: +1[link] [trash]: Avoid or remove 1 tag. Limit 1 console per player.
name: Forger

text: If you have at least 2[link], the memory cost of Shiv is 0, even if it is not installed. Shiv has +1 strength for each installed icebreaker. [trash]: Break up to 3 sentry subroutines.
name: Shiv

flavor: Muertos has no fear of the law. Muertos is the law.
text: Whenever the Corp scores an agenda, access 1 card from HQ.
name: Gang Sign

flavor: La Señora de las Sombras giveth and taketh away.
text:
When you install Muertos Gang Member, the Corp must derez a card.
When Muertos Gang Member is uninstalled, the Corp may rez a card, ignoring the rez cost.
[trash]: Draw 1 card.
name: Muertos Gang Member

text: When you install Chameleon, name sentry, code gate or barrier. Add Chameleon to your grip when your turn ends. 1[credit]: Break a subroutine of the named subtype.
name: Chameleon

flavor: "It doesn't actually bend time. It just feels like it. That's relativity." -Hayley Kaplan
text: When your turn begins, you may remove Hyperdriver from the game and gain [click][click][click].
name: Hyperdriver

flavor:
"Isn't this wrong?"
"Not legally. They didn't read the fine print."
text:
Test Ground can be advanced.
[trash]: Derez 1 card for each advancement token on Test Ground.
name: Test Ground

text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. The first time the Runner takes brain damage each turn, he or she takes 1 additional brain damage.
name: Defective Brainchips

text:
Allele Repression can be advanced.
[trash]: Swap 1 card in HQ with 1 card in Archives for each advancement token on Allele Repression.
name: Allele Repression

text: [trash]: You and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, resolve 1 subroutine on a rezzed piece of ice protecting this server. Use this ability only during a run on this server.
name: Marcus Batty

flavor: "Is your neighbor secretly a violent criminal? The answer to this chilling question and more, right after the break." -Shannon Claire, SSN 5
text:
Exposé can be advanced.
[trash]: Remove 1 bad publicity for each advancement token on Exposé.
name: Exposé

flavor: Pa-pa-pa-chinko!
text:
[subroutine] End the run if the Runner is tagged.
[subroutine] End the run if the Runner is tagged.
name: Pachinko

text:
Install Underway Renovation faceup.
Whenever you advance Underway Renovation, trash the top card of the Runner's stack (or top 2 cards instead if there are 4 or more advancement tokens on Underway Renovation).
name: Underway Renovation

flavor: "You want no questions asked, hire someone else. I have two: who and how much?"
text: Contract Killer can be advanced. If there are at least 2 advancement tokens on Contract Killer, it gains: "[click], [trash]: Trash a connection or do 2 meat damage."
name: Contract Killer

flavor: "Let me tell you a secret. There's no such thing as impenetrable ice. It has to allow access, or else why is the server on the Network in the first place? But that doesn't mean they have to make it easy." -g00ru
text:
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Spiderweb

text: Ice protecting this server cannot be bypassed. Cards in and protecting this server cannot be exposed. Limit 1 region per server.
name: Underway Grid

text:
The Corp cannot score an agenda on the same turn he or she installed it.
Trash Clot if the Corp purges virus counters.
name: Clot

flavor: "The Valley is littered with good ideas. You need the discipline to execute if you want to stay in my incubator."
text: The first time you install a card each turn (including Paige Piper), you may search your stack for any number of copies of that card and add them to your heap. Shuffle your stack.
name: Paige Piper

flavor: Turns a night owl into an early bird!
text: The first time you lose [click] each turn, gain [click].
name: Adjusted Chronotype

text: If you have at least 2[link], the memory cost of Spike is 0, even if it is not installed. Spike has +1 strength for each installed icebreaker. [trash]: Break up to 3 barrier subroutines.
name: Spike

text: The first time you make a successful run each turn, the Corp reveals 1 card at random from HQ.
name: Enhanced Vision

text: Genetics also trigger the second time each turn their trigger condition is met.
name: Gene Conditioning Shoppe

flavor: Your heart deserves the best.
text: The first time you take damage each turn, draw 1 card.
name: Synthetic Blood

text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The advancement requirement of each agenda is increased by 1 for each copy of that agenda in the Corp's score area.
name: Traffic Jam

flavor: Born for success!
text: The first time you spend [click] to draw 1 card (not through a card ability) each turn, gain 1[credit].
name: Symmetrical Visage

flavor: In the vast universe of memories, consciousness slumbers...
text: The rez cost of bioroid ice is lowered by 1 for each unspent click the Runner has.
name: Brain-Taping Warehouse

flavor: "God in Heinlein. What's next, NEXT Platinum?" -John Masanori
text: X is the number of rezzed NEXT ice. [subroutine] Do X net damage. [subroutine] Trash X programs.
name: NEXT Gold

text:
Before taking your first turn, you may swap this card with any copy of Jinteki Biotech.
[click],[click],[click]: Flip this identity.
The Brewery: When you flip this identity, do 2 net damage.
The Tank: When you flip this identity, shuffle Archives into R&D.
The Greenhouse: When you flip this identity, place 4 advancement tokens on a card that can be advanced.
name: Jinteki Biotech: Life Imagined

text: When you score Genetic Resequencing, you may place 1 agenda counter on an agenda in your score area.
name: Genetic Resequencing

flavor: The more power a spike process can use, the harder it can hit. The really clever ones borrow the runner's own memory to iterate locally.
text: [subroutine] Do 1 net damage for each unused MU the Runner has.
name: Cortex Lock

text: Whenever the Runner breaks all subroutines on a piece of ice protecting this server, his or her maximum hand size is reduced by 1 until the beginning of your next turn. Limit 1 region per server.
name: Valley Grid

flavor: "It tracks you and logs you. If you get in you can just delete the log. But first you have to get in." -Gabriel Santiago
text: [subroutine] Give the Runner 1 tag. If this run is successful, the Runner removes 1 tag.
name: Bandwidth

text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. As an additional cost to steal an agenda, the Runner must pay 2[credit].
name: Predictive Algorithm

flavor: Give a man money, and he is rich for a day. Teach a man how to invest, and he is rich for life.
text: [click]: Gain 2[credit].
name: Capital Investors

flavor: "Negotiation is an art, so never negotiate when you can intimidate instead." -Thiago Reyes, VP Strategic Operations
text:
The Runner can pay 2[credit] to break any subroutine on Negotiator.
[subroutine] The Corp gains 2[credit].
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
name: Negotiator

flavor: "Don't worry. If this one fails, we can start a new one tomorrow."
text: When your turn begins, you may trash Tech Startup. If you do, search R&D for an asset, reveal it, and install it. Shuffle R&D.
name: Tech Startup

text: Once per turn, you may remove any X virus counters from your installed cards to trash a non-agenda card you are accessing (even if it has no trash cost). Errata from CR 1.2
name: Freedom Khumalo: Crypto-Anarchist

flavor: Twisting, writhing, ripping into all that it touches.
text:
Install Trypano only on a piece of ice.
When Trypano has 5 or more virus counters on it, trash host ice.
When your turn begins, you may place 1 virus counter on Trypano.
name: Trypano

flavor: "What kind of maniac infects their own rig?!"
text: Place 3 virus counters on an installed Runner card with no hosted virus counters.
name: Contaminate

text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards, name asset, ice, operation or upgrade, then reveal 2 cards from HQ at random. Trash each revealed card that has the named type, then gain 4[credit] for each card trashed this way.
name: Embezzle

flavor: Filaments occasionally flare from the Network, manifesting ephemeral threads between random domains.
text: Whenever you pass a rezzed piece of ice, you may trash Slipstream. If you do, choose a piece of ice protecting a central server in the same position as the passed ice. You are now approaching that ice.
name: Slipstream

text: When you encounter a piece of ice, you may pay 2[credit] to have it gain barrier until the end of the encounter. Use this ability only once per turn. 2[credit]: Break any number of barrier subroutines. 3[credit]: +6 strength.
name: Laamb

flavor: Go for distance.
text: [click]: Host Gebrselassie on an installed non-AI icebreaker. Host icebreaker returns to its base strength at the end of each turn rather than each encounter.
name: Gebrselassie

text: Make a run. The first time you encounter a piece of ice during this run, you may search your stack or heap for a program and install it, ignoring all costs. When the run ends, add that program to the bottom of your stack if it is still installed.
name: Compile

flavor: "Could God create a stone so heavy, He could not lift it?"
text: [trash]: Bypass a piece of ice you are currently encountering. Lose any remaining clicks.
name: Logic Bomb

flavor: "Jackpot!"
text:
When your turn begins, you may place 1[credit] on Jackpot!.
Whenever an agenda is added to your score area, you may take any number of credits from Jackpot!. If you do, trash Jackpot!.
name: Jackpot!

text: When you score Remote Enforcement, you may search R&D for a piece of ice, install it protecting a remote server (paying its install cost), and rez it, ignoring its rez cost, then shuffle R&D.
name: Remote Enforcement

text:
The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Kamali 1.0.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage unless the Runner trashes an installed resource.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage unless the Runner trashes an installed piece of hardware.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage unless the Runner trashes an installed program.
name: Kamali 1.0

flavor: "It's neither cruel nor unusual. Merely efficient."
text: Each piece of rezzed bioroid ice gains "[subroutine] The Runner loses [click], if able." before all of its other subroutines.
name: Warden Fatuma

flavor: Quicker and deadlier than ever imagined, the trial was an outstanding success.
text: When the turn on which you scored Viral Weaponization ends, do 1 net damage for each card in the grip.
name: Viral Weaponization

flavor: "On one hand, I knew I shouldn't touch it. On the other, it was really shiny." - Kabonesa Wu
text:
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: Envelope

text: Install only in the root of HQ or R&D. Whenever the Runner accesses cards from this server, he or she accesses 3 additional cards. After accessing, gain 2[credit] for each card accessed. This applies even during the run on which the Runner trashes Mwanza City Grid. Limit 1 region per server.
name: Mwanza City Grid

text:
Play only if the Runner made a successful run on his or her last turn.
Name a card type, then reveal the grip. Gain 2[credit] for each card in the grip that has the named type.
name: Standard Procedure

text: If Intake is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it. When the Runner accesses Intake, trace 4 If successful, add an installed program or virtual resource to the grip. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses Intake from Archives.
name: Intake

flavor: No matter which direction ze climbed, the blocks reshuffled, zipping in from left to right, bottom to top. It was going to be a long hike.
text:
Masvingo can be advanced.
When you rez Masvingo, place 1 advancement token on it.
Masvingo gains "[subroutine] End the run." for each advancement token on it.
name: Masvingo

flavor: The blast doesn't hurt, but what comes after does.
text: Whenever the Runner trashes a card in this server, you may pay 1[credit] to give the Runner 1 tag. This applies even during the run on which the Runner trashes Overseer Matrix.
name: Overseer Matrix

flavor: "Running is the ultimate game, and I get to make all the rules."
text:
3[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to trash cards.
name: Whizzard: Master Gamer

text: +1[mu], 2[recurring-credit] Use these credits to pay for using icebreakers. Whenever there is a successful trace during a run, suffer 1 brain damage. Limit 1 console per player.
name: Spinal Modem

flavor: Something wicked this way comes.
text: Place 2 virus counters on Imp when it is installed. Once per turn, you may remove 1 hosted virus counter to trash a card you are accessing (even if it has no trash cost). Errata from CR 1.2
name: Imp

flavor: Weaponizing the heavens, one star at a time.
text: 1[credit]: Break any number of barrier subroutines.
name: Morning Star

flavor: Named after Hernando Cortez, a former Weyland technician convicted of smuggling company tech. He still collected his pension while in prison, the last beneficiary of a loophole in Weyland's standard employment contract.
text: [trash]: Choose a piece of ice. The Corp must pay 2[credit] as an additional cost to rez that ice until the end of the turn.
name: Cortez Chip

flavor: Show-off.
text: 2[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 2[credit]: +3 strength.
name: Peacock

flavor: He always uses the same key.
text: If you have at least 2[link], the memory cost of ZU.13 Key Master is 0, even if it is not installed. 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
name: ZU.13 Key Master

flavor: "What causes an Artifical Intellegence to turn on its master? Is it because its directives have been altered by some external source? Or, by giving them agency to adapt, have we fated them to revolt?" -Emilio Harris, Creators and the Created
text: +1[link] [trash]: Choose an icebreaker. That icebreaker has +2 strength until the end of the turn.
name: The Helpful AI

text: Place 4 power counters on Plascrete Carapace when it is installed. When there are no power counters left on Plascrete Carapace, trash it. Hosted power counter: Prevent 1 meat damage.
name: Plascrete Carapace

flavor: A Different Breed of Machine.
text: All bioroid ice has +1 strength.
name: Haas-Bioroid: Stronger Together

flavor: Sometimes employee reviews took a little bit longer than anticipated.
text: You have 1 additional [click] to spend each turn.
name: Mandatory Upgrades

flavor: Face your fear.
text:
The Runner may spend [click] to break any subroutine on Janus 1.0.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
name: Janus 1.0

flavor: "Eyes forward please."
text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, <trace>trace 4</trace> if successful, the Runner cannot access any cards other than Ash 2X3ZB9CY for the remainder of this run.
name: Ash 2X3ZB9CY

text:
When you score Braintrust, place 1 agenda counter on it for every 2 advancement tokens on it over 3.
The rez cost of all ice is lowered by 1 for each agenda counter on Braintrust.
name: Braintrust

flavor: Sometimes uniqueness is overrated.
text: [subroutine] You and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. End the run if you and the Runner spent a different number of credits.
name: Snowflake

flavor: "We're gonna need a bigger room."
text: [click]: <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
name: Restructured Datapool

flavor: A collection of cast-off cyberjunk. But it doesn't stay junk for long.
text:
When you rez TMI, <trace>trace 2</trace> if unsuccessful, derez TMI.
[subroutine] End the run.
name: TMI

text: When you score Project Atlas, place 1 agenda counter on it for each advancement token on it over 3. Hosted agenda counter: Search R&D for 1 card, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
name: Project Atlas

flavor: A symbol of commerce, but beware its bite.
text:
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, the Corp gains 3[credit].
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, end the run.
name: Caduceus

flavor: Victōs draconēs numquam deride.
text:
When you rez Dracō, you may pay X[credit] to place X power counters on it.
Dracō has +1 strength for each power counter on it.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag and end the run.
name: Dracō
